loans.name: Dúo Flor Xesujence Group

texts.es: Dúo Flor Xesujence: Ana Maria es originaria de paraje San Francisco San Martin Jilotepeque, es una mujer muy trabajadora ya que ella se dedica a la elaboración de tejidos típicos a mano de esta forma es como ella ayuda con los gastos de su hogar, está solicitando este crédito para la compra de materia prima para la elaboración de tejidos típicos a mano, ella esta espera que y confía  en que kiva a través de fape le pueda ayudar para poder invertir más en su negocio.
texts.en:
Dúo Flor Xesujence: 

Ana Maria is a native of San Francisco, San Martin Jilotepeque. She is a very hard-working woman and she makes a living in hand weaving traditional fabrics. This is how she helps with the expenses in her household.

She is requesting this loan to purchase raw material for the production of traditional handmade fabrics.  She expects and hopes that, through FAPE, Kiva can help her invest more in her business.

loans.use: to purchase raw material for the production of traditional handmade fabrics.

loans.name: Jumaa

texts.en:
Jumaa is married, has three children, two in school, and lives in the Kongowea area of Coast province, Kenya. He owns a retail shop which he has been operating for two years. In this shop, Jumaa sells assorted retail products. Besides this, he also keeps domesticated animals.
He learned about Milango through a friend with an aim of accessing credit to improve the business operations. The challenge he is facing is bad debts.
Jumaa is applying for a loan of 15,850 Kenya shillings to buy another domesticated animal. The extra income from the loan will be added to his savings to improve the living standard of his family.

loans.use: to buy another domesticated animal.

loans.name: Bernard

texts.en:
Bernard is a resident of Kongowea in the Coast Province, Kenya. He is a father of two children. Bernard has been operating a food stall for nine months. In this business, he basically sells coffee. Besides this, he also works as a painting contractor.
He learned about Milango through an employee and aims to access credit to improve the operations of his business. His main challenge is some customers not paying on time and insecurity.
Bernard is applying for a loan of 10,650 Kenya shillings to purchase additional stocks of food to go with his coffee sales. The extra income from the loan will be added to his savings to improve his living standard. He aspires to open a hotel in future.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock for his food stall.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma lives in the coastal town of Mariakani, Kenya. She has one child and runs a motorcycle spare parts shop. Emma started the business from the little savings she had. The desire for increased credit led her to join Milango.
She is applying for a loan of 41,850 Kenya shillings to purchase more motorcycle spare parts. The motorcycle business has been rising in the area and the related damages warrant a business dealing in spares.
Emma believes the business has a bright future and has not ruled out hiring or acquiring the training in the area to improve her prospects. This business faces the challenge from inflation within the country and that has reduced the purchasing power of most customers.The additional income from this business will also help her plan for emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase motorcycle spare parts.

loans.name: Mugambi

texts.en:
Mugambi is a married man who lives in Kongowea, Kenya and is an events manager. He began the business five years ago. His main duties are to work with event organizers of weddings, promotions, conferences etc., to plan out logistics for such events and follow through till they are completed. He specializes in decorations and interior designs. 
He is applying for a loan of 21,050 Kenya shillings to purchase curtains and tents. Mugambi was introduced to Milango by his friend and decided to join in order to access credit. Mugambi’s main challenges come when events are cancelled at the last minute and slow seasons. Mugambi looks forward to establish and make his business known.   
He will reinvest the extra income obtained to expand operations.

loans.use: to purchase curtains and tents.

loans.name: Riziki

texts.en:
Riziki is married, has seven children attending school and is a resident of Likoni of Coast province, Kenya. Riziki owns a food cafe, a business that she has been in operating for four years. She also sells water to the residents around her.
She learned about Milango through an employee and aims to access credit to improve the operations of her business. Her main challenge is bad debts.
Riziki is applying for a loan of 32,550 Kenya shillings to purchase items such as flour, sugar, cereals and cooking oil. She would use part of the loan to pay school fees. The extra income from the loan will be added to her savings to improve on the living standard of the family, build a shelter for the family and pay school fees for the children. She aspires to open a retail shop.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, cereals and cooking oil for her cafe and to pay school fees.

loans.name: Maribel Leonor

texts.es:
MARIBEL LEONOR tiene 38 años de edad de estado civil unión libre tiene dos hijos, vive con el esposo y con el hijo en la ciudad de Ventanas Provincia de los ríos.

Es integrante de la VRC 16 DE AGOSTO, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Agua de Mocache, pertenece al Cantón Mocache se dedican a labores agrícolas y pecuarias.

MARIBEL LEONOR se dedica a la agricultura y a la crianza de animales. Solicita el crédito para comprar semillas, insecticidas, urea, liquido para la maleza, ranger.

Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar los fertilizantes para los cultivos. Las compras las hará en la ciudad de Ventanas y en Mocache. 

El sueño es terminar de construir la casa. Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta son las plagas en los sembríos la langosta.
En el tiempo libre le gusta hacer los quehaceres del hogar.
texts.en:
Maribel Leonor is 38 years old, has two children, and lives in a common law marriage with her husband and son in the city of Ventanas Provincia de Los Ríos.

She is a member of the VRC 16 de Agosto, which is located in the precinct of Agua de Mocache, which is part of the Mocache District where the residents work as a farmers and raise livestock. 

Maribel Leonor works as a farmer and raises animals. She seeks the loan to buy seeds, insecticides, urea (fertilizer) and liquid for the underbrush. 

With the assistance from the loan she will be able to buy fertilizers for the crops. She will make the purchases in the city of Ventanas and in Mocache. 

Her dream is to complete the construction of her home. The challenges she faces are the plagues of locusts in the crops. 

In her free time she likes to do the chores around the house.

loans.use: to buy seeds, insecticides, urea (fertilizer) and liquid for the underbrush.

loans.name: Matu

texts.en:
Matu is 27 and single, with a 10-year-old child who is in school. She has been selling door locks, hinges, nails and paint brushes for the past five years. She learned to sell from a friend of hers. She makes a profit when she sells because of the good interactions she has with her customers.

Matu sells in the open square of a market and so she faces difficulty during the raining season. She has requested this loan to purchase more paint brushes, nails and door locks for her business, and to find a suitable place in the market for her business.

Her plan for the future is to educate her child.

loans.use: to purchase more paint brushes, nails and door locks for her business,

loans.name: Sophia

texts.en:
Sophia is a fishmonger living in Mariakani, Kenya. She is a single mother of three children. 

Fish is among the staple foods among the residents living around Sophia. She has been operating her business six years. Sophia started from a limited stock of fish and has seen her capital grow with time. She obtained the money to start the business from an informal savings scheme called "merry go round," which is a method where people contribute and lend out the money in turns. She also owns some rental houses.

Sophia joined Milango this year and is applying for a loan of KES 41,850 to renovate her rental houses to attract tenants. 
The extra income will also form part of Sophia’s future savings.  Her challenge currently is the high cost of transport.

loans.use: To renovate the rental houses to attract tenants.

loans.name: Teofilo

texts.en:
Teofilo is married, with three children.  He is 76 years old and lives in Sinonoc, Sinacaban.

Teofilo is a farmer who grows coconut crops to earn a living.  He has been doing this for 20 years.

Teofilo has requested a loan to purchase additional fertilizers, such as inorganic and commercial.  He has been a member of PMPC for three years. In the future, Teofilo hopes to save in case of emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as inorganic and commercial.

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita is 47 years old and married. She lives in Imelda, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte.

Rosita owns a general store to earn a living, and she has had this business for two years. Each month, she earns PHP 5,000 doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of PHP 13,000 to purchase more stocks for her general store.

Rosita has been a member of PMPC for two years. In the future, Rosita hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks for her general store.

loans.name: Mamie

texts.en: This is Mamie. She is 43 years old, married and has two children aged 22 and 19 years old. She also has an additional dependent living with her. In 1991, Mamie established her local food stuff (palm oil) and garri business. She started her business because she wants to be able to take good care of her family. Working seven days a week and ten hours a day, she earns about Le 800,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of Le 5,000,000 in order to buy large quantities of palm oil and bags of garri. In the future Mamie plans to give quality education to her children, and build houses which will save her from paying a huge amount of rent to house owners. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more rubbers of palm oil (e.g. 150 to 200)

loans.name: Najlah

texts.en:
Najlah is a conservative mother and asked her son to take her place in the photo.
Najlah is 47 years old, a wife and mother of five. She has three sons who help her and their father with the family business selling junk at their own junkyard to factories that recycle. She is hoping to get a loan so they can open a new store to sell junk in and increase their market and profits.

loans.use: to open a new store to sell junk

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Lorina

texts.en:
Lorina is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a food production business in the Philippines. 

She is requesting a loan of PHP 25,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

NWTF is relisting Lorina's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: To buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Khaled

texts.en:
Khaled is from Iraq. He is 42 years old, married, and has four children. He is the only provider for the family.

Khaled owns a big generator and he provides his neighborhood with electricity. He established his business in 2009 and now has one employee. He has experience in this field and has built a good reputation for himself in his local community.

Khaled is requesting a $3000 loan to buy a new engine for his generator. He is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so that he will be able to provide better living conditions for his family.

loans.use: to buy a new engine for his generator.

loans.name: Elvencito

texts.en:
Elvencito is a 49-year-old single man, and he lives in the Philippines.

Elvencito operates a service-based business, providing transportation services to local community members to earn a living. He has been doing this for 4 years, and every month he earns 4,000 PHP from this work. He has requested a loan of 3,000 PHP to repair his existing vehicle for better service.

Elvencito is a new member of GDMPC. In the future, Elvencito hopes to double the income from his business.

loans.use: to repair an existing vehicle for better service

loans.name: Bayarjavhlan

texts.en:
Mr. Bayarjavhlan is 20 years old and lives with his wife and mother in a ger, the traditional Mongolian nomadic tent, in Dornogovi province. 

Bayarjavhlan has been running a taxi service business since 2011, which his wife helps with. His daily income is 45,000 MNT, however his profit (300,000 MNT per month) cannot cover his family's expenses. Therefore, his wife has decided to start a business selling clothes. She plans to rent a counter in a trading center and import the goods from China. Her sister has experience in this type of business, so Bayarjavhlan and his wife will consult with her for advice on how to manage their new business.

They are requesting a 2,500,000 MNT loan to invest in starting this business and plan to use the profits to build a new house.

loans.use: to invest in starting a clothing business.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy bed sheets to resell

loans.name: Tumema

texts.en:
Tumema is 47 years old and is married with 7 children. She has a small garden where she grows taro, bananas, and yams so that she can sell them in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for 5 years. Tumema needs a loan to buy another wheelbarrow, a shovel, a rake, some bush-knives, weedkiller spray and more tiapula. 
She has been a member of SPBD since 2010, and she joined to gain access to financial stability. Tumema will use the profits from her sales to improve her family's assets.

loans.use: to buy a wheelbarrow, bush knives, weedkiller spray and other tools.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy a lathe machine

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy wood to make and sell wooden vessels

loans.name: Charlene

texts.en:
Charlene is from Sangay Diot, Ozamis City. She is 32 years old, married and has 3 children. Charlene has been cultivating bananas and coconuts to earn a living for 5 years and gains 8,000 PHP a month.

In 2007, Charlene joined GDMPC. Charlene is requesting a loan of 16,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to make improvements to her house.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise

loans.name: Fozia's Group

texts.en: Fozia is a 29-year-old, hard working and independent woman. She is living in Punjab, Pakistan, with her husband and son, who is studying in third class. Fozia's husband is an auto mechanic. His income is not enough to meet the household expenses. Since 2003, Fozia has been running a beauty salon and she wants to purchase some more cosmetic products and chairs for her beauty salon. For that reason, as a member of a nine-person lending group, she has requested a loan from Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan. With her profits, she will first repay the loan amount to Kiva and then she wants to build a new room in the salon, as the current space in the salon is too congested. She hopes for her daughter's bright future. Note: In the picture, Fozia is carrying a passbook in her hand.

loans.use: To purchase cosmetic products and chairs for her beauty salon.

loans.name: Kiden

texts.en:
Kiden is a 36-year-old businesswoman who lives in Juba. She is married and has four children between the ages of four and 12. All of them go to school.

Kiden runs a general store and has been in business for three years. She has no employees. She heard about Finance Sudan through other clients. She is taking a loan of 2000 SDG to purchase beans, cow peas and other items. Beyond this business, she has no other source of income.

In five years, Kiden would like to expand her business. Her major challenges include high prices in the market.

Kiden says she is happy for the loans given by Finance Sudan through the help of Kiva.

loans.use: To buy items like cow peas, beans, maize, etc.

loans.name: Nelson

texts.en:
Nelson is 27 years old, single, and has no dependents.  He is in the garbage collection business. He started this business six years ago and earns a monthly income of KES 10,000. 


He has requested for a first loan of KES 30,000 to purchase bins for collecting garbage and to hire trucks for transporting garbage. 

The profit he makes will contribute towards him buying a truck of his own to facilitate this business. He hopes to prosper in whatever he does.

loans.use: To purchase dustbins for collecting garbage and to hire trucks for transporting garbage.

loans.name: Nimer

texts.en:
Nimer is a 52-year-old married man and the father of five children. He has been working as a mechanic since 1990 with 22 years of experience in this field. Nimer's honesty, experience, and wide talent in this domain have provided him with his customers' support and loyalty. He hopes to keep on improving his business and to retain his present customers.   

Nimer is applying for a loan from Kiva's partner, Al Majmoua, in order to pay for his children's tuition fees. This is Nimer's first loan cycle as an Al Majmoua borrower: he believes that this loan will help him a lot in providing his children with the necessary education.

loans.use: to pay for his children's tuition fees

loans.name: Maria Luisa

texts.es:
La señora María es una de las tantas madres solteras que existen, pero bien responsable y Idealista en cuanto a las mejoras de su  nivel de vida, de profesión maestra de educación primaria, imparte el pan de la enseñanza en un colegio del departamento de león, viaja de su casa de habitación a su centro de trabajo,   su núcleo familiar está compuesto por ella y su hijo.
una de las necesidades que tiene en este momento es la de seguir mejorando su casa la que está en regular estado, mediante las mejoras mismas que le ha efectuado atravez de los financiamientos recibido en ceprodel,  ya que este   crédito lo esta solicitando para utilizrlo en la compra de Bloques, Hierro, Arena, Piedrín, Cemento, Ventanas de Vidrio y Mano de Obra, por eso visito las oficinas para ser beneficiada.
texts.en:
María is one of the many single mothers who exist, but are very responsible and idealistic regarding making improvements to their standard of living. She is employed as an elementary school teacher. She imparts the gift of teaching in a school in the district of León. She travels from her home to her workplace. Her nuclear family is composed of her and her son.

One of the needs that she has at this moment is to continue improving her house which is in fair condition through the same improvements that she performed by means of financing she received from Ceprodel. She is seeking this loan to use it to buy bricks, iron, sand, stones, cement, glass windows and manual labor. For this reason she visited the offices to become a beneficiary.

loans.use: to buy bricks, iron, sand, stones, cement, glass windows, manual labor and repairs to a wall in the house and a glass window.

loans.name: Misbha

texts.en:
Misbha is a 37-year-old married woman and a mother of five. She is a courageous lady as she opened a beauty parlor four years ago in a small corner of her two-room house in order to fight poverty. She and her daughter work hard day and night to make the parlor famous so they may be able to provide for her family. Misbha works tirelessly to keep the business running because she plays a vital role in supporting her family. Her husband is employed in a factory and is paid less than the family's expenses. Now she has gained popularity in her community and has a good client list. 

Currently, Misbha requested a loan of Rs 40,000 to buy some furniture and tools, such as hair dryers, rollers and streamers, to allow her to cater to many customers at a time. She is hopeful to earn more through her larger investment in her parlor. She wishes to provide a better life for her family and quality education for her children.

loans.use: to buy furniture and tools for her hair salon

loans.name: Genesis Lisette

texts.es: Génesis tiene 19 años estado civil soltera. Ella cuenta que desde muy joven comenzó a comercializar ropa a  todas sus amigas y después a toda la gente de su barrio  con la ayuda de su mama que le  prestó el dinero para que compre toda la mercadería ella sale a trabajar todas las tardes uno de sus peores impedimentos es la delincuencia del sector pero Génesis dice que nada ni nada le va a impedir lo que ella quiere para su vida. Con el préstamo ella quiere comprar más mercadería como: blusa, falda, vestidos
texts.en: Génesis is 19 years old and she is single. She says that she has started selling clothes to all her female friends since she was very young; then she has begun selling clothes to all the people of her neighborhood thanks to her mother’s help, who has lent her the money to buy the products. She works every evening, and crime in her area is the worst hindrances she has to face, but Génesis says that nothing will ever stop her from achieving what she has planned for her life. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy more products such as blouses, skirts and dresses.

loans.use: To buy blouses, skirts and dresses

loans.name: Mujeres En Accion Group

texts.es:
El presente comité se encuentra, en su décimo  noveno  ciclo es un comité ejemplar, que trabaja y se esfuerza mucho por salir adelante. Todas ellas son amigas y vecinas que se esfuerzan por mejorar y salir adelante.
Nilda es modista y comenta que hace muy buenos trabajos, ella gracias a su dedicación y esfuerzo esta saliendo adelante y por medio de su trabajo ayuda a su familia.
Solicita el préstamo para la compra de telas, con lo cual podrá hacer prendas que tiene como pedidos. Nilda cuenta que su sueño es poder seguir creciendo y también poder dar trabajo a otras personas.
texts.en:
This group, now on their nineteenth loan cycle, is an exemplary group of people who work hard and put in a lot of effort to get ahead. They are all friends and neighbours who strive to improve and stay afloat. 

Nilda is a dressmaker. She says that she does very good work, that she is getting ahead thanks to her dedication and effort, and that she is helping her family by working. She is requesting this loan so she can buy fabric, with which she will be able to make garments to order.

Nilda says her dream is to be able to continue expanding and to be able to offer work to other people.

loans.use: to buy fabric for making garments.

loans.name: Edelita

texts.en:
Edelita is 36 years old and lives in Maikay, Tudela. She is married with 2 children. Edelita is an Avon dealer and sells different Avon products. She has had this business for 4 years.  

Edelita requested a loan of 14900 PHP to purchase additional Avon products. Edelita has been a member of PMPC for 2 years.  In the future, Edelita hopes to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase additional Avon products

loans.name: Hanan

texts.en:
Due to cultural reasons, Hanan prefers that her photo is not on the Internet. Thus, the above photo is of her husband.

Hanan is a 24-year-old married female from Al Hashmi in Jordan. She has a child and has requested a 700 JOD loan to help pay for her home improvement and painting expenses. In the future, she would like to improve living conditions for her family.

Since Hanan is under 30 years old, her loan is considered a youth loan.

loans.use: to pay for her home improvement expenses.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy paper and gum for a business of making and selling paper envelopes

loans.name: Mejumaa

texts.en:
Mejumaa is a married woman who is in her mid-30s. She is a visionary woman who finds opportunities to progress in life. For the last two years, Mejumaa has been running a food stall where she sells different types of African dishes.
Her business is located in a strategic place along a busy street of the suburban city of Likoni. Her aim is to continue offering quality services and all of the dishes her customers will request. The main challenge is a lack of enough capital to meet her goals. For this reason, she is asking for a loan to buy ingredients like wheat flour, rice, beans, meat, oil, and cooking oil.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like wheat flour, rice, beans, meat, oil,and cooking oil.

loans.name: Jenny

texts.en: Jenny is determined to overcome poverty by expanding her pig-raising business so that she can earn more money and continue to pay the cost of keeping her three children in school. She has been in this business for almost six years and spends most of the money she earns on food, clothing and allowances for her children. To improve her business and increase her earnings, Jenny is asking for a loan for PHP 9,000 to buy the feed, medicine and vitamins she needs to continue her business.

loans.use: to buy feed, medicine and vitamins to use in her livestock business.

loans.name: Arturo

texts.es:
El señor Arturo actualmente es pensionado por una compañía petrolera con la cual puede solventar sus gastos y los de su esposa, el señor Arturo desea hacer el cambio de la instalación eléctrica de su vivienda ya que se encuentra desgastado por el paso del tiempo y quiere evitar accidente en su casa.
Solicita el préstamo para comprar el material y pagarle ala persona que se encargara de realizar la mejora.
Desea mejorar el patrimonio y la seguridad de su familia. 
Con una parte de la pensión que recibe pagara el préstamo
texts.en: Arturo is currently a pensioner of a petroleum company through which he can pay for his expenses and the expenses of his wife. Arturo desires to make a change to the electricity installation in his house now that it is worn out by the passing of time and he wants to avoid an accident in his home. He seeks the loan to buy the material and to pay an individual that he will put in charge of making the improvements. He desires to improve the heritage and security of his family. With a portion of the pension that he receives, he will pay for the loan.

loans.use: to install electric cables.

loans.name: Thomas

texts.en:
Thomas lives in the Kongowea area of Coast Province, Kenya. He is married and has one child. He owns a cafe that sells french fries, which he has been operating for two years. He also sells firewood. In addition, Thomas owns a motorcycle which provides transportation in the area.

He heard about Milango through friends who invited him to the group. He joined with the aim of accessing credit to improve his business operations. His main challenges are debts and high transportation and fuel costs.

Thomas is applying for a loan of 21,100 Kenyan shillings to buy potatoes for his business and firewood to sell. His extra income from the loan will be added to his savings to pay school fees for his child and to improve his standard of living. His dream is to open another cafe.

loans.use: To buy potatoes for his cafe and firewood to sell.

loans.name: Remelita

texts.en: Remelita knows that operating a business requires determination and hard work, and is committed to the success of her hog-raising business. Her goal is to increase her family's income by borrowing PHP 7,000 to buy vitamins and feed for her livestock. Securing this loan will help her achieve her dreams for her family and for the future.

loans.use: to buy vitamins and feed for her hogs.

loans.name: Myagmarsuren

texts.en: Myagmarsuren is a 57-year-old widow who lives in an apartment in the Arkhangai province of Mongolia.  Her children are grown and live on their own. She went into the business of selling dairy products in 2000 and now runs a stable business. She is planning to go into the business of selling dairy products wholesale, and wants to accumulate enough stock to sell her products when prices are high. She is a very optimistic and hard-working woman who is requesting a loan for MNT 1,500,000 to buy more dairy products to sell to her customers.

loans.use: to buy more dairy products to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.en:
Rosalina is married, with four children.  She is 49 years old and lives in Antonino, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte.

Rosalina owns a general store to earn a living, and she has had this business for two years. Each month, she earns PHP 2,500 doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of PHP 7,000 to purchase more stock for her general store, such as shampoo, toothpaste, and beverages.

Rosalina has been a member of PMPC for two years. In the future, Rosalina hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for her general store such as shampoo, toothpaste, and beverages

location.town: Liloy - Antonino, Labason, Zamboanga Del Norte

loans.name: Maa Laxmi Group

texts.en:
The Name of this group is Maa Laxmi. It was formed in the year 2010. Its four members are women from a small rural village called Barpadar. It is situated in the district of Nuapada of Odisha, one of the poorest districts in India particularly known for drought and underdevelopment. Anadi is one of the members of this group. 

The lady sitting second from left raising her hand in the photo is Anadi. She is the Group Leader. She is 38 years old and is living with her husband, her only daughter who is eight, her two sons who are 20 & 18 and her father in-law. Anadi hails from a very poor, landless, illiterate Schedule Caste (SC) Below Poverty Line family. Anadi's community is socially, economically and educationally very backward and far from the mainstream. One will hardly find graduates in their community. Anadi resides in a small hut with her family. 

Anadi is running a business preparing and selling different items made of a rope that is made from plastic cement bags. She took over the business from her fore fathers who used to make rope from cow and buffalo skin. The items are used particularly for tightening domestic animals like cows, buffalo, sheep, goats etc, for manually extracting water from a well by using a tin bucket and other works related to cultivation. Her husband and younger son help Anadi in the total process from collection of empty cement bags from the contractors and builders, processing of string into small wires and making the plastic rope items to selling the products. They sell them in five weekly markets each week. Her family works 8-10 hours daily to make those items. Her husband procures empty cement bags at Rs 2/- per bag. In a week, she earns almost 1000-1500 INR from this business. She gets around 40% profits. Her elder son works as a salesman in a grocery shop, but in comparison to all this i.e. the labor, transporting and material costs, this is not at all cost effective. So very miserably, she manages her family. Presently, the stock she buys from her locality is not enough for her to make items for the entire week. Her husband moves frequently to collect empty bags, which is very time and energy consuming and hampers her production. She wants to have enough stock to support her business uninterrupted. The loan will be used by her to buy more stock of empty cement bags and a bicycle for her son to earn some extra income. 

Anadi dreams of building a small pucca (permanent) house for her family and for the marriage of her elder son. The other three members of her group are Rashmita, Debaki and Jasoda who are doing a similar business of making ropes.

loans.use: to purchase empty cement bags and a bicycle

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en: Evelyn makes a living by selling bananas and coconuts. She has been in this business for 14 years and is very committed to her work because this is how she supports herself. Her dream is to improve her living standards even though, at age 53, she is no longer young. As a way to improve her life, she is requesting a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy more bananas and coconuts to sell.

loans.use: to buy more bananas and coconuts to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Luis Daniel

texts.es:
LUIS DANIEL tiene 25 años de edad es soltero no tiene hijos, vive con los padres en la ciudad de ventanas Provincia de los ríos.

Es integrante de la VRC 16 DE AGOSTO, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Agua de Mocache, pertenece al Cantón Mocache se dedican a labores agrícolas y pecuarias.

LUIS DANIEL se dedica a la agricultura a crianza de animales. Solicita el crédito para comprar semillas, insecticidas, urea, liquido para la maleza, ranger.

Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar lo que le hace falta para los cultivos. Las compras las hará en la ciudad de Ventanas. 

El sueño es comprar un terreno. Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta son las enfermedades y las plagas en los cultivos.
En el tiempo libre le gusta jugar indor.
texts.en:
Luis Daniel, 25, is single and has no children.  He lives with his parents in the city of Ventanas in the province of Los Ríos.  He's a member of 16 de Agosto Communal Bank, located in the Agua de Mocache area in Mocache Canton, where people make a living in agriculture and livestock.

Luis Daniel makes a living in agriculture and raising animals.  He's requesting the loan to buy seed, insecticide, urea, liquid weedkiller, and Ranger.  With the help of the loan he'll be able to buy what he needs for his crops.  He'll make his purchases in the city of Ventanas.

His dream is to buy a plot of land.  The challenges he faces are sickness and crop pests.  In his free time he likes to play indoor soccer.

loans.use: to buy seeds, insecticide, urea, and weedkiller

loans.name: Griza

texts.en: Griza is 34 years old and lives in Lopoc, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte. She is married and the mother of two children. For the last six years, she has earned a living by catching and selling fish. She is requesting a loan for PHP 10,000 to buy more fish to sell to her customers. Griza has been a member of PMPC for one year and hopes to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Elias

texts.en:
Elias lives in Kilifi, Kenya. He is married and has three children in school. He was introduced to Milango by his friends.

Elias owns a public service vehicle--a three-wheeler--which he uses to transport people and goods in his town. He has run this business for five years. He is also employed at a local hotel as a chef. The main challenges he faces are police harassment and unpredictable fuel prices.

Elias is applying for loan of 52,300 Kenyan shillings to purchase another three-wheeler. He will use the additional income to add to his savings, improve his standard of living and educate his children. He plans to start other businesses in the future.

loans.use: To purchase another three-wheeler.

loans.name: Orlanda De Jesus

texts.es:
ORLANDA DE JESUS tiene 35 años de edad es soletar no tiene hijos, vive con la familia en la ciudad de ventanas provincia de los ríos.

Es integrante de la VRC 16 DE AGOSTO, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Agua de Mocache, pertenece al Cantón Mocache se dedican a labores agrícolas y pecuarias.

ORLANDA DE JESUS  se dedica a la agricultura y a la crianza de animales. Solicita el crédito para comprar urea, ranger, semillas, insecticidas.

Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar los fertilizantes sin ningún problema. Las compras las hará en la ciudad de Ventanas. 

El sueño es comprar terrenos para sembrar mucho más. Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta son las enfermedades o desastres naturales.
En el tiempo libre le gusta trabajar más.
texts.en:
Orlanda de Jesús, 35, is single and has no children.  She lives with her family in the city of Ventanas in Los Ríos Province.  She's a member of 16 de Agosto Communal Bank, located in the Agua de Mocache area of Mocache Canton, where the people make a living in agriculture and livestock.

Orlanda de Jesús makes a living in agriculture and raising animals.  She's requesting the loan to buy urea, Ranger, seeds, and insecticide.  With the help of the loan she'll be able to buy the fertilizer with no problem.  She'll make her purchases in the city of Ventanas.

Her dream is to buy land to grow a lot more.  The challenges she faces are illnesses and natural disasters.  In her free time she likes to work more.

loans.use: to buy urea, seed, and insecticide

loans.name: Edson

texts.es:
Edson, de 46 años de edad, es un hombre trabajador  y empeñoso, además de solidario y amable con muchos deseos de superación.  Está casado con Miguelina quien es empleada, fruto de esa unión tiene 01 hija de 17 años de edad, a la que quiere mucho, habitando juntos en su propia casa. La actividad que realiza Edson es el dar servicio de transporte de pasajeros en un mototaxi de su propiedad que se compró con el fruto de sus ahorros más un crédito particular, siendo su herramienta de trabajo y sustento de su familia.  
Iniciándose de esa manera hace más de 15 años, cuando se compró su primera unidad, y en el transcurso del tiempo fue renovando a otras unidades mientras se deterioraban por el uso cotidiano. Considera rentable su negocio por la demanda que tiene el servicio y las buenas ganancias que le deja.
Le gusta su negocio pues le permite tener un ingreso económico con el cual poder solventar sus gastos familiares, iniciándose por la necesidad de contar con un ingreso económico, ya que no podía conseguir un empleo, ahora se siente con mayor seguridad pues puede manejar sus propios tiempos, además de ser su propio jefe. Por lo contrario comenta que no le gusta cuando su mototaxi se malogra muy seguido pues le ocasiona muchos gastos, pero aun así logra ver buenas resultados, por eso tiene planes de crecer y poder comprarse un vehiculo de transporte de carga pesada. Este es el préstamo número 02 con la institución MFP, se siente agradecido por el apoyo financiero que viene recibiendo para poder alcanzar sus objetivos. Además comenta sentirse a gusto con su banco comunal pues se lleva bien con todos sus miembros a los que considera ser buenas personas. Con el monto solicitado de 1000 nuevos soles, lo invertirá en la compra de repuestos de mototaxi como llantas y accesorios, buscando de esa manera mantener operativa su vehiculo y así seguir generándose ingresos económicos.
texts.en:
Edson, 46 is a hardworking man, helpful and kind with lots of wishes to get ahead.  He is married to Miguelina who is employed, they have a 17-year-old daughter that he loves very much and lives with them at their house.  Edson's activity is transportation services in a motorbike that he owns and bought with savings and a private loan, this is his main working tool and the one that supports his family.

He started this business 15 years ago, when he bought his first bike, as time went by he fixed other units as they deteriorated due to daily use.  He considers having a profitable business due to the demand for services and the good earnings he makes.
He likes his business because it allows him to have income to cover his family expenses, he started the business out of necessity because he couldn't find a job, now he feels more security because he can plan his own time and be his own boss.  On the other hand, he doesn't like having to fix his motorbike because it generates a lot of expenses, in spite of them he has good results, that's why he has plans to grow and buy a truck to transport heavy cargo.  This is his second loan with MFP and he is thankful for the financial support that he has received to achieve his goals.  He also indicates feeling happy with the community bank because he gets along with the members and considers them good people.  The loan requested is 1000 new soles that will be invested in tires and motorbike accessories, looking this way to keep operating and generating income.

loans.use: to buy repairs for his motorcycle taxy such as tires and accesories.

loans.name: Vela Mozombite

texts.es: Waldir, de 25 años de edad, es un hombre trabajador y emprendedor con muchas ganas de sobresalir.  Es soltero sin hijos.  Vive en compañía de su padre, madre, su hermana menor, instalados cómodamente en la casa de sus padres. La actividad que realiza Waldir, es el despacho de madera, realizando ventas periódicas a la capital donde cuenta con compradores y también realizando tramites de despacho de madera a empresas, realizando estas actividades hace 02 años, paralelo a estas actividades también cuenta con un taller de mecánica de motores menores en su casa,  la cual tiene 01 año de funcionamiento. Considera rentable su negocio por las buenas ganancias que le deja. Le gusta lo que hace, pues le permite tener un ingreso económico con el cual puede pagar los gastos de su hogar y su educación. Además de ver lo rentable que le resulta trabajar con la venta de madera, tiene planes de aumentar el volumen de sus despachos y ampliar su taller de mecánica. Este es el préstamo número 02 con la institución MFP. Con el monto solicitado de 1000 nuevos soles lo invertirá en la compra de madera para los despachos que tiene pendiente por enviar; además de la compra de algunas herramientas de trabajo para su taller.
texts.en:
Waldir, 25, is a hardworking, enterprising man who very much wants to get ahead.  He’s single and has no children.  He lives comfortably with his father, mother and younger sister in his parents’ house.

Waldir’s business is selling lumber.  He sells it periodically to customers in the capital.  He also takes care of processes to ship lumber to firms.  He’s been in this business for two years.  He also has a small motor repair shop at home that’s been in operation for a year.  He considers his business to be profitable because of the profits it nets.  He likes his businesses because they provide him income to cover household expenses and continue working and seeking ways to get ahead.  As a result of the profitability of his lumber sales, he plans to expand the volume of his shipments and to enlarge his repair shop.

This is his second MFP loan and he hopes for your collaboration to make his plans reality.  On the other hand he feels good in his communal bank because he considers the group to be quite efficient.  He will use the requested 1,000 new soles to buy lumber to fill his pending shipping orders.  He will also buy some work tools like wrenches for his repair shop.

loans.use: to buy lumber and tools.

loans.name: Eli

texts.es:
Eli tiene 30 años convive con Edith con quien tiene 3 hijos de 9, 8 y 2 años de edad. Esta familia habita en una casa propia que él construyó en una comunidad nativa en la selva central. Eli se dedica a la agricultura. Le agrada el trabajo en la libertad del campo, para ello cuenta con terrenos de cultivos en su comunidad, ahí están sus sembríos de café, palta y plátanos. Son 3 parcelas donde distribuye estos productos.
Tiene como 12 años laborando en el campo, y menciona le gusta los días de cosecha, porque el trabajo es en equipo y puede ver reflejado todo su esfuerzo en sus ventas.
“El trabajo es cansado, se invierte mucho dinero, pero al final se ven los resultados”, dice.
Los cuidados para sus sembríos son constantes, por eso debe recurrir a personal para que trabajen sus tierras.  
Cosecha el café una vez al año, pero los plátanos le brindan ingresos económicos cada 20 días. 
Estos días son vitales para realizar la limpieza de sus cultivos y fertilizar sus tierras, por eso solicita de su apoyo para conseguir sus objetivos. Éste es su segundo crédito con MFP, por lo que agradece de antemano el apoyo. Se siente contento de pertenecer a ”Los Productores Yaneshas”, su banco comunal, porque le agradan las actividades educativas y solidarias.
Destinará los 2000 soles, primero en el pago del personal que contratará para la limpieza de sus cultivos y luego (casi con 1000 soles) en la compra de guano de corral para fertilizar sus tierras.
texts.en:
Eli, 30, lives with Edith, they have three children aged  9, 8 and 2. The family lives in their own home, which he built in a native community in the rainforest. 

Eli is a farmer. He is thankful for the work in the freedom of the countryside and relies upon his community's farmland. He plants coffee seeds, avocado and banana and has three plots of land where he grows his products.

He has worked on the land for 12 years and mentions that he enjoys the harvest season, because the work is done in teams and he can see the effort he has put in reflected in sales.

"The work is tiring and requires a lot of financial investment, but in the end it produces results", he says.

The seeds require constant care, for this reason he has to hire staff to work on his land. 

He harvests coffee once a year, but bananas provide economic income every 20  days.

The current time of year is vital for cleaning the crops and fertilising the land, this is why he is requesting support to achieve his aims. This is his second loan with MFP, for which he is grateful and offers his thanks to Kiva lenders. He is happy to belong to "Los Productores Yaneshas", his communal bank, because he is thankful for the educational and team activities.

He will use the 2000 PEN to pay the staff he has hired to clean the crops and then (with almost 1000 PEN) he will buy poultry manure to fertilise his land.

loans.use: to buy poultry manure to use for fertilising his land and to pay his hired staff

loans.name: Segundo

texts.es:
Segundo tiene 36 años convive con María, con quien tiene 4 hijos de 17, 13, 8 y 7 años. Todos viven juntos en una casa propia en una comunidad nativa de la selva central. Segundo es agricultor. Se dirige cada mañana hacia sus parcelas con mucho entusiasmo, pues reció rodeado de la naturaleza y plantaciones de frutas. Es por eso que aprendió como se realiza los sembríos. 
Al lado de su esposa, labora en sus 5 parcelas de terrenos (terrenos que la comunidad le otorgó), donde cultiva café, plátanos y yucas.
“casi son 20 años que trabajo en el campo y me siento bien produciendo y vendiendo mis frutos menciona.
Las faenas son cansadas y absorbentes, es así que requieren contratar operarios a quienes paga al día. 
Este año obtuvo una buena cosecha de café, y espera que el próximo año conseguir mayor producción, por eso se esmerará en sus cultivos desde ahora. Espera de su apoyo para adquirir abono orgánicos. Éste es su segundo crédito con MFP. Se compromete a ser puntual en la pago de las cuotas. “Los Productores Yaneshas” es el nombre de su banco comunal, y le agrada el trabajo en equipo. Con el dinero podrá comprar 10 bolsas de abono orgánico para esparcirlos en sus cultivos de café y plátanos.
texts.en:
Segundo, 36, lives with Maria and their four children aged 17, 13, 8 and 7. They all live together in their own home in a native community in the rainforest.

Segundo is a farmer. Every morning, he heads to her fields filled with enthusiasm. He grew up surrounded by nature and fruit plantations, which is how he learnt to sow seeds.

Alongside his wife, he works on 5 plots of land, which were given to him by the community, where he grows coffee, bananas and yuccas.

"I have worked in the fields for almost 20 years and I enjoy producing and selling my fruit", he comments.

The tasks are tiring and absorbing, which is why he needs to hire labourers who he pays daily.

This year he had a good coffee harvest and hopes that next year he will achieve a greater yield, which is why he works hard on his crops now.

He hopes to use the support to buy organic fertiliser. This is his second loan with MFP. He is committed to being punctual with his scheduled payments.

"Los Productores Yaneshas" is the name of his communal bank and he is happy to work in a team with the other members. With the money he will be able to buy 10 bags of organic fertiliser to spread on his coffee and banana crops.

loans.use: to buy 10 bags of organic manure to fertilise his crops.

loans.name: Rosalyn

texts.en: Rosalyn, age 32, and a loving mother of two children is requesting a loan amount of 6,000 PHP to buy spices, noodles, milk, soy sauce, vinegar and soap. She will put these items to her store as additional goods. She hopes that her business will be succeeding so that she can save and provide for the educational needs of her children.

loans.use: to buy spices, noodles, milk, soy sauce, vinegar and soap

loans.name: Climaco

texts.es:
CLIMACO tiene 50 años de edad es soltero no tiene hijos, vive con unos familiares en la ciudad de ventanas provincia de los ríos.

Es integrante de la VRC 16 DE AGOSTO, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Agua de Mocache, pertenece al Cantón Mocache se dedican a labores agrícolas y pecuarias.

 CLIMACO se dedica a la agricultura y a la crianza de animales. Solicita el crédito para comprar 2 cerdos, platano, semillas, insecticidas, urea, liquido para la maleza.

Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar lo que le hace falta para los cultivos. Las compras las hará en la ciudad de Ventanas. 

El sueño es comprarse más terreno. Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta son las plagas en las plantas.
En el tiempo libre le gusta jugar indor.
texts.en:
Climaco, 50, is single and has no children; he lives with some relatives in the city of Ventanas, Los Ríos Province.  He’s a member of the “16 de Agosto” communal bank located in Recinto Agua de Mocache belonging to Mocache Canton.  They all work in farming and animal husbandry activities.

Climaco works in agriculture and raising animals.  He’s requesting the loan to buy two pigs, bananas, seeds, insecticide, urea and liquid weed killer.  With help from the loan he will be able to buy what he needs for his crops.  He will make his purchases in the city of Ventanas.  

His dream is to buy more land and the challenge he faces is plant infestations.  He enjoys playing Indor soccer in his free time.

loans.use: to buy two pigs, bananas, seeds, insecticide, urea and weed killer.

loans.name: Dúo Los Encantos Group

texts.es: Dúo los encantos: Doña Yolanda es originaria de tecpan  Guatemala tiene una hija y se dedica a la venta de cosméticos, ella todos los día sale a vender su producto de forma ambulante y gracias a Dios le ha ido bien poco a poco a aumentado su capital, ella sueña con tener un negocio más grande. Está solicitando este crédito para la compra de cosmético para la venta.
texts.en:
The Enchantments Duo

Yolanda is from Tecpan, Guatemala.  She has a daughter and she works selling cosmetics.  She goes out every day to sell her goods from place to place and thanks to God she’s done well and has been gradually increasing her capital.  She dreams with having a larger business and is asking for this loan to buy cosmetics to resell.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics to resell.

loans.name: Judi

texts.es: Judi, de 39 años de edad, es hombre trabajador; vive en casa propia junto a su pareja Martha de 36 años y su 02 queridos hijos, a quienes desean brindarle un buen futuro. Él lucha por sobresalir adelante con su puesto de trabajo. Es comerciante y tiene un puesto de abarrotes situado en su comunidad y del que es muy frecuentado por sus compradores. Asimismo atienden con mucha cordialidad. Apertura las puertas de su negocio desde muy tempranas horas y están listas para recibir a sus primeros compradores. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es conversar con sus clientes ya que es una de sus habilidades que emplea para ganar mayor cantidad de consumidores, lleva 10 años en este negocio y se sienten muy contento de mejorar cada día. Con el crédito que obtuvo comprara más víveres para su negocio y así abastecerse de mercadería. Con el tiempo piensa incrementar sus ganancias ampliando su puesto de ventas. Este es su crédito número 07 y esta muy contento al saber que tendrá un apoyo financiero ya que así seguirá con su trabajo. Con los 1,000 nuevos soles, podrá comprar más víveres para su negocio.
texts.en: Judit, aged 39, is a hard-working man; he lives in his own house with his partner Martha who is 36, and their 2 beloved children, to whom they want to give a good future. Judit works hard to get ahead in his work. He is a shopkeeper and has a grocery store in his community; the shop is regularly used by his customers because he and his partner serve them with a great deal of warmth. The doors of his business open very early and are ready to receive the first customers, who don't hesitate to shop there as they know that there is a variety of products so they are sure that they will find what they need. The thing that he likes most about his work is chatting to his customers, as this is one of the skills that he employs to attract a greater number of customers. He has been working in this business for 10 years and feels very happy to improve each day. With the loan which he obtained, he will buy more supplies for his business so that he has a good stock of merchandise. In time, he is thinking about increasing his earnings by expanding his shop. This is his seventh loan and he is very happy to know that he will have the financial support to be able to continue his work. With the 1,000 nuevos soles, he will be able to buy more supplies for his business.

loans.use: to buy various products to stock his shop.

loans.name: Felina

texts.en: Felina, who has been selling different kinds of kakanin, plans to buy additional rice cake, milk, sugar, coconut and oil to satisfy customer demand and increase profits in order to meet family needs. Felina is therefore requesting a loan of 4,000 PHP to buy the stated goods.

loans.use: to buy additional rice cake, milk, sugar, coconut and oil

loans.name: Saturnina

texts.en:
Saturnina is 55 years old and lives in Poblacion, Sinacaban. Saturnina is married with 3 children. 

To earn a living, Saturnina has a business selling snacks in the community. She earns about 2,000 PHP each month doing this type of work. Saturnina has requested a loan to purchase additional ingredients such as flour, sugar, oil, etc.. Saturnina has been a member of PMPC for 4 years. In the future, Saturnina would like to save for in case of emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients such as flour, sugar, oil, etc.

loans.name: Alejandro

texts.es:
Alejandro, de 41 años es un padre responsable. Vive en compañía de su esposa Delfina y sus 3 hijos en una casa que heredó de sus padres hace 15 años. El es un hombre líder siempre atento en los problemas de los agricultores como él. Trabaja desde hace muchos años en el proyecto sierra productiva, de su experiencia pudo adquirir mucho conocimiento y además conocer muchas ciudades del país, “conozco casi todo el Perú”, comenta. En la actualidad posee terrenos propios y arrendados que quedad a una hora de camino, ahí siembra, papa, alverja, habas, olluco y demás productos agrícolas que comercializa en el mercado de su ciudad. Trabaja con mucho esmero, pues gracias al proyecto donde labora, aprendió a sembrar de manera orgánica, “los productos naturales siempre son buenos, cuando era niño mis padres sembraban de esa manera”, afirma. Es por esa razón que en todas las charlas que ofrece a sus similares pone énfasis en los antiguos agricultores. La otra actividad de Alejandro, es la crianza de animales posee vacas, cerdos, ovejas y cuyes, los cuales cuida con mucha dedicación. Ahora desea seguir sembrando y mejorar sus alimentos. Este es el crédito número 7 con MFP, durante todo este tiempo demostró responsabilidad y solidaridad. Gusta mucho de pertenecer a su asociación, por ello promete ser puntual en el pago de sus cuotas. Además agradece el apoyo económico obtenido durante estos años.
Alejandro invertirá el dinero en la compra de fertilizantes orgánicos para sus sembríos y si el dinero le alcanza comprará comida balanceada para sus animales.
texts.en:
Alejandro, at 41 years old, is a responsible father.  He lives with his wife, Delfina, and his three children in a house that he inherited from his parents 15 years ago.  He is a leader who is always attentive to the problems of other farmers.  He has many years' experience in the "el proyecto sierra productiva", which is a Peruvian agricultural program that helps lift rural families out of poverty through teaching innovative farming techniques.  From that experience, he has acquired a great deal of knowledge about farming.  He has also become familiar with the cities around the country.  "I know almost all of Perú." he says.

Right now, he has his own land as well as leased land, which takes about an hour to reach.  There he plants potatoes, peas, lima beans, ollucos (root vegetables grown in Peru, similar to a potatoes) and other agricultural products that he sells at the market in his city.  He works with great care, and thanks to the "proyecto sierra productiva" where he works, he has learned to grow his crops organically.  "Natural products are always good. When I was a child my parents planted in this way," he says.  It is for this reason that in all of his conversations with, and advice to, other farmers, he puts emphasis on pre-modern agricultural practices.  Alejandro also makes a living raising cattle, pigs, sheep and guinea pigs, which he owns and cares for with a great deal of dedication.

He would like to continue planting and improving his crops.  This is loan number 7 with MFP.  During the time he has been a member, he has demonstrated responsibility and solidarity with the group.  He really enjoys belonging to this organization, and so he promises to be punctual in his payments.  He is also grateful for the financial support he has received during these years.  Alejandro will invest the money in the purchase of organic fertilizers for his crops, and if there is enough money he will buy food for a balanced diet for his animals.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizers for his crops.

loans.name: Oscar Manuel

texts.es:
Oscar tiene 48 años de edad, vive al lado de su esposa con la cual tiene 2 hijos de 20 y 10 a los a quienes ama mucho y por quienes trabaja muy duro para darle una vida mejor; la vivienda de Oscar se encuentra en la ciudad de Nazca, ciudad que se caracteriza por tener un clima cálido y acogedor, asimismo se desarrolla la agricultura y la ganadería. Oscar es muy trabajador y sobre todo empeñoso, estudio la carrera de Ingeniería mecánica, actualmente trabaja en una empresa de chofer de carga pesada, el labora alrededor de 9 horas al día; el cree que le va bien en su trabajo porque ti muchas ganas de salir adelante y sobre todo porque es responsable.

Oscar está muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá  realizar el pago dl ciclo de estudios de uno de sus  hijos el cual se encuentra estudiando en un instituto de su ciudad, asimismo comprar una computadora para que su hijo pueda realizar sus trabajo de esta manera podrá seguir luchando y trabajando para poder hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Darle una buena educación a sus hijos y ´poder tener un gran restaurante”.
texts.en:
Oscar, 48, lives with his wife and two children who are 10 and 20 years old who he loves very much and for whom he works hard to provide a better life.  Oscar’s house is in the city of Nazca, a city noted for its hot, welcoming climate.  Farming and animal husbandry are common here too.  Oscar is very hardworking and above all dedicated.  He studied mechanical engineering and currently works for a firm as a heavy cargo truck driver.  He works about 9 hours daily and believes that he does well because he has a strong drive to get ahead and above all because he’s responsible.

Oscar is very grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to the support they’ve given him he will be able to pay tuition for one of his sons who is attending a local institute.  He will also buy a computer so that his son can do his school work while he himself continues to work and strive to make his greatest wish reality: to give his children a good education and to succeed in having a great restaurant.

loans.use: to pay tuition and to buy a computer.

loans.name: Metchail

texts.en:
Metchail is 38 years old and lives in Aquino,Tangub City. She is married with 5 children. Metchail works in the fish industry and sells fish for a living. She has been doing this for almost two years with her husband. She has applied for a loan of PHP 9,000 for additional capital in her business.
Metchail has been a member of PMPC for one year. In the future, Metchail desires to improve her living standard with her perseverance to attain her goal.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en: Virginia, aged 57, works hard to support her family. She sells bananas and coconuts. She is requesting a loan of PHP 6,000 to purchase more bananas and coconuts to sell in the village. She has been in this business for more than a year now. In the future, Virginia would like to save for future expenses and allowances. She hopes to grow her business through the loan in order to have a steady source of income.

loans.use: to purchase more bananas and coconuts to sell.

loans.name: Celerina

texts.en:
Celerina is 55 years old and lives in Villalin, Panaon,  Misamis Occidental. She is married with two children. 
Celerina is engaged in farming and a snack vending business and earns approximately PHP 3,000 each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan to be used in purchasing construction materials for house repair purposes. 
Celerina has been a member of PMPC for 4 years. In the future, Celerina hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials for house repair purposes.

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
Letecia is 46 years old and married with seven children. Three of the children are in school. 

Leticia is a very hard-working entrepreneur. She has a seashell culture business in the Philippines. She requested a 19,500 PHP loan through NWTF to buy seashells for culture.

Letecia has been in this business for 17 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy sea-shells to culture.

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en: Mary Jane is from Dalingap, Clarin. She is 33 years old. Mary Jane is married and has 4 children. She runs a general store for a living. Every month she earns 8,000 PHP and has been 8 years in this business. She joined GDMPC in 2009. She ask for a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase new items such as candies, milo, shampoo, soaps, etc.. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase new items such as candies, milo, shampoo, soaps, etc.

loans.name: María Eugenia

texts.es:
La Señora María Eugenia posee un negocio de venta de comida como pollo frito, enchilada, chancho con yuca,  ubicado en uno de los mercados de la ciudad de León, desde hace 40  años, ella realiza esta labor para llevar el sustento a su familia, es madre de 8 hijos de los cuales solo una está bajo su responsabilidad.
 Inicia sus labores a las 5:00 am a preparar  la comida en su casa, a las 11:00 am. Se traslada a su puesto de venta para su comercialización Y finaliza a las 2:00 Pm esta labor la realiza  de lunes a sábado en este mismo horario,  Su negocio lo inicio de forma ambulante, el capital con  que inicio fue producto de sus ahorro.

El  crédito que esta solicitando a CEPRODEL lo utilizara  para comprar por mayor el producto para elaboración de sus deliciosos platillos y ofrecerle a precios favorables   a sus clientes que viajan a los diferentes municipios de la ciudad de León, así obteniendo mayores ingresos y mejorar el nivel de vida tanto de ella como la de su  hija de 24  años de edad. 

Los sueños de Doña María Eugenia  es que su hija  logre culminar una carrera profesional y  realizar  mejora a su vivienda.
texts.en:
María Eugenia has a business selling food like fried chicken, enchiladas and pork with cassava. The business is located in one of the city markets in Leon. She has been doing this work for 40 years to bring money into her family. She is the mother of eight children, of them all, there is only one child whom is still dependent upon her.

She begins work at 5:00 am to prepare food at home. At 11:00 am she moves the food to her stall for sale and finishes about 2:00 pm.  She works the same schedule Monday through Saturday.  She started her business as a mobile street vendor with the initial investment taken from her savings.

The loan that she is requesting from CEPRODEL will be used it to buy the products wholesale in order to prepare her delicious dishes and offer more competitive prices to her customers, many of whom travel from the different municipalities of the city of León. This way, she will earn a higher wages and improve not only her standard of living, but also that of her 24 year old daughter.

Maria Eugenia dreams that her daughter will attain a successful career and make improvements to their home.

loans.use: to buy plastic wrap, chicken, rice, cooking oil etcetera.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is a 40-year-old married woman with a 6-year-old son from Panglao, Bohol. She has been in the hog-raising business for three years. She plans to use the loan to purchase additional piglets, feeds and pig supplements. Her husband is a motorcycle driver who helps her to finance their daily needs. 

In the future, Jocelyn would like to expand her business to support the education of her son for his bright future.

loans.use: to buy additional piglets, feed and pig supplements.

loans.name: Felicitas

texts.es: La señora felicitas trabaja como estilista desde hace mas de 8 años y es una persona emprendedora ya que en poco tiempo adecuo una parte de su vivienda para poner su negocio con el cual lleva la misma de cantidad de años, la  señora esta solicitando un crédito para poder invertir en la compra de nuevo equipo para la estética ya que le hace falta maquinaria para poder realizar los tintes pero no cuenta con el capital necesario para poder efectuar dicha mejora.
texts.en: Felicitas has been working as a hair stylist for more than 8 years.  She’s an enterprising person who gradually equipped part of her house as her business which has also been in operation for that same amount of time.  She’s asking for a loan to buy new beauty salon equipment; she needs machinery to do hair coloring but does not have the necessary capital to make this improvement.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her beauty salon.

loans.name: Neris Roxana

texts.es:
Neris tiene 32 años de edad, esta acompañada y tiene un hijo de 11 años de edad. Cuenta con tres años de experiencia en el negocio de la cosmetodología, lo aprendió en una academia especializada. Su negocio, lo tiene instalado en un local que alquila en el mercado municipal; todos los productos que utiliza para su negocio de sala de belleza se los llegan a dejar a su local.

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para cancelar una deuda y para comprar más productos para su sala de belleza.  La deuda la adquirió porque tiene un familiar con problemas de salud; pero ahora desea cancelarla e invertir en su negocio, para recibir mejores ingresos para su familia y brindarle un mejor servicio a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Neris, age 32, is in a relationship and has an 11 year old, school age child.  She has three years of experience in the cosmetology business.  She learned at a specialized academy.  

Her business is set up at a place that she rents at the municipal market.  She takes all of the products that she uses for her beauty salon business to her place.

The loan she is requesting from the Fundación Campo is to pay a debt and to buy more products for her beauty salon.  She acquired the debt because a relative had health problems.  However, she now wants to cancel the debt and invest in her business.  She wants to do this in order to get better income for her family and to give her customers better service.

loans.use: to pay a debt and to buy more products for her beauty salon.

loans.name: Roxana Verónica

texts.es:
La señora Roxana de estado civil acompañada, su pareja trabaja como mecánico, tiene dos hijos en edad escolar; es una comerciante que se dedica a brindar el servicio de comideria y venta de tortillas, ella vive en el municipio de san Rafael del sur, Managua, Nicaragua, en un lugar donde tiene un alto potencial turístico por las bellas playas del pacífico nicaragüense; ella tiene su negocio en el mercado donde atiende a un buen número de personas que visitan este centro de compras, además de proveer tortillas a los comedores del mercado.

El crédito será destinado para comprar arroz, azúcar, frijoles, aceite y verduras en general. Esto con el objetivo de brindar una mejor atención a sus clientes.

Con el préstamo anterior doña Roxana mejoro las condiciones de su actividad comercial, generando así bienestar emocional y económico por los ingresos obtenidos de su negocio que viene ayudar en los gastos familiares.
texts.en:
Roxana has a partner, who works as a mechanic, and two children in school.  She lives in the town of San Rafael del Sur, Managua, Nicaragua, in a place that has a high potential for tourism because of the beautiful beaches of the Nicaraguan Pacific.

She's a merchant who makes a living with an eatery and selling tortillas.  Her business is in the market where she serves a good number of people who come to this shopping center.  She also provides all the eateries in the market with tortillas.

She'll use the loan to buy rice, sugar, beans, oil, and vegetables in general.  Her goal is to give her customers better service.

With the previous loan Roxana improved the conditions of her business, creating emotional and financial well-being with her income, which helps with the family expenses.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, oil, vegetables, and beans

loans.name: Jefferson Sebastian

texts.es:
JEFFERSON SEBASTIAN tiene 27 años de edad es soltero no tiene hijos, vive con los padres en Ventanas provivncia de los Ríos.

Es integrante de la VRC 16 DE AGOSTO, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Agua de Mocache, pertenece al Cantón Mocache se dedican a labores agrícolas y pecuarias.

JEFFERSON SEBASTIAN  se dedica a la agriculturaa la siembra de maíz y a la crianza de animales. Solicita el crédito para comprar pollos, polbillo, semillas, insecticidas, urea.

Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar lo que le hace falta para los cultivos, además comprar pollos para criarlos engordarlos y venderlos. Las compras las hará en la ciudad de Ventanas. 

El sueño es comprarse una camioneta para trasladar los productos para venderlos. Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta son las plagas en el maíz.
En el tiempo libre le gusta jugar indor.
texts.en:
Jefferson Sebastián, 27, is single and has no children.  He lives with his parents in Ventanas, Los Ríos Province.  He's a member of 16 de Agosto Communal Bank, located in the Agua de Mocache area of Mocache Canton, where the people make a living in agriculture and livestock.

Jefferson Sebastián makes a living in agriculture, growing corn and raising animals.  He's requesting the loan to buy chickens, rice powder, seed, insecticide, and urea.  With the help of the loan he'll be able to buy what he needs for his crops as well as chicken to raise, fatten, and sell.  He'll make his purchases in the city of Ventanas.

His dream is to buy himself a truck to transport his products for sale.  The challenges he faces are pests in the corn.  In his free time he likes to play indoor soccer.

loans.use: to buy chickens, rice powder, seed, insecticide, and urea

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cement, sand and to pay labor costs.

loans.name: Ramón Sebastián

texts.es:
El señor Ramón de estado civil casado y actualmente vive solo con su esposa, quien también trabaja en su punto de venta; él es un pequeño comerciante que actualmente se dedica a vender productos de consumo como arroz, azúcar, frijoles, aceite, jabón, queso, huevos, entre otros.

El vive en san Rafael del sur, un municipio de Managua, un lugar turístico con un alto potencial de desarrollo por las bellas playas del pacifico de Nicaragua.

Antes de tener su negocio él fue obrero en la industria de cemento, después queda en el desempleo, situación del cual nace la idea de poner su propio negocio personal donde colabora en los gastos familiares.

esta solicitando este crédito para la compra de: arroz, azúcar, aceite, verduras en general, frijoles, recargas movistar, esto con el fin de incrementar su inventario y obtener mas ganancias.
texts.en:
Ramón is married, and he now lives alone with his wife, who also works at his sales location.  He is a small businessman who now sells consumable products like rice, sugar, beans, cooking oil, soap, cheese, and eggs, among others.

He lives in San Rafael del Sur in the Managua municipality.  It is a tourist location with a high potential for development because of its beautiful beaches on the Pacific coast of Nicaragua.

Before having his business he was a worker in the cement industry.  He later was left unemployed.  The idea of setting up his own personal business, where he could contribute to the family expenses, was born from this situation.

He is requesting this loan to buy rice, sugar, cooking oil, vegetables, beans, and Movistar cell phone recharges to increase his inventory and to get more income.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, cooking oil, vegetables, beans, and Movistar cell phone recharges

loans.name: Moyopata-San Sebastian Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “MOYOPATA SAN SEBASTIAN”; Este banco se ubicado en el distrito de San Jeronimo, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Rosaría ella es casada y tiene 40 años y tiene 3 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de desayunos, la socia lleva años en este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día  a su negocia, la socia vende de  forma ambulatoria a fuera de uno de los mercados de la ciudad del Cusco, la socia vende quinua con manzana,maca,leche,tortas,pan con palta, pan con queso entre otros, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa siendo de esta forma que la socia saca adelante  a su familia, la socia trabaja desde las 06:00am hasta terminar su mercadería como 10:00am aproximadamente.

La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de insumos como leche, manzana, azucar entre otros para su negocio.
La socia que sale adjunta en la foto pidio permiso para llegar tarde a la reunion.

Los otros socios  se dedican al negocio de mecanico, servicio de mudanza, servicio de carga, picantería, ama de casa apoyando a su esposo en planchado y pintura de autos, venta de libros, crianza de animales, carpintería.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members belong to the “Mayopata San Sebastian” communal bank located in San Jerónimo District belonging to Cusco Province and Department.  

Rosaria, 40, is married and has three children.  She alternates her daily chores with a business selling breakfasts.  She’s been in this business for years and does well thanks to the effort she puts into it daily.  She’s a street vendor outside one of Cusco’s markets.  She sells quinoa with apples, maca root, milk, cake, bread with avocado, bread with cheese and others.  She’s a responsible, dedicated person who supports her family this way.  She works from 6am until she sells out her merchandise around 10am approximately.

She will use the loan to buy ingredients like milk, apples and sugar, among others for her business.  She thanks those who share her dream and commits to make her installment payments as scheduled.

The member in the inserted photo requested permission to arrive late at the meeting.  The other group members are mechanics, movers, cargo shippers, snack shop owners, a housewife who helps out her husband taking in ironing, car painters, book sellers, animal raisers and carpenters.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like milk, apples, sugar and others.

loans.name: Poe

texts.en:
Poe, 30 years old, is a married entrepreneur from Caniangan, Tangub, with two children. He is earning from his business of buying and selling coconut wine. He started it almost five years ago and now he earns 4,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) a month. 

To improve business, he is borrowing the amount of 6,500 PHP from GDMPC microcredit, which he just joined in 2011, to buy more coconut wine to sell. Before long, he’s hopeful of the possibility of expanding his business.

loans.use: to buy more coconut wine to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy computers.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is 56 years old and lives in Libertad Bajo, Sinacaban.  Gloria is married and has five children. 
Gloria has a store that sells a variety of products.  She has had this business for 10 years. Gloria requested a loan to purchase additional products, such as canned goods, noodles, beverages, detergents, etc.
Gloria has been a member of PMPC for 2 years.  In the future, Gloria hopes to save and improve their general living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase additional products such as canned goods,noodles,beverages,detergents,etc.

loans.name: Madelyn

texts.en: Madelyn is 43 years old, married and has 5 children. She is from Panta-on, Ozamiz City.  Madelyn is a farmer who plants and harvests bananas for sale. She has been in business for 10 years and earns 8,000 PHP a month. In 2011, Madelyn joined GDMPC. Madelyn is requesting a loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, such as manure

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es: Mercedes es originaria de aldea xetzac, Tecpan Guatemala se dedica a la elaboración y venta de queso, tiene 4 hijas que le ayudan con su negocio, ella desde hace algunos años empezó su propio negocio con un capital muy pequeño, y cada día va en aumento eso gracias a que ya es bien reconocida  por la calidad de su producto, está solicitando este crédito para la compra de leche y condimento que lleva para la elaboración de queso, espera que le puedan ayudar con el crédito solicitado.
texts.en: Mercedes is from the village of Xetzac in Tecpan, Guatemala.  She works making and selling cheese. She has four daughters that help her in the business.  She started her own business some years ago with very little capital and every day has been growing.  Thanks to that she’s well-known for the quality of her product.   She’s requesting this loan to buy milk and condiment she needs to make cheese and hopes that you will be able to help her with the loan she’s requested.

loans.use: to buy milk and condiment to make cheese.

loans.name: Dúo Cristo Vive Group

texts.es:
Dúo  Cristo Vive
