El dúo está conformado por  la señora  Maria Consuelo de  42 años de edad  vive  en san Juan Sacatepequez  ella es viuda  su  negocio es una tienda de consumo diario (Jabón, pastas y golosinas ) desde  hace 8 años que inicio con la ayuda de su esposo con el tiempo fue creciendo en su negocio y ahora necesita un crédito para surtir su negocio tiene dos  hijos que aun estudian   su deseo es que sus hijos se superen  y su negocio siga creciendo.   está solicitando este crédito para la compra de productos comestibles de primera necesidad.
texts.en:
Christ Lives Duo

María Consuelo, 42, lives in San Juan Sacatepequez.  She’s a widow and her business is a grocery store selling daily use items (soap, noodles and snacks).  She started it 8 years ago with help from her husband.  In time the business has grown and now she needs a loan to stock it.  She has two children attending school and her wish is that they improve and that the business continues to grow.  She’s requesting this loan to buy basic staple foodstuffs.

loans.use: to buy basic staples.

loans.name: Michelle

texts.en: Michelle is a married woman from Panglao, Bohol.  She has a five year-old daughter. She has been in the hog raising  business for three years. Michelle plans to use the loan to purchase additional piglets, feeds and pig supplements. Each month, she earns four thousand pesos by doing the hog raising business.  In the future, Michelle would like to expand her business to support the schooling of her daughter.

loans.use: to buy additional piglets, feed, pig supplements

loans.name: Lyn

texts.en: Lyn is 29 years old, married, and the mother of two children. She lives in Montol, Ozamis City, Misamis Occidental, where she has earned a living for the last 4 years by selling home products. She makes PHP 6,000 a month and is applying for a loan for PHP 5,500 to purchase additional products like canned goods, noodles, sugar and coffee. She joined GDMPC in 2008 as a way to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase additional products like canned goods, noodles, sugar and coffee

loans.name: Aileen

texts.en: Aileen, age 27, has been a farmer for 8 years and earns PHP 4,000 a month from her endeavors. She plans to plant more crops to gain more income, and also intends to make essential repairs to the family home. Aileen has been a member of GDMPC since 2011. She has requested a loan in the amount of PHP 7,500 from GDMPC in order to buy fertilizers and pay for land preparation costs. She has three children and lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pay for land preparation costs

loans.name: Eden

texts.en:
This is Eden; she previously accessed a 15000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for her children’s education as well as in their personal, household and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for another 10000 PHP loan for her to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add in her inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in a better profit. Her profits from the business will definitely help to sustain her family’s daily needs and the children’s educational expense. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Eden hopes that her business will grow and expand through all her hard work on it. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Mercita

texts.en:
Mercita is from Calabayan, Ozamiz City. She is 44 years old, married, and has 2 children. To make a living, she makes and sells food. She's been in business for 5 years and earns about 4,000 PHP a month. 

In 2011, Mercita joined GDMPC.  She is requesting a loan of 6,000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make the food she sells. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make the food she sells

loans.name: Rochell Liza

texts.en:
Rochell Liza is a 29-year-old married woman from Prenza, Tangub City. She owns and operates a specialized retail store selling a variety of products such as biscuits, noodles, sugar, salt, vinegar, cooking oil, etc. She has had her business for 5 years, and earns 8,000 PHP a month. 

In 2010, Rochell Liza joined GDMPC. She's requesting a loan of 19,000 PHP to purchase new items for her store such as candies, milo, shampoo, soap, etc. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase new items for her store such as candies, milo, shampoo, soap, etc.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
This is Yolanda, 58, a resident of Manila, Philippines. She is married to Rogelio, and a mother to her children. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Yolanda operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php500 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php30,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Yolanda dreams to give her family a good life through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Herminio

texts.en:
As farmers, Herminio and Grace make sure that their farm is well maintained. The couple carefully plans their farming strategies to take advantage of their one hectare rice field to produce plentiful yields next season. Herminio hopes that his farming business will further grow so he can educate his two children and give them a better way of living.

Herminio would like to take out another loan amounting to PHP37,000. He will use this amount in purchasing farm supplies, such as fertilizer and insecticides, and to pay for land preparation of his farm plot. He believes that this loan will help him in achieving his goal in life.

loans.use: to purchase farm supplies such as fertilizer and insecticides and for land preparation of rice farm

loans.name: Lina

texts.en: Lina is a resident of Prenza, Tangub City, Philippines. She is 31 years old, married, and has 3 children. For 10 years she has been managing a gardening business as her source of income. Each month, she earns PHP 4,000 from this business. Lina has requested a loan of PHP 7,000 from GDMPC to purchase fertilizers. In the future, she hopes to expand the business, buy a motorcycle to easily move goods in the marketplace, and make more money.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers.

loans.name: Mahfuza

texts.en: Mahfuza is married and has three children. She is married to a lovely man who is a singer. She is a seamstress and sews very wonderful women's dresses. She wants to get additional income by selling clothes. She wants to organize a new business. With this aim, she studied in a course called, "To get ahead", which was offered by a women's organization.  There she got business skills.  Her shop will be near her workshop. She is asking for a loan of 2000 somoni to buy cloth for organizing the new business.  Her business will be a source of income so that her family can have a good quality of life and better financial opportunities to progress. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy cloth for organizing her new business

loans.name: Vicenta Elle

texts.en: Vicenta Elle is a widow, and has three children. She is 60 years old, and resides in Labo, Ozamis City, Philippines. She owns and operates a retail store where she sells a variety of different products to earn a living. She's been in this business for 5 years, and earns 4,000 PHP each month. Vicenta Elle has requested a loan of 14,000 PHP to purchase additional products to sell like canned goods, noodles, sugar and coffee. In 2007, she joined GDMPC. In the future, she wants to build a house and to help her children finish their studies.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell like canned goods, noodles, sugar and coffee

loans.name: Ganbaatar

texts.en: Mr.Ganbaatar is 43 years old and lives with his wife and two children in a small house in Suhbaatar district, Mongolia. His wife, Ariunaa, is a tailor. His daughter, Odonchimeg, is a college student. Hisson, Jawhlantugs, is secondary school student.  Mr.Ganbaatar started working as taxi driver in 2008 with a taxi service provider company. He is well-experienced and popular in the town. He is planning to buy a car of his own to operate a taxi service independently, and he is requesting  3,000,000 MNT for the purchase of car for his business.  He is well behaved and hardworking person.

loans.use: To purchase a car for his newly-started taxi service business

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
This is Teresita, 56. She is a resident of Caloocan, Philippines, and is married to Fernando, a technician and the father of her children. Together with her husband, she manages their household while operating her business. At this time, she is working hard to continue providing income for her family's everyday expenses.

Teresita operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store which sells groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local community. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, 5 PHP worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns money by getting supplies wholesale and selling them at retail prices. Her regular customers are her neighbors and other members of the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

To help her continue operating her business, Teresita is requesting a PHP 30,000 loan. She will use the money to buy more groceries, toiletries and beverages and expand her inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her product line. 
 
Teresita dreams of giving her family a good life through all her hard work on her business. She meets faithfully with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her work and also to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.  

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy more groceries, toiletries and beverages and expand her inventory

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en: Merlinda is married with five children. She is 58 years old and lives in Ozamis City, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. To earn a living, she owns and operates a retail store selling grocery products such as noodles, spices, canned goods, laundry and bath soap, soft drinks, etc. She has run this business for eight years. Each month, she earns PHP 8,000. She has requested a loan of PHP 10,000 to acquire additional grocery products to sell. In 2007, Merlinda joined GDMPC. She hopes to expand and improve her business to gain more income for the family and for a better lifestyle.

loans.use: to acquire additional grocery products to sell.

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.en: Marcelina is from Masabud, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 39 years of age, married and has five children. To make a living, Marcelina owns and operates a business venture planting and harvesting bananas for sale. Marcelina had been in this business for eight years and earns PHP 5,000 per month. Marcelina applied for a loan of PHP 5,000 to purchase fertilizer. Marcelina's revenue will be reinvested back into the business to double the return, and a portion of the profit will be used for the education of her children.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer.

loans.name: Nanette

texts.en:
This is Nanette. She previously accessed a 20,000 PHP loan, which she used to purchase a greater quantity and variety of products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help in meeting the family’s personal, household and business expenditures, and also for her children’s education.

Nanette would like to apply for another loan of 30,000 PHP in order to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better – more items to sell will result in more profits. Her profits from the business will definitely help to continue meeting her  family’s daily needs and paying for her children’s education. She looks forward to this financial boost with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Nanette hopes to be able to expand soon and dreams of giving her children a good education. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her work and also to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her inventory.

loans.name: Almie

texts.en:
Almie is 33 years old and married with two children. Almie works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 10000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional stock to sell.

Almie has borrowed and paid two loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for two years and also earns an income from food vending.

Almie aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stock to sell.

loans.name: Penden

texts.en:
Penden is 34 years old. She is married to Arlan and gifted with three children. 

Penden owns and manages a business where they sell dry goods such as toothbrushes, slippers, combs, and washing utensils. Their business is situated in lower Magapit where most of the customers are stop-over. She is very lucky because through her hard work, it flows well. She has been in the business for sixteen years and is still doing better. 

Penden is now requesting a loan of 50,000 PHP to increase her working capital. She will use the loan to purchase items such as school supplies, slippers, kitchen utensils, and washing utensils, as requested by her customers. Hopefully it will help her to generate more income. Through this, she could help out other people by hiring a companion in selling. She hopes to build a bigger stall for her business in order to be safe from the heat of the sun and rain that usually destroys her goods.

loans.use: to purchase items such as school supplies, slippers, kitchen utensils, and washing utensils.

loans.name: Bayarmaa

texts.en:
Mrs. Bayarmaa is 47 years old and lives with her husband and two daughters in a small house in Arhangai province, Mongolia. Her husband, Tumenjargal, works as a driver for a public transportation company. Her two daughters, Otgonjargal and Oyunjargal, are 21 and 15 years old. Her older daughter is a college student and her younger daughter is a secondary school student. 

Mrs. Bayarmaa has worked as a chef in private restaurants and cafes. She is starting her new business of food delivery. She did a trial of her newly-starting food delivery business and it was very attractive to customers. She estimated potential profit from this business. She is also planning to expand this business in future.

Mrs. Bayarmaa is a modest and hardworking person. She is asking for a loan of 1,700,000 MNT to purchase inventory for her food delivery business.

loans.use: to purchase inventory for her food delivery business.

loans.name: Janice June

texts.en: Janice June is a 32 year old married woman with two children. She is from Panglao, Bohol, and has been in the food vending business for two years. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy vegetables to sell like beans and squash, as well as green leafy vegetables like pechay and snack foods like rice cakes. She earns 3,000 PHP a month from her business. In the future, Janice June would like to expand her business so she can support her children in getting an education.

loans.use: to buy vegetables and snack foods to sell

loans.name: Emely

texts.en:
Emely is 32 years old, married, and has two children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Emely is borrowing PHP 13000 through NWTF to buy additional feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Emely has been raising pigs for 3 years and also earns additional income from selling food.

She is working tirelessly to achieve her dream of saving enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Chagaa

texts.en: Mrs. Chagaa is 45 years old and lives with her husband and two children in a house in the Suhbaatar district, in Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia. Her husband, Batmunh, is 45 years old. Her daughter, Maralmaa, is a secondary school student, and her son, Gantulga, is a college student. Mrs. Chagaa has been working for a tailoring company since 1990. She has a lot of experience in the industry and is planning to start her own business in her old house, which is right beside her new house. She is asking for a loan of 4,200,000 MNT to buy an electric sewing machine and to redesign her old house into a workplace for her new business.

loans.use: to buy an electric sewing machine and to redesign her old house into a workplace for her new business.

loans.name: Esmelda Del Socorro

texts.es:
Esmelda del Socorro es una señora de unos cuarenta y cinco años de edad con nivel de estudio primaria no aprobado, su negocio consiste en compra y venta de mariscos, esta actividad la realiza dos veces por semana, se levanta muy temprano a buscar el producto a orilla de las costas del mar en donde llegan las pequeñas lanchas o balsas las cuales pasaron en el proceso y búsqueda de los marisco, Luego de esta compra toman sus panas y realizan sus ventas calle a calle ofertando sus pescados.

De ejercer esta actividad llevan un poco más de cinco años sus ventas son al contado, fruto de esa experiencia ha adquirido un buen mercado. 
Inicio sus ventas de herencia de sus padres los cuales también se dedicaban a esta actividad. 

este crédito lo solicita para comprar mariscos, asi obtener mayor ganacias.
texts.en: Esmeralda del Socorro is about 45-years-old and did not complete elementary school.  Her business consists in buying and selling seafood.  She does this twice a week.  She rises very early to go look for product along the seashore where the small fishing boats come in after a night of fishing.  Once she buys the seafood she puts it in her baskets and goes from street to street selling it to her customers.  She’s been in this business a little over five years and her sales are all cash.  Thanks to the experience she’s gained, she has a good clientele.  She started selling as an inheritance from her parents since they were in the same business.  She will use the loan she’s requesting to buy seafood and earn higher profits.

loans.use: to buy seafood.

loans.name: Mauro Abel

texts.es:
MAURO ABEL tiene 37 años de edad de estado civil soltero tiene tres hijos, vive con los hijos en la ciudad de Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos.

Es integrante de la VRC 16 DE AGOSTO, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Agua de Mocache, pertenece al Cantón Mocache se dedican a labores agrícolas y pecuarias.

MAURO ABEL se dedica a la agricultura y a la crianza de animales. Solicita el crédito para comprar semillas, insecticidas, urea, fertilizantes, abono orgánico.

Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar lo que le hace falta para los cultivos. Las compras las hará en la ciudad de Ventanas y en Mocache. 

El sueño es comprarse un vehículo. Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta son las plagas y enfermedades en las plantas.
En el tiempo libre le gusta practicar el futbol y el indor.
texts.en:
Mauro Abel, 37, is single and has three children.  He lives with his children in the city of Ventanas in Los Ríos Province.  He’s a member of the “16 de Agosto” communal bank located in Recinto Agua de Mocache belonging to Mocache Canton; they work in agriculture and animal husbandry.

Mauro Abel works in agriculture and raising animals.  He requests the loan to buy seeds, insecticide, urea, fertilizer and organic manure.  With help from the loan he will be able to buy what he needs for his crops.  He will make his purchases in the cities of Ventanas and Mocache.

His dream is to buy a vehicle.  The challenges he faces are pests and plant illnesses.  In his free time he likes playing soccer and Indor soccer.

loans.use: to buy seeds, insecticide, urea, fertilizer and organic manure.

loans.name: Merle

texts.en:
Merle is 39 years old, married, and has four children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Merle is borrowing PHP 10000 through NWTF to buy additional feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Merle has been raising pigs for 2 years and earns additional income from selling food.

She works hard to achieve her dream of saving enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Luis Alfonso

texts.es:
LUIS ALFONSO tiene 35 años de edad de estado civil soltera tiene dos hijos, vive con los hijos y la madre en la ciudad de Ventanas provincia de los ríos.

Es integrante de la VRC 16 DE AGOSTO, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Agua de Mocache, pertenece al Cantón Mocache se dedican a labores agrícolas y pecuarias.

LUIS ALFONSO se dedica a la agricultura y a la crianza de pollos, cerdos. Solicita el crédito para comprar semillas, insecticidas, urea, liquido para la maleza, polbillo.

Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar lo que le hace falta para los cultivos. Las compras las hará en la ciudad de Ventanas. 

El sueño es comprarse una casa y un carro. Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta son las plagas en las plantas.
En el tiempo libre le gusta jugar indor.
texts.en:
Luis Alfonso, 35, is single and has two children.  He lives with his children and his mother in the city of Ventanas, Los Ríos Province.  He’s a member of the “16 de Agosto” communal bank located in Recinto Agua de Mocache belonging to Mocache Canton.  They work in agriculture and animal husbandry.

Luis Alfonso works in agriculture and raises chickens and pigs.  He requests the loan to buy seeds, insecticide, urea, liquid weed killer and animal feed.  With help from the loan he will be able to buy what he needs for his crops.  He’ll make his purchases in the city of Ventanas.

His dream is to buy a house and a car.  The challenge he faces is plant infestations.  In his free time he likes to play Indor soccer.

loans.use: to buy seeds, insecticide, urea, liquid weed killer and animal feed.

loans.name: Ginger Estefania

texts.es: Ginger tiene 19 años, estado civil soltera. Ella cuenta que comenzó de a poquita mercadería de ropa, su sueño es ampliar su negocio y brindarle trabajo a personas que no tenga .ella trabaja de 8:00am hasta las 16:00pm. Con el préstamo comprara mercadería como: pantalones, faldas, blusas, vestidos etc.
texts.en: Ginger, 19, is single.  She relates that she started out with little clothing and her dream is to expand the business and provide employment for people who don’t have jobs.  She works from 8am until 4pm.  She will use the loan to buy merchandise like pants, skirts, blouses, dresses, etc.

loans.use: to buy clothes.

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es: Maria estado civil soltera , tiene 2 hijos . Maria comenta que a causa de la falta de empleo que posee el país y no podía encontrar un trabajo fijo, tomo  el camino de ser una comerciante. Pero la falta de capital era un impedimento para su negocio, ya que ella tiene una pequeña tienda. Con el préstamo Maria va a comprar: papa, aceite, arroz etc.
texts.en: María is single and has two children.  She comments that due to the lack of employment in the country she was unable to find a steady job so she took the road of becoming a merchant.  But lack of capital was an impediment for her business since she has a small store.  She will use the loan buy potatoes, rice, oil, etc.

loans.use: to buy potatoes, rice, oil, etc.

loans.name: Lorena Nataly

texts.es:
LORENA NATALY tiene 21 años de edad es soltera no tiene hijos, vive con la familia en ventanas Provincia de los ríos.

Es integrante de la VRC 16 DE AGOSTO, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Agua de Mocache, pertenece al Cantón Mocache se dedican a labores agrícolas y pecuarias.

LORENA NATALY se dedica a la crianza de animales, además también vende productos por catalogo. Solicita el crédito para comprar cerdos, pollos, polbillos.

Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar lo que le hace falta. Las compras las hará en la ciudad de Ventanas. 

El sueño es comprarse una casa. Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta es la competencia y desastres naturales.
En el tiempo libre le gusta hacer deporte y realizar los quehaceres domésticos
texts.en:
Lorena Nataly, 21, is single and has no children.  She lives with her family in Ventanas, Los Ríos Province.  She’s a member of the “16 de Agosto” communal bank located in Recinto Agua de Mocache belonging to Mocache Canton.  They are involved in agriculture and animal husbandry activities.

Lorena Nataly raises animals and also sells products via catalogue.  She requests the loan to buy pigs, chicks and animal feed.  With help from the loan she will be able to buy what she needs.  She will make her purchases in the city of Ventanas.

Her dream is to buy a house.  The challenge she faces is competition and natural disasters.  In her free time she enjoys playing sports and doing housework.

loans.use: to buy pigs, chicks and animal feed.

loans.name: Doraliza

texts.es:
Doraliza tiene 68 años de edad, pero tiene la alegría y las ganas de salir adelante de una joven de 20 años, ella es madre soltera y a sabido luchar mucho para sacar adelante a sus 2 hijos; sui vivienda se encuentra en la ciudad de Ica, ciudad que se caracteriza por tener un clima cálido y acogedor, asimismo se desarrolla la agricultura, en especial el cultivo de algodón, uva, esparrago, entre otros. Doraliza solo pudo estudiar hasta el tercer grado de educación secundaria, pero le hubiera gustado mucho estudiar la carrera de enfermería, pro ello siempre le ha inculcado a sus hijos sobre el estudio. Día a día Doraliza trabaja e como empleada del hogar y también tiene su pequeño negocio de venta de aves especialmente pato, ya que los ofrece a los restaurantes de la ciudad para la preparación de uno de los platillos mas ricos de nuestro país, el cual es el riquísimo arroz con Pato.; ella trabaja alrededor de 9 horas al día y ella cree que le va bien porque es responsable, honrada y sobre todo tiene mucha fe en Dios.

Doraliza está muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá comparar materiales como fierros, cemento, ladrillos, entre otros para poder construir su baño, ya que actualmente es de adobe, de esta manera ella podrá mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia y poder seguir luchando para poder hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Darle una buena educación a sus hijos y poder tener una negocio más grande”.
texts.en:
Doraliza is 68 years old, but has the joy and the desire to get ahead of a 20 year old. As a single mother she has struggled a lot to raise her two children. Her house is in the city of Ica, a city that is known for having a warm and welcoming climate, and it has developed agriculturally, especially growing cotton, grapes, and asparagus, among others.

Doraliza could only study until the third grade of secondary school, but would have liked to study to be a nurse, but has always instilled in her children above all to study.

Every day Doraliza works as a housekeeper and also has a small business selling birds, especially ducks, offering them to restaurants in the city for the preparation of one of the most delicious dishes of the country, which is the tasty rice with duck. She works around nine hours a day and she thinks it is going well because she is trustworthy, honest and above all she has a lot of faith in God.

Doraliza is very grateful to the Kive lenders and thanks to the help they have given her she can buy supplies such as iron, cement, bricks, etc. in order to build her bathroom, as currently it is adobe. In this way she can improve the quality of life for her family and be able to continue fighting in order to reach her biggest dream: “Providing a good education to the children and to have a larger business.”

loans.use: to buy iron, cement, bricks, etc. to be used in the construction of a bathroom

loans.name: Alexis Francisco

texts.es:
ALEXIS FRANCISCO tiene 21 años de edad es soltero no tiene hijos, vive con el papá en la ciudad de Ventanas Provincia de los ríos.

Es integrante de la VRC 16 DE AGOSTO, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Agua de Mocache, pertenece al Cantón Mocache se dedican a labores agrícolas y pecuarias.

ALEXIS FRANCISCO se dedica a la agricultura,además también a la crianza de animales. Solicita el crédito para comprar insumos, urea, abono agrícola, ranger y comprar pollos.

Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar lo que le hace falta para las siembras. Las compras las hará en la ciudad de Ventanas. 

El sueño es comprar terrenos. Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta es la competencia.
En el tiempo libre le gusta hacer deporte.
texts.en:
Alexis Francisco, 21, is single and has no children.  He lives with his father in the city of Ventanas, Los Ríos Province.  He’s a member of the “16 de Agosto” communal bank located in Recinto Agua de Mocache belonging to Mocache Canton.  They work in agriculture and animal husbandry.

Alexis Francisco works in agriculture and also raises animals.  He’s asking for the loan to buy supplies, urea, manure, Ranger [herbicide] and to buy chicks.  With help from the loan he will be able to buy what he needs for his crops.  He will make his purchases in the city of Ventanas.

His dream is to buy land and the challenge he faces is competition.  In his free time he enjoys playing sports.

loans.use: to buy supplies, urea, manure, Ranger and chicks.

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en: Rosita is 58 years old, married and has three grown children. She lives in a rural community with her family where they farm and raise livestock for sale. Since it is the major source of their income, they have aimed to improve their farming business so that it generates sufficient income for their family. Due to financial difficulties, Rosita has specifically aimed to improve her hog-raising business in order to increase her income. She has been in this business for almost eight years but she has only raised four hogs for fattening. She planned to acquire additional piglets to raise but she does not have enough capital; therefore she is asking for a loan of PHP 45,000 to buy feed, vitamins and additional piglets to raise. Rosita mentioned that this loan will enable her to implement her plans and hopes that it will also enable her to satisfy her family’s needs and support the schooling of her grandchildren. She believes that her patience and sacrifices will bear good fruit someday.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins and additional piglets to raise

loans.name: J Jesús Manuel

texts.es:
Esta nuevamente solicitando un préstamo para poder comprar un equipo de sonido, ya que fue victima de robo en su negocio se llevaron su herramienta de trabajo. Es por eso que esta solicitando el préstamo y poder comprar el equipo de sonido y mandar hacer los trajes que le están haciendo falta, ya que tiene unos eventos de concursos de bailes típicos mexicanos aquí en la ciudad de Nuevo Laredo.
El señor J Jesús Manuel y su esposa tiene cuatro hijos ya grandes de edad todos unos profesionales. Planea pagar el crédito con la pensión que recibe por sus servicios como maestro en varias escuelas, ya que su esposa se encargara de los gastos familiares con el sueldo que recibe como maestra de secundaria.
Desea mejorar su negocio de baile regional  y pronto poder concursar en varios partes de México y también en Estados Unidos.
Espera nueva mente contar con su cooperación en este crédito
texts.en:
He’s requesting a loan to be able to buy sound equipment because he was a robbery victim and lost all his work tools.  This is why he’s requesting a loan to be able to buy sound equipment and t have all the costumes made that he needs because he has scheduled traditional Mexican dance contests in the city of Nuevo Laredo.

J. Jesús Manuel and his wife have four children who are all professional adults now.  He plans to repay the loan with the salary he earns for services rendered in several schools since his wife will take care of family expenses with the salary she earns as a secondary school teacher.

He wants to improve his regional dance business and to soon be able to compete in various parts of Mexico and in the United States.  He hopes once again to have your cooperation for this loan.

loans.use: to buy equipment.

loans.name: Maria Antonieta

texts.es:
MARIA ANTONIETA tiene 39 años de edad de estado civil unión libre tiene tres hijos, vive con los hijos y con el conyugue en Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos.

Es integrante de la VRC 16 DE AGOSTO, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Agua de Mocache, pertenece al Cantón Mocache se dedican a labores agrícolas y pecuarias.

 MARIA ANTONIETA se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz. Solicita el crédito para comprar urea, ranger, insecticidas, líquido mata maleza.

Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar lo que le hace falta para los cultivos. Las compras las hará en la ciudad de Ventanas y en Mocache. 

El sueño es comprar un carro. Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta son las plagas cómo la langosta.
En el tiempo libre le gusta hacer las actividades del hogar.
texts.en:
María Antonieta, 39, is in a common law relationship and has three children.  She lives with her children and spouse in Ventanas, Los Ríos Province.  She’s a member of the “16 de Agosto” communal bank located in Recinto Agua de Mocache belonging to Mocache Canton.  They carry out agriculture and animal husbandry activities.

María Antonieta works growing corn.  She’s asking for the loan to buy urea, Ranger [herbicide], insecticide and liquid weed killer.  With help from the loan she will be able to buy what she needs.  She’ll make her purchases in Ventanas and Mocache.

Her dream is to buy a car.  The challenge she faces is plant infestations.  In her free time she enjoys doing things at home.

loans.use: to buy urea, Ranger, insecticide and liquid weed killer.

loans.name: Ma.gigi

texts.en:
Ma. Gigi is a married woman with 14-year-old son. She hails from Baclayon, Bohol. For the past seven years, she has run a sari-sari (variety) store and she earns 5,000 PHP from her business.

Ma. Gigi is requesting a loan to buy merchandise such as canned goods, noodles, soap, sugar, and coffee. In the future, she would like to expand her sari-sari store business and provide a quality education of her son.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, noodles, soap, sugar, and coffee

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy merchandise (rice, beans, and soft drinks, among other items) to start his own grocery store.

loans.name: Poverty Eradication Group

texts.en:
Isha is a single mother of eight children. She is divorced from her husband who had another wife. Five of Isha's children attend school and she also supports two additional dependants who are orphans. After her husband abandoned her, Isha opened a restaurant and also works as a cook at functions. Her business helps her to meet her family's needs single-handedly. Isha's main business challenge is debtors who eat food on credit, customers who pilfer utensils, and the fluctuation in food prices.

Isha is requesting a loan to buy cooking utensils and raw foods and sodas for the restaurant. She is a member of a loan group, which, as their name suggests, is geared toward eradicating poverty in their households. Despite challenges, Isha is determined to change the future of her family. In this photo, Isha is seated second seated from the right. Only 11 of the 13 group members are pictured because two members were absent with apology from the group meeting although the did sign the waiver form.

loans.use: to buy cooking utensils and raw foods and sodas for her restaurant

loans.name: Danilo

texts.en:
Danilo is 31 years old and is married to Laarnie. To make a living, he owns and operates a farm where he raises crops. Laarnie is also a farmer. Danilo earns a living from planting and harvesting rice and has been engaged in his business for over 20 years. He earned approximately 35,000 PHP with his last crop. 

Danilo is requesting a 50,000 PHP loan to purchase seeds, fertilizer, and insecticide for his rice farming business. He dreams that his business will become more productive so he can give his family a improved standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizer, and insecticide for his rice farming business

loans.name: Shqiponja

texts.en:
Shqiponja, this wonderful and hard-working Egyptian lady, lives in the outskirts of a major city in southern Albania. She is in her mid-forties. She was widowed a long ago and has two children. They are 23 and 20 years old, and she raised them almost all on her own. Shqiponja says that being a single parent and coming from the most vulnerable ethnic community means extreme poverty, and "It was not easy at all.  Yet through luck, I was supported and respected by all sorts of people who knew me, and that gave me the strength to carry on with my mission of raising my children.”

“I started my own agricultural farming business, producing mostly white beans, potatoes, grains, and veggies about six years ago, and I can say that I have made an income that has helped me with the basics. I have had a horse to do the transportation from the field to the market, yet it is growing older, and I don’t want to use it as much as before,” Shqiponja continues. 

Shqiponja is requesting a loan now to purchase a horse so that she can use it for the transportation of her agricultural products.

loans.use: To buy a horse for the transportation of agricultural products from the field to the local market

loans.name: Lily

texts.en:
Lily is 57 years old and lives in Punta, Liloy, Zamboanga del Norte. She is married with 5 children.

Lily works in the fish industry and sells fish for living. She has been doing this for 22 years. She has requested a loan of 14,900 PHP to puchase more fish to sell.

Lily has been a member of PMPC for 3 years. In the future, Lily hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: To puchase more fish to sell

loans.name: Dioscora

texts.en:
Dioscora is 58 years old and is married with 12 children. She lives in Dansalan, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte. For the past five years, Dioscora has bought and sold charcoal to earn a living and she earns 5,000 PHP doing this type of work. Dioscora has been a member of PMPC for three years.

Dioscora is requesting a 14,900 PHP loan to buy more sacks of charcoal to sell. In the future, she hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: buy sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Esperanza

texts.en:
Esperanza is 55 years old and lives in Dela Paz, Panaon,  Misamis Occidental. She is married and has 3 children.

Esperanza is engaged in a gardening business; she grows squash, okra, string beans, and cucumbers. Esperanza earns approximately PHP 8,000 each month from this business. She has requested a loan to purchase canned seed and fertilizers for her business.
 
Esperanza has been a member of PMPC for 6 years, and hopes to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: purchase seeds and fertilizers for her gardening business

loans.name: Ricafort

texts.en:
This is Ricafort, 48, a resident of Manila, Philippines. He is married to Lucia and a father to her children. He and his wife manage their own household while also operating the business. At this time, he is working hard to continually provide income for his everyday expenses.

Ricafort operates a business buying and selling cars. What he basically does is buy second-hand cars from sellers, then he upgrades or repairs them and sells them for a profit. Cars can range from lower-end to updated models. Customers are attracted to buy due to the fair selling prices he offers. His regular customers are people who wanted to acquire a vehicle in their local community. Ricafort earns a minimum of PHP 10,000 in sales every month.

To help him continue operations of his business, Ricafort is requesting a PHP 50,000 loan. He will be utilizing the loan to do repairs and upgrades on cars that he buys. He expects a boost in his business income as he expands his business. Ricafort dreams of expanding his business in the coming years. He faithfully meets up with his co-fellowship members to share stories of his work every week, and it is where he can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for second-hand cars in his business.

loans.name: Apple Jean

texts.en:
Apple Jean is 27 years old and married with two children. She lives in Poblacion, Titay, Zamboanga, Sibugay. For the past three years, she has been selling ready-to-wear clothing and she earns 7,000 PHP each month. Apple Jean is a new member of PMPC.

Apple Jean is requesting a 9,000 PHP loan to purchase more ready-to-wear clothing to sell. In the future, she hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more ready-to-wear clothing to sell

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy scrap for her husband's scrap-selling business

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy embroidery material for her embroidery business

loans.name: Guillermo Ezequiel

texts.es:
Guillermo tiene 24 años de edad, es soltero. Desde hace tres años es empleado en una ONG. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación a Campo, es para terminar de construir dos habitaciones en su casa y para pago de mano de obra; debido a que el dinero que tenia ahorrado para ese fin ya se le termino. Con el crédito podrá terminar de construir las habitaciones, pues él ahorro durante tres años para iniciar la construcción ya no tiene fondos para continuar por su propia cuenta. Así tendrán más privacidad, pues él duerme con sus hermanos y él desea tener comodidad. Pues debe de esperar que su mamá y sus hermanos se vistan para ingresar a la habitación. Más adelante desea construir una habitación más y un corredor a su casa e instalarle un pequeño negocio a su mamá.
texts.en:
Guillermo is 24 years old and single. For the past three years he has worked for ONG.
The loan that he is requesting from the Countryside Foundation will be used to finish building two bedrooms and pay for workers to do this, as the money he has saved for construction has been spent. With this loan he can finish building these rooms. He saved for three years in order to start construction and now he doesn’t have funds left to finish construction. He would like more privacy. He currently sleeps with his brothers and he wants to be more comfortable. He would like his mother and brothers to see the results of his investment in his house. In the future he would like to build one more bedroom and connect it to his house with a hallway. He would like to build a business for his mother.

loans.use: to finish building two bedrooms in his house and to pay for construction workers to do this work.

loans.name: Florenda

texts.en:
Florenda is a hardworking mother who engages in a tailoring business to generate income. She is 58 years old and has five adult children. She and her husband aim to improve their status of living to satisfy their needs and give their children a better life. Florenda has been operating the business for almost 22 years and usually earns a profit of PHP 12,000 a month that she has utilized for their daily consumption and allowances for her children in school. 

Being a patient and industrious mother, Florenda educated most of her children with the help of her husband. At present, her business is still existing and she wants to improve and strengthen it to continuously earn sufficient income for their family. To improve the business, she is asking for an additional capital of PHP 50,000.00 to buy threads, buttons, zippers, machine oil, needles, tape measure and hook & eye clasps needed in dressmaking. She mentioned that this financial assistance will be a great help for her to improve the business and she is hoping that she will make more improvements in the future.

loans.use: to buy threads, buttons, zippers, machine oil, needles, tape measure and hook & eye clasps needed in dressmaking

loans.name: Maria De Lourdes

texts.es: María de estado civil soltera, tiene 1 hija.  Ella cuenta que comenzó de a poquita mercadería  de ropa interior. Su sueño es ampliar su negocio y brindarles trabajo a personas que no tengan trabajo. María trabaja de 8:00am hasta las 16:00pm. Con el préstamo comprara mercadería como: ropa interior femenina, ropa interior masculina y ropa interior de niños
texts.en: María is single and has one daughter. She says that she started with a small amount of undergarment merchandise. Her dream is to expand her business and bring work to people who do not have jobs. María works from 8:00am to 4:00pm. With this loan, she will buy merchandise such as men's, women's, and children's undergarments.

loans.use: to buy men's, women's, and children's undergarments

loans.name: Sarantsetseg

texts.en: Mrs. Sarantsetseg is a 45-year-old woman who lives with her husband and three children in a little house in Arkhangai province of Mongolia. She started her business in 1995 by selling dairy products at retail price. Since then, she continued her business. Now she produces dairy products and sells to the food market of Ulaanbaatar city and local market. Mrs.Sarantsetseg is planning to expand her production. She is a diligent and hardworking woman. She is requesting a 6,000,000 MNT loan to increase her turnover capital and buy more raw materials for her dairy products production and sales.

loans.use: To increase her turnover capital and buy more raw materials for her dairy products production and sales

loans.name: Raul Antonio

texts.es: Raúl tiene 25 años de edad estado civil soltero, no tiene hijo. Empezó hace 5 años vendiendo cloro y después comenzó con desinfectantes y aromatizantes .El trabaja durante la tarde 13:00pm hasta 17:00pm: tener su propia casa en una ciudadela  y tener su propio almacén de productos. Con el préstamo él quiere comprar: cloro , suavitel, materiales químicos etc.
texts.en: Raúl is 25 years old and single; he does not have any children. Five years ago, he began selling bleach, and then he began with disinfectants and liquid flavoring. He works in the afternoon from 1pm to 5pm. He hopes to have his own house and residential area, and to have his own shop for his products. With the loan, Raúl wants to buy bleach, Suavitel fabric softener, chemical materials, etc.

loans.use: to buy bleach, Suavitel fabric softener, chemical materials, etc.

loans.name: Osacar Santiago

texts.es: Oscar tiene 32 años estado civil soltero, tiene 1 hija .empezó con la venta de churritos cuando el tenia 19 años. Ese es su trabajo en la actualidad y también tiene un negocio de venta de zapatillas. Su sueño es comprarse un carro y ponerlo en una cooperativa de taxi. Con el préstamo él quiere comprar: harina,huevos, azúcar, etc.
texts.en: Oscar is 32 years old and single. He has one daughter. He has been selling churros (donuts) since he was 19 years old. This is his primary job. He also sells sandals. His dream is to buy a car and join a cooperative of taxi drivers. With this loan he will buy flour, sugar, etc.

loans.use: to buy flour, eggs, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Alvaro

texts.es: El joven Alvaro se desempeña como responsable de compras para una empresa privada desde hace 4 años desempeñandose con gran responsabilidad y honestidad, su esposa se encarga de los quehaceres del hogar y de cuidar su bebe, son una familia muy unida. Este es su primer credito que solicita para comprar una computadora portatil y pagar gastos de estudios de su esposa quien se encuentra cursando clases de Belleza, son una familia que han luchado para salir adelante y gozar de mejores condiciones, ademàs de su salario el obtiene ingresos de la compra de raices y tuberculos;  su sueño es construir  su propia vivienda con mejores condiciones, que su hijo goze de salud y que su familia permanezca unida.
texts.en:
This young man, Alvaro, is responsible for purchasing for a private business. For the past four years, he has taken on this position with great responsibility and integrity. His wife is in charge of household responsibilities and taking care of their baby. They are a very close family. 

This is the first loan that Alvaro is requesting to buy a laptop computer and to pay his wife's school expenses, who is taking beauty classes. They are a family that has fought to move forward and enjoy better conditions. In addition to his salary, he earns income from buying roots and tubers. His dream is to build his own home with better conditions, that his son be healthy, and that his family remain close.

loans.use: to buy a computer and pay school expenses.

loans.name: Julio Cesar

texts.es: Julio Cesar de  50 anos de edad. Casado con tres de 25,23, 6 anos. De los cuales el hijo menor esta bajo su responsabilidad, los mayores trabaja y son independiente. Julio es originario del departamento de Chinandega, lugar que esta ubicado en el occidente del país. Julio tiene por actividad económica la venta de mercadería en general la cual consiste en comprar y vender, pantalones, blusas, camisetas, vestidos, faldas, ropa interior. El negocio esta ubica en su casa y forma ambulante. La rutina diaria de Julio es trabajar ambulantemente unas 10 horas diarias a ofrecer su mercadería a sus clientes fijos y eventuales el cual deja de crédito y recupera quincenalmente. El negocio surgió hace 3 anos por la necesidad de tener una fuente de trabajo para brindarle a su familia estabilidad económica.  Con los préstamos que fundación león 2000 le ha brindaba y poco a poco fue creciendo y haciendo clientela. Él ha demostrado su responsabilidad de pago en tiempo y forma. Julio agradece a los inversionistas kiva la ayuda que les brindan a personas de escasos recurso y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de vida digno.
texts.en: Julius Cesar is fifty years old. He is married with three children, ages 25, 23 and 6. The youngest child is still a dependent. The older two have jobs and are independent. Julius is from Chinandega Province. This is located in the west of the country. Julio works selling general merchandise. He buys and sells pants, blouses, shirts, dresses, skirts and underwear. His business is located in his house and he sells door-to-door. His daily routine consists of going door-to-door selling his goods to his regular customers. He provides them with credit and collects the payments every fifteen days. He began this business three years ago in order to have a way to provide economic support for his family. With the loans that have been provided by the Leon 2000 Foundation, he has been able to grow his business and gain more customers. He has paid his payments on time and as required. Julio is thankful to the investors from KIVA for the help that they provide to people with scarce resources and to countries like Nicaragua. It gives us a dignified life.

loans.use: to have working capital and to buy merchandise such as pants, blouses, shirts, skirts and underwear.

loans.name: Oscar Arnulfo

texts.es:
Oscar, se le presento la necesidad de invertir más en el negocio de compra y venta de leña, es por eso que nos está solicitando un nuevo préstamo para la compra de leña por mayor, para la venta de todas las tortilleras de la zona, este prestamo le dara los recursos para que Oscar realice una buena inversion al negocio.

El nos comenta que con el préstamo le ayudo a incrementar sus inventarios y por ende tener mejores ingresos, sus condiciones económicas han mejorado pero no lo suficiente ya que desea seguir trabajando.
texts.en:
Oscar finds that he needs to invest more money in his business of buying and selling firewood. This is why he is asking for a loan to buy firewood at a wholesale level. He sells to all the tortilla shops in the zone. This loan will give Oscar the resources to invest in his business. 
Oscar told us that this loan would help him increase his inventory and therefore have more income. His economic conditions have improved but they are not sufficient for his desire to continue with his work.

loans.use: to buy wood on a wholesale level.

loans.name: Maa Sublen Group

texts.en:
This group is composed of six members from a small rural village called Barpadar in the district of Nuapada of Odisha – one of the backward districts in India, mainly known as a drought-prone area of underdevelopment. 

The lady sitting third from right, raising her hand in the photo, is one of the members named Prema. She is 50 years old, living with her husband; one son, age 25; and her daughter-in-law, age 22. Prema hails from the very poor, landless, illiterate Schedule Caste (SC) Below Poverty Line category. She is running a rope-making, procuring and selling business. This is a traditional business in her community. Previously, the people of this community used to make rope from cow and buffalo skin. Due to social restrictions and progressive mindset, this has been replaced with plastic rope. These items are specially used to fasten domestic animals like cows, buffaloes, sheep and goats. 

Her husband and son help Prema in all aspects of the business from the processing part to selling of the products in different weekly markets in her locality. Her entire family works 8-10 hours daily making these items. Her husband covers six weekly markets a week by using public transport and a bicycle for selling the products. Apart from this, her husband also goes collecting raw materials from different contractors and builders which is a very time-consuming task and hampers the production. In a week, her family earns 1,500 to 2,000 Indian rupees (INR) which is not sufficient to manage her family.

Prema wants to increase her income by adding some extra stock of empty cement bags and a self transport facility. She wants to have enough stock to allow her business to run throughout the year smoothly. Prema wants to utilize the present loan to purchase more stock of empty cement bags and to procure ready-made products from her locality.

Prema dreams of having a bike for transporting and marketing her products as per her own sweet will. She also wants to construct a house, as her family is living jointly in a small house. 

The other five members of her group (Kshyanaprabha, Dukhli, Bandei, Bilash and Bhumisuta) belong to the same community and are doing a similar business related to rope-making and selling.

loans.use: to pay for purchasing empty cement bags and procurement of ready-made items.

loans.name: Oscar Elias

texts.es:
Oscar, necesita capital para invertir en el cultivo de granos básicos, es por eso que esta nuevamente esta  solicitándonos un crédito, que le ayudara en la compra de tres sacos de abono para mejorar su cultivo y brindarles un mejor grano a sus clientes.

El nos dice que el préstamo anterior le ayudo a mejorar sus cultivos, ahora tiene una mejor capacidad de inversión  y su economía aumento para tener una vida agradable junto a su familia.
texts.en:
Oscar needs working capital to buy supplies to grow grain. This is why he is asking for a new loan, which he will use to buy three sacks of fertilizer. Fertilizer will improve his crop yield and give his customers a better quality of grain.
He told us that the last loan helped make his crops better. Now he has a larger income and is able to provide a better quality of life for his family.

loans.use: to buy three sacks of fertilizer.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
This is Helen. She previously accessed a PHP24,000 loan that she used to purchase quantities and varieties of grocery items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for her children’s education, in their personal, house hold and business expenditures. 

Helen would like to apply for another PHP25,000 loan so she can buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result for better profit. Her profits from the business will definitely help to sustain her family’s daily needs and her children’s education expenses. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Helen hopes to be able to expand soon and dreams of being able to give her family a good future through all her hard work with her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week; here she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to purchase grocery items and other products to sell in her store

loans.name: Tessie

texts.en:
Tessie is married with five children. She is 55 years old and lives in Poblacion, Titay, Zamboanga Sibugay.

Tessie sells ready-to-wear dresses to earn a living. She has had this business for 12 years. Each month, she earns 12,000 PHP doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 9000 PHP to purchase more ready-to-wear products to retail.

Tessie is a new member of PMPC. In the future, she hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more ready-to-wear products to sell

loans.name: Petrus

texts.en:
Petrus, 19 years old, was born in Tual (Ambon), Maluku. His family lives in Galaidubu Village, Kepulauan Aru District. His father works as a farmer with a very low income (around 500,000 Indonesian rupiah per month) that covers their daily needs only. So his parents can’t help Petrus to continue his education. 

Petrus wants to change his family’s future for the better. So he asked for this loan to pay for his education fees at the Maritime Academy, because he knows and imagines that, if he can finish his education in the Maritime Academy, he will find a good job in the shipping company and get a good salary too. Then he will help his parents to provide an opportunity for his siblings to get an education at a higher level like him. 

Do you want to help Petrus make his dream come true?

loans.use: to pay education fees for three years

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert is a mechanic and owns his own garage, which has been in existence for the past five years. He earns a monthly income of 8,000 KES. The business improved well, and he was able to offer good service to his customers. 

He has requested a second loan of 16,000 KES to pay school fees for his child. He hopes to grow his business, and for this he will use the anticipated income.

His dream is to see his children get the best education.

loans.use: To pay school fees for his child.

loans.name: Sarvodaya Group

texts.en: Sarvodaya ("Overall Development"), a Joint Liability Group, was formed in the year 2010 by four active women of Khariar town of Nuapada district in Odisha, India. Nuapada district is known for drought and backwardness. Sunita is one of the members of this group, standing second from the left with a raised hand. She is 33 years of age and lives with her husband; one son, age 3; her father-in-law and mother in-law. Sunita has been running a small mirror-cutting and binding unit in her house and a photo framing shop for the last five years with the active support of her husband. Her husband goes to a wholesale market 200 kilometres away twice in a month and brings back raw materials like mirrors, framing items and cardboard. In her unit, she has engaged two workers for cutting and binding mirrors of different sizes as per the orders of the traders. She supplies these mirrors wholesale to five traders from the same town and one trader from a nearby town. From this business she earns a monthly income of 6,000 to 7,000 Indian rupees (INR). With her previous loans, Sunita has taken a cabin in the heart of the town for marketing her products as well as photo framing. This is her fourth loan and Sunita wants to purchase a photo lamination machine as well as mirrors and binding materials for the smooth running of her business. This will reduce the transportation costs and she will be able to work for a long period. She expects a good return from this investment for the total development of her business. With this extra income, she is planning to repair and renovate the cutting and binding unit she is running in a temporary shed. Sunita hopes to open a mirror showroom in the market with quality products. The other three members of this group are Sanjukta, Sannu and Premalata. They are running a grocery shop, small restaurant and X-ray center respectively.

loans.use: to pay for purchasing a photo lamination machine, mirrors, cardboard and binding materials.

loans.name: Munhtsetseg

texts.en:
A diligent and honest woman, Munhtsetseg is 45 years old and lives with her two children in a ger in Hovd province, Mongolia. Her older daughter, Ariuntungalag, is nineteen years old and a college student. Her younger daughter, Ariuntuya, is eighteen years old and a secondary school student.

In 2000 Munhtsetseg rented a counter in the market and started selling fruits and vegetables. She still does so, importing her fresh produce from close to the Mongolian border.

Munhtsetseg is applying for a 3,300,000 MNT loan from XacBank. She plans to reserve fruit now when prices are the lowest and sell them later when prices go up.

loans.use: To reserve fruit now so as to sell it later at a higher price.

loans.name: Thimothy

texts.en:
Thimothy is 26 years old, married and the father of one child. For the last six years he has earned a living by selling goods for daily living from his shop. He earns a monthly income of 25,000 KES.

Thimothy was introduced to KADET LTD by one of its credit officers. He is applying for his fourth loan, this time for 100,000 KES, to buy additional stocks of soft drinks, cooking oil, bales of maize flour and wheat flour to sell to his customers.

Thimothy plans to use the profits made possible by this loan to pay his child's school fees. His goal for the future is to continue growing his business so that he can give his family a good and stable life.

loans.use: to buy additional stock for his shop.

loans.name: Rozel

texts.en: Due to financial difficulty, Rozel engages in a hog-raising business to generate additional income for her family. She is 34 years old and has two school-aged children. They plan to improve their poor living condition to educate their children and give them a better life. In this regard, she plans to raise more piglets and sell them in the future. Due to insufficient capital, she is asking for an additional P38,000.00 to buy additional piglets, feed, and vitamins needed in hog-raising. Despite problems and difficulties in life, she has the determination to improve the business and hopes that someday she will make the business grow and be a viable source of income to continue sending their children to school and give them a bright future.

loans.use: to buy additional piglets, feed, and vitamins needed in hog-raising.

loans.name: Nawal

texts.en:
Due to cultural reasons, Nawal prefers that her photo is not on the Internet; thus the above photo is of her son.

Nawal is a 51-year-old married female from Al Russeifeh, Jordan, with one child. She requested a 500 JOD loan to open a beauty (hairdressing) salon inside her home. In the future, she is planning to open a separate beauty salon, increase her income and improve the living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to open a beauty salon

loans.name: Soeurn's Group

texts.en: Soeurn, a rural villager from Sa Ang district, is 65 years old and has eight children. She supports her household through rice-cropping on two and a half hectares of farmland. The current business earns her about 18,000 KHR per day. Her past loan was the original loan that she has applied for with VisionFund and has successfully paid back. Now she is with a third-cycle loan in the same group. For this cycle, both group members are seeking the same loan amount of 1,000,000 KHR each. As a group leader, she is going to use her portion to buy rice seed, fertilizer, and insecticide, and to pay for the plowing fee. She hopes to earn more income from her current business so as she can fix and redecorate her house.

loans.use: to buy rice seed, fertilizer, and insecticide, and to pay for plowing fee.

loans.name: Merly

texts.en:
This is Merly, 39, resident of Payatas, Philippines. She is married to Efren, a driver, and is a mother to her children. With her husband she manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Merly operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store that retails groceries, toiletries, and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php 5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns money by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php 500 in sales every day.

To help her continue business operations, she is requesting a Php 40,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries, and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Merly dreams of giving her family a good life and hopes to give her children a good and quality education through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: La Morita Group

texts.es: Socias formada por tres microempresarias de éxito una de ellas es Jessica que vende cosméticos de la Avon, bisuterías y cosas de manualidades, actividad que lleva 6 años, lleva dos préstamos en nuestra institución y ella  misma lo atiende su negocio. El objetivo del nuevo préstamo lo invertirá en cosméticos, accesorios para las bisuterías como piedras preciosas de fantasías, broches, etc. Doña Manuela Petrona vende ropa nueva y usada, Wendy vende fritanga en su domicilio, puesto de frutas y bisuterías como colas, prensa pelo etc.
texts.en:
This group consists of three successful micro-entrepreneurs. One of them is Jessica who sells Avon cosmetics, trinkets, and handcrafted items. She has been in business for six years and has received two loans from ADIM to help manage her business. Her goal with this new loan is to invest in cosmetics, trinket accessories such as precious stones, brooches, and other items.

Doña Manuela Petrona sells new and used clothing. Wendy sells fried foods from her home, but she also has a fruit stand and sells trinkets such as hair clips, curling irons, and other items.

loans.use: to buy Avon cosmetics, precious stones, brooches, and other items.

loans.name: Ra'edah

texts.en:
Ra'edah is a 26-year-old married female from Al Aqaba in Jordan. She has requested a 400 Jordan dinar (JOD) loan to pay for cosmetics and perfumes to retail. She is planning to buy goods and sell them to her colleagues at work. In the future, Ra'edah is looking forward to expanding her project.

Since Ra'edah is under 30 years old, her loan is considered a youth loan.

loans.use: to pay for cosmetics to retail.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy fruits and cold drinks for selling.

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
This is Arlene, 42, a resident of Payatas, Philippines. She is married to Milo, a driver, and is a mother of her children. She, together with her children, manages their own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Arlene retails processed meat products. What she basically does is buy processed meat products from wholesalers, then she sell them per piece/pack with a profit. Products can range from ham to hot dogs, processed pork and other products of the like. Customers are attracted to buy due to the low selling prices and the many options she offers. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of 300 Philippines pesos (Php) in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 19,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more quantities and varieties of products to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Arlene hopes to be able to expand soon, as she dreams to be able to give her children a good and high quality education through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week, and this is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional stocks of supplies and products needed in her meat-selling business.

loans.name: Karemah

texts.en:
Karemah is a 28-year-old married female from Al Aqaba in Jordan. She has requested a 500 JOD loan to pay for cleaning supplies for retail sale. She is planning to sell to her neighbors, and in the future she would like to expand her project.

Since Karemah is under 30 years old, her loan is considered a youth loan.

loans.use: to pay for cleaning supplies for retail sale

loans.name: Luis Ernesto

texts.es:
Luis tiene 55 años vive al lado de su esposa, la cual es su fuerza y sobre todo quien le da ánimo para seguir y salir adelante, la vivienda de Luis se encuentra en la ciudad de Ica, la cual se caracteriza por tener un clima muy cálido y acogedor, asimismo  se desarrolla la agricultura y la ganadería. Luis es un hombre muy trabajador, día a día traba en su parcela en la cual ha sembrado algodón, el trabaja alrededor de 9 horas al día y sobre todo le gusta mucho su trabajo por ello el cree que le va bien, porque lo trabaja de buena manera y muchos ánimos.

Luis está muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá comprar abono, fertilizantes, así como también cubrir los gastos de riego y limpieza de la parcela, de esta manera el podrá tener una buena cosecha y podrá seguir luchando cada día para poder hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Tener una hacienda”.
texts.en:
Luis is 55 years old. He lives with his wife who is his strength and gives him the energy to persevere and to succeed. Their home is in the city of Ica, which is known for its warm and comfortable climate; therefore, its main industries are agriculture and cattle ranching. Luis is a hardworking man. During the day, he works on his land growing cotton for around nine hours a day. He likes his work because he thinks he will do well due to his good spirits and his good techniques. 

Luis is very thankful to the Kiva microlenders because thanks to their help he has been able to buy fertlizer and pay for the cleaning and watering of his land. This way he will be able to have a better harvest and continue working towards making his dream of owning a ranch come true.

loans.use: purchase of fertilizers, manure, and watering fees among other things

loans.name: Verginia

texts.en:
This is Verginia, 36, a resident of Payatas, Philippines. She is married to Leonardo, a carpenter, and is an active mother to her children. She together with her husband manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Verginia operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages by small units to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, five PHP worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns profit by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 25,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Verginia dreams to give her family a good life. She hopes to give her children high quality education through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her work. Here she can also draw strength and inspiration from the study of the Word of God.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Nelly Consuelo

texts.es:
La  Señora Nelly  tiene 50 años de edad, vive en unión libre con su esposo, su núcleo familiar lo compone su esposo y un nieto,  reside en el Municipio de Santa Rita, Departamento de Yoro.
Doña Nelly inicio su negocio de pulpería hace 20 años, ella vende granos básicos, productos de aseo y limpieza, medicinas, golosinas, dulces y refrescos.
En la actualidad doña Nelly ha solicitado un crédito por la cantidad de  11,000 para adquirir más variedad de productos y ampliar su inventario.
Considera que con el apoyo financiero obtenido ha mejorado sus ingresos, lo cual le ayudara a mejorar su estatus de vida y a crecer su negocio.
texts.en:
Sra. Nelly is 50 years old and in a common-law relationship with her husband. Her immediate family consists of her husband and a grandson. They reside in the town of Santa Rita, Department of Yoro.

Doña Nelly started her grocery business 20 years ago. She sells basic grains, cleaning and hygiene products, medicines, snacks, candy, and soft drinks. At the moment, Doña Nelly is requesting a loan in the amount of 11,000 HNL so that she can acquire a wider variety of products in order to expand her inventory. She believes that the financial support she will receive will help to increase her earnings. This should help her with improving her living status and growing her business.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, meat, bread, and canned goods.

loans.name: Ousaphea's Group

texts.en:
Ousaphea, 31 years old, is a villager living in Kampong Cham province’s Tbaung Khmum district in Cambodia. She is married and blessed with two lovely daughters. Ousaphea and her husband earn their living through farming rice on one and a half hectares of farmland. This rice-farming business enables Ousaphea to earn around 20,000 KHR per day, but she can only save approximately 5,000 KHR of that amount due to covering the daily cost of living. 

Ousaphea’s group consists of two female members, each of whom are first-time borrowers with Kiva's partner, VisionFund. She is leading her group to apply for a loan in the amount of 500,000 KHR each. As a group leader, she will use her loan portion to buy fertilizers to support her rice field. Her hope in the future is that her rice field will provide her with higher and better quality crop yields so that she can sell them for better prices.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers to support her rice field

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Reynaldo

texts.en:
Reynaldo is a 39 year old man from Maribojoc, Bohol in the Philippines. He has been in the sari-sari (variety) store business for seventeen years. Reynaldo sells items like rice, corn, soft drinks, canned goods and coconut wine. 

Reynaldo is requesting a loan of 18,000 PHP to buy more merchandise like rice, corn, canned goods, noodles and soft drinks. Reynaldo would like to expand his sari-sari store business to support his family.
