Абдурахмон имеет средне - специальное образование, он шафер. По специальности Абдурахмон несколько лет как не работает. Он более шести лет зарабатывает путем разведения крупнорогатого скота. Абдурахмон разводит скот у себя дома. Он создал хорошие условия для животноводство. 
Абдурахмон просит кредит для закупа бычков.
texts.en:
Abdurahmon lives in the town of Dangara. He is 45 years old. He is married and has six children: three sons and three daughters. The eldest son temporarily works in the Russian Federation; one daughter is married; and four other children are still in secondary school.

Abdurahmon has received a technical education. He is a driver. It has been several years since he stopped working in his profession. For over six years, he has been raising cattle. Abdurahmon raises cattle near his home. He has created good conditions for his livestock.
Abdurahom is requesting a credit in order to buy  some bull calves.

loans.use: to buy cattle.

loans.name: Bador Group

texts.en:
This group is called Bador and is comprised of four ladies. They applied for a loan of 80,000 Yemeni Rial (YER). 

Hanan lives in Hodeida, Yemen. She is the second woman on the right in the photo. She is 24 years old and single. 

She has been selling clothes and incense for ladies. She is a professional in this field and her goods are required in the market. She started her business with little capital. 

Hanan is applying for a youth loan of 20,000 YER to buy clothes. Her extra income from the loan will be added to her savings to expand her business and improve the living standards of the family. Her dream is to expand her business in order to sell different products.

loans.use: to buy clothes for her business

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is single with three children. and two go to school. She has two additional family members (mother and father). 

She sells green bananas at the market. She sells her products on a retail basis. She also owns a motorcycle where she earns additional income.  She has been in her business for the past 10 years. She works seven days a week.  

She has requested  a loan of UGX 300,000 from MCDT – SACCO to buy more bunches of green bananas. Her major business challenges are thieves and seasonality. 

Her goals and aspirations are to become a wholesaler and to build a house. She lives in a rented house, and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

loans.use: To buy more bunches of green bananas.

loans.name: Sesilia

texts.en:
Sesilia is 41 years old and married, with four children. She has a small garden where she grows taro, bananas, and yams so she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for three years. 

Sesilia needs a loan to buy another wheelbarrow, a shovel, a rake, some bush knives, weed-killer spray, and more tiapula and to pay her children's school fees. She has been a member of SPBD since 2011. Sesilia will use the profits from her sales to improve her family assets.

loans.use: to buy a wheelbarrow, shovel, rake, bush knives, and weed killer.

loans.name: Jay Maa Dharitri Group

texts.en:
In the year 2010, four active ladies from a rural village called Nehena in the Nuapada district of Odisha, India, came out with an intention to add some extra income through their efforts and formed a joint liability group named Maa Dharitri, which means “Earth.” All four members belong to the "below poverty line" category. Gangabali is one of them. The lady sitting third from right with raised hand is Gangabali. She is a very active and cheerful. Her family consists of her husband, two daughters. age 15 and 13, and two sons, age 10 and 5. All her children are continuing their study.

Gangabali has been running a tailoring center with the help of her husband in her residence for 20 years. Her husband stitches ladies' and gents' garments and school uniforms. He also does repairing and alteration work. The neighbors and the local community are the regular customers of her tailoring center. She earns a minimum of 200 INR every day, which is not sufficient for managing the day-to-day expenses of her six-member family. So Gangabali wants to raise her income by increasing the volume of her business. At present Gangabali needs to purchase sewing materials such as fabric, which is essential for making clothing, some zippers, buttons, threads and hangers. This loan will provide necessary resources to complete her work in time to meet the customers' demands.
 
Gangabali has a strong desire to give a better education to her children and construct a separate cabin for her tailoring center. She has a dream to give her family a bright future through her hard work.

The other three members of the group are Dharitri, Saebani and Kanchan, whose businesses are screen printing, vegetable cultivation and Tiffin hotel.

loans.use: to pay for purchasing fabric, zippers, buttons, thread, etc.

loans.name: Julius

texts.en: Julius used the previous loan to buy bread, juice, and sodas to sell. He is 25 years old, married, and has two children. He lives in Kagadi, Uganda. Julius has been operating a retail shop for five years. He started by delivering bread from door to door and after saving enough profits he rented a room where he now operates and trades in a variety of home use products. His challenge is price fluctuations; his dreams are educating children and hiring employees to expand his business. Julius is requesting a loan to buy sugar, soap and cooking oil to sell.

loans.use: to buy sugar, soap and cooking oil to sell.

loans.name: Debra

texts.en:
The opening of The Pointed Roof Deli has been a long-time dream come true for Debra. 

Having an eye on her shop’s location since moving to her small, close-knit community over 11 years ago, Debra was always cooking up creative, new ideas for her future business. The time just never seemed right to start as she was busy working as an accountant in the corporate world.

One day, as Debra was driving home, she saw a “for lease” sign in front of her dream location and she knew it was the right time. She immediately got on the phone to secure the space. She involved her family every step of the way: They have helped with construction, property improvements, and other preparations. The local community has also rallied around the project, as there currently is no good deli and hang-out spot in town.

Debra will use her $10,000 Kiva loan for working capital and inventory needed to open. Once open, she does not want to just be another business in town, but hopes to become an integral part of community life.  

“I get a great feeling from contributing to the community,” Debra said. She wants The Pointed Roof to create jobs locally and provide a space where people would want to hang out. Furthermore, she will use only local venders, ensuring that she continues to support the community that has long supported her.

loans.use: to purchase inventory needed to open.

loans.name: San Jose Group

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Santaní, 11 mujeres se unieron con el propósito de ayudarse las unas a las otras y por medio de ese trabajo en conjunto poder salir adelante.
Todas las integrantes del grupo se dedican a la cría y venta de animales, como gallinas, ovejas, cerdos, patos y demás. Ellas cuentan que la fundación y su grupo les han ayudado mucho en todo, ya que están aprendiendo a trabajar juntas y también las capacitaciones les está siendo muy útil.
Nelly, la presidenta, solicita el crédito para la compra de balanceados, afrechos y demás alimentos para poder seguir alimentando a sus animales.
texts.en: In the city of Santaní, eleven women united with the purpose of helping each other so that they could get ahead together. All of the members of the group raise and sell animals like chickens, sheep, pigs, ducks and others. They rely on the foundation and their group which have helped them a lot with everything. They are already learning to work together and their trainings have been very useful for them. Nelly, the president, is requesting a loan to buy animal feed, bran and other nutrients to continue feeding her animals.

loans.use: to buy animal feed.

loans.name: Pindoty 1 Group

texts.es:
El comité “Pindoty I” está creciendo gracias a la ayuda de todas las miembros, ellas son mujeres luchadoras y día a día se esmeran al máximo ya que desean poder dejar atrás la pobreza.
Todas ellas se dedican a la cría y venta de cerdos, gallinas, patos y demás tipo de animales, son mujeres que pese a la pobreza quieren ayudar a sus familias por medio de su trabajo.
Evangelista pide el crédito para comprar balanceados para sus animales y de esa forma poder seguir dándoles una buena alimentación y cría.
texts.en:
The "Pindoty 1" committee is growing thanks to the help of all the members. They are hard-working women who work as hard as they can every day because they want to be able to leave poverty behind.
They all raise and sell hogs, hens, ducks, and other kinds of animals. They are women who, despite poverty, want to help their families through their work.
Evangelista is requesting this loan for the purchase of balanced feed for her animals so that she can keep feeding them well and raising them well.

loans.use: to buy balanced animal feed.

loans.name: Kuña Guapa Group

texts.es:
Kuña Guapa cada vez está creciendo más por el gran incentivo que tienen todas las miembros, ellas son mujeres jefas de familia que desean poder ayudar a los suyos y así mejorar la vida de toda su familia.
Maria es vendedora de chipa, que es un alimento típico paraguayo muy consumido. Ella vende su producto de forma ambulante y dice que le va muy bien, pero que el día de mañana sueña con poder tener un local propio y así poder seguir creciendo.
Solicita el crédito para la compra de chipa, para poder surtirse y seguir trabajando, así lo como lo ha venido haciendo siempre.
texts.en:
Kuña Guapa is growing more and more every day because of the initiative of each of the members. They are female heads of their families who want to be able to help their own and improve the lives of their entire families.
Maria sells chipa [small cheese-flavoured rolls], a very popular traditional Paraguayan food. She sells her products on the street and says that it is going very well, but that she dreams of someday having her own storefront in order to expand.
She is requesting this loan for the purchase of chipa in order to stock up and keep working as she always has.

loans.use: to buy chipa for sale.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is happily married, having three children. She is a responsible and resourceful woman. Her main goal is to have an increased income so she can send her youngest child on to a higher level of education. Her eldest son is a mechanic, while her daughter is a sales lady. Her family works together in order to earn a living.

Teresita has owned a retail store since 2004. She is really grateful to the Lord because her sacrifices have had a fruitful outcome.

Teresita plans to increase the volumes of her grocery sales, but because of insufficient funds, she is requesting a loan amount of PHP10,000. 

She hopes and prays for continuous improvement of her retail store so that she can gain greater profits that will enable her to sustain her family's basic necessities and educate her youngest child.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of groceries for her retail store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay school fees for himself.

loans.name: Jovia

texts.en:
Jovia is lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with three children, two of whom go to school. She has one additional family member (old mother). 

She operates a beauty salon at the market. She sells her products on a retail basis. She has been in this business for the last seven years. She works six days a week. She has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT – SACCO to buy braids, hair relaxers, treatments, weaves and hair spray. 

Her major business challenges are the ever-increasing prices of cosmetics in Uganda and seasonality. Her goals and aspirations are own a fully stocked beauty salon and to buy a plot of land. She lives in a rented house and the family has access to electricity but no access to piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees, feeding the family, and rent.

loans.use: To buy more hair relaxers, braids, weaves, and hair spray

loans.name: Mwadzombo

texts.en:
Mwadzombo is 28 years old, married, and has one daughter who is attending school. He has been operating a general store since last year. 

He currently has a large number of customers. He needs to increase his inventory but he does not have enough capital to do so. 

Mwadzombo is requesting a loan to buy beverages, flour, sugar, canned goods, and other products so that he can restock his store and continue offering a wide variety of merchandise to his customers.

loans.use: to buy beverages, flour, sugar, canned goods, and other products

loans.name: Hajarah

texts.en:
Hajarah lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has four children and all her children go to school. She has one additional family member (father). She lives in her own house and the family has no access to electricity but has access to piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and food.

She operates a beauty salon at the market. She sells her products on a retail basis. She has been in this business for the last two years. She works seven days a week.  

She has requested a loan of 300,000 UGX from MCDT – SACCO to buy braids, hair treatments, weaves and hair sprays. Her major business challenge is transportation and seasonality. Her goals are to buy unique hair products that will bring more customers to her saloon and also to own a bridal salon.

loans.use: To buy more braids, weaves, hair treatments and relaxers and hair sprays.

loans.name: Chalevoix

texts.en:
Chalevoix is 19 years old and single with no children. 

She has a small stall where she bakes and sells pancakes, buns, scones and more in her community. 

Chalevoix needs a loan to buy a plastic bags, sugar, flour, yeast, oil and a gas oven to help her with the business. 

She is a new member of SPBD in 2012. Chalevoix hopes to use her earnings to improve her family assets.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, plastic bags, yeast, baking powder, cooking oil, and a gas oven.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy seedlings and chicken feed

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase new equipment and tools for her newly starting barbershop.

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet is a graduate in economics. She is living with her long-time partner and three children.

In the year 1998, she applied for work as salesclerk at City Colorland. Luckily, she was hired as a salesclerk in the same year. 

Nowadays, she manages her rice retailing, frozen foods and boarding house businesses. Aside from these businesses, Juliet also manages her transportation business as her additional source of income.

Juliet's goal is to earn greater profits, let her children finish their studies, uplift their living condition and have a stable source of income. So, she patiently runs all her businesses to make all her dreams possible. Her profits from her transportation, rice retailing and boarding house businesses were used to cover all their daily expenses, allowances of her three children and monthly payments for electric bills and water bills. 

Now she is applying for additional working capital of PHP 40,000. She will use this amount to buy 15 sacks of rice and some frozen foods. She hopes for approval of this loan so that her goals in life will come to reality.

loans.use: to buy 15 sacks of rice for her retailing business.

loans.name: Moussa

texts.fr:
Moussa est un jeune de 38 ans qui se débrouille dans la vie pour avoir de quoi nourrir sa famille. Il loge dans un petit village situé à environ 7 km de la ville principale ou il vit avec son foyer. Moussa travaille maintenant dans l’agriculture depuis 3 ans : il vend du mil, du mais, de l’arachide etc. Vu sur la photo, il stocke une certaine quantité pendant l’hivernage pour pouvoir le revendre en période de pénurie à un prix plus cher ; C’est d’ailleurs le but de sa demande de financement de 400000F CFA.
Il est marié et s’occupe de la dépense quotidienne des membres de sa famille.
Il aimerait dans l’avenir, avoir une large clientèle dans le marché tout en disposant de tout ce dont les clients auront besoin pour ne pas aller ailleurs.
texts.en: Moussa is a 38-years old man who works hard to be able to support his family. He lives with his household in a small village about 7 km away from the capital. For three years he has been working in agriculture: he sells millet, corn, peanuts etc. As shown in the photo, he stocks up  during the rainy season in order to resell at a higher price during  periods of shortage. This is why he is requesting a loan in the amount of 400,000 West African francs. He is married and provides for everyday needs of his family members. In the future he would like to have a larger customer base at his market and be able to offer everything that his customers need, so that they wouldn’t have to go elsewhere.

loans.use: to buy millet, corn and peanuts for resale at the local market.

loans.name: San Cayetano Group

texts.es:
16 mujeres son las que forman el grupo llamado San Cayetano, donde todas trabajan en la cría y venta de animales de corral.
Isabel es una de ellas y comenta que por medio de su trabajo ha podido ayudar a sus familiares y darles todo lo que necesitan. Su trabajo es duro, pero lo hace para poder luchar contra la necesidad.
Solicita este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de balanceados para sus animales, y también para la compra de pollitos para la cría. 
Ella cuenta que su sueño es poder tener una granja y así tener más animales que criar.
texts.en:
Sixteen woman make up the San Cayetano Communal Bank. They all work raising and selling barnyard animals.

Isabel is one of the members and notes that through her work she has been able to help her family members and give them all they need. Her work is hard but it has enabled her to fight against hunger.

She is requesting this loan in order to purchase nutritional feed for her animals and also to buy chicks to raise. She notes that her dream is to own a farm and have more animals to raise.

loans.use: to buy nutritional feed and chicks to raise.

loans.name: Jovita

texts.en: Jovita, 46, is married and has seven school-age children. She believes that "patience and hard" work will enable her to achieve her goals. She and her husband want to improve their income to satisfy their necessities and continue sending their children to school. She sells beauty products such as lotion, body sprays, soaps, roll ons, creams, feminine wash and many more. She aimed to acquire additional stocks of the beauty products and also feed, fertilizer and pesticides to sell in their community but lacked adequate capital. She is asking for a loan of 50,000.00 PHP to buy the items. Jovita believes that this financial assistance will enable her to improve the business and hopes that someday, she will become financially stable and their children will have a bright future.

loans.use: to buy lotions, body sprays, roll on, soaps, creams and other beauty products and also feed, fertilizer and pesticides to sell in the community.

loans.name: Zaituni

texts.en:
Zaituni is lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with four children and all her children go to school. She doesn’t take care of any additional family members. She operates a restaurant at the market. She sells her products on a retail basis. She has been in business for the last four years. She works seven days a week.  

Zaituni has requested for a loan of Uganda shillings 300,000 from MCDT – SACCO to buy a small jerrycan of cooking oil, rice, green bananas and beef. Her major business challenges are transportation and seasonality. Her goals and aspirations are to have a fully stocked restaurant so as to serve more customers, to buy a plot of land and also to educate her children up to university level. 

Zaituni lives in a rented house and the family has no access to electricity or piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees, medication  and rent.

loans.use: To buy more bunches of green bananas, a small jerrycan of cooking oil, beef and rice

loans.name: Maia

texts.en: Maia is 50 years old, single and lives in Georgia's Senaki district with her mother. The family earns a living by farming, especially by raising and caring for four calves and four milk cows whose milk is used in cheese products that the family sells in the local open market. In addition, she has a pig and sells its piglets locally. Finally, the family grows maize on land it owns and sells an average of 500-600 kg of maize per year. Maia is a very hard-working woman, and very experienced at what she does. She has applied for this loan to buy another additional milk cow so that she will have more milk to sell. This will allow her to earn more money and improve her living standards.

loans.use: to buy a milk cow.

loans.name: Jesca

texts.en: Jesca is lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with four children and all her children go to school. She also takes care of her father. She sells second-hand clothes at the market on a retail basis. She gets additional income from selling fruits and vegetables at the market. She has been in this business for the last eight years, working seven days a week. She has requested for a loan of Uganda shillings 300,000 from MCDT – SACCO to buy a bale of second-hand clothes, pineapples, watermelon, and passion fruit. Her major business challenges are thieves and seasonality. Her goals and aspirations are to rent one shop where she operates all her businesses and also to become a wholesaler of used clothes. She lives in a rented house and the family has access to electricity but does not have access to piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

loans.use: to buy a bale of used clothes, watermelons, pineapples and passion fruit.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy clothes for clothes selling business

loans.name: Pacal

texts.en:
Pascal is a 37-year-old single man who works as a barber and is very satisfied with the customers he has. Pascal is well known in the region, with his talent and good reputation. He replies to customers' needs, but also gives them his experienced advice whether their choice is accepted or not. He never lies to customers just to please them; in fact he puts a lot of effort into convincing his customers what's suitable for them.

Pascal is applying for a loan from Kiva's partner Al Majmoua, in order to renew his shop's furnishings, to keep his customers pleased and satisfied.

He hopes to train his own team and to open a new branch in the future.

loans.use: To renew his shop's furniture

loans.name: Narantsetseg

texts.en: Narantsetseg is 45 years old and lives with her children in a ger, a Mongolian yurt, in Hovd province of Mongolia. Her older children are college students and her son is a secondary school student. She started her business in 2003 by selling home appliances at the local market. She mainly purchases products from the Mongolian western border. A home appliances selling business is not a seasonal business; therefore, her sales are stable. Mrs.Narantsetseg bought a trading container in 2009. She is an open-minded person who says "September and October is high season for marriage and events. So demand of home appliances is very high. I am trying to sell as many products as possible." She is requesting 4,000,000 MNT loan to pay for her children's university tuition.

loans.use: To pay for her children's university tuition

loans.name: Ashi

texts.en:
Ashi is 36 years old and married. She has been making and selling Nimko (a traditional spicy and yummy snack) for two years. She is earning enough to lead a decent life with the support of her husband, who is also in the photo. Her husband assists her in packaging and selling the Nimko door-to-door and at the local market. They serve well in their community.

Ashi requested a loan of  25,000 PKR to buy ingredients such as assorted daals (lentils) and dry fruit in large quantities to increase their sales. She wishes to spend a part of profits on her children’s education and well being.

loans.use: to buy ingredients such as assorted daals (lentils) and dry fruit in large quantites to increase their sales of Nimko (snack food).

loans.name: Shirley

texts.en:
Shirley, 31, is a resident of Manila, Philippines. She is married to Zaldy, a driver. She, together with her husband and children, manage their household while operating a junk shop business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.  

Trash is not actively segregated in the Philippines. While waiting for their local dump trucks, people scavenge garbage dumps and trash bags for recyclable materials like metal, copper, plastic, and paper. They sell these items to junk shops for a little profit. Junk shops then stack, clean, and gather huge quantities of these materials and sell them back to foundries, factories and other industries. Shirley also raises pigs in her compound and her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of PHP 1000 in sales every day.

To help her continue operation of her business, she is requesting a PHP 50,000 loan. She will be incorporating the loan into her current revolving fund used to buy trash from collectors. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Shirley hopes to grow her business and dreams to be able to give her children a high-quality education through all her hard work in her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and it's where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for trash from collectors to resell in her junk business.

loans.name: Abdallah

texts.en:
Abdallah is a 44-year-old married man and father of two children. He has been in the business of selling and fixing electronics for 17 years. Abdallah specializes in repairing electronics of different kinds; he's an expert in this field. He buys used electronics, performs necessary maintenance and then sells them at very impressive prices.

He applied for a loan from Kiva's partner Al Majmoua, in order to buy used TVs and other appliances at a very good price. He will do any maintenance necessary to sell them again at special prices.

Abdallah is working hard to improve his business as much as he can to keep his family pleased with their living. He hopes to keep on increasing his capital to respond to almost all of his customers' requests.

loans.use: To buy used TVs and other appliances to perform necessary maintenance to sell at special encouraging prices

loans.name: Al-Rjwy Group

texts.en: Al-Rjwy is a loan group made up of four women from Taiz, Yemen who earn a living by selling various items. They they are requesting a loan for 140,000 (YER) from AMB to buy supplies for their businesses. Radha, the leader of the group, is a 41-year-old widow who has three children and earns a living by running a beauty salon in her house. She is a professional in her field and has been running this business for 10 years. She would like to expand her business in order to meet her clients' needs and plans to use her portion of this loan, for 50,000 YER, to buy cosmetic supplies for her business. She hopes to open a big beauty salon in her area in the future.

loans.use: to buy cosmetic supplies for a beauty salon.

loans.name: Maty

texts.fr: Madame Maty est une dame de 49 ans qui s’active depuis 7 ans. Elle loge dans un village situé à environ 7km de la ville principale. Vu leur faible revenu, les dames de cette localité sont obligées de vendre du lait caillé sur la route. Maty en fait parti ; elle démarre sa journée à 7h30mn et la termine à 19h30mn. Elle est à son second crédit à l’IMCEC et vient solliciter 200000F CFA afin d’améliorer son activité. Elle participe à la dépense quotidienne de la famille et gère aussi son transport de son lieu d’habitation, à son lieu de travail. Elle désire avec l’appui de l’IMCEC, augmenter son capital afin d’améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en: Mrs. Maty is 49 and has been working for eight years.  She lives in the village located about 7 km from the main city.  Because of their lack of money, the women of this area are must sell milk curds by the roadside.  Maty does as well; she starts her day at 7:30 in the morning and finishes at 7:30 in the evening.  She is on her second loan with l’IMCEC and has just requested 200,000 FCFA in order to grow her business.  She contributes to the daily expenses of the family and also manages transportation from her home to her place of work.  She wants, with the help of l’IMCEC, to increase her working capital and to improve the living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to buy various products and milk curds to sell by the road.

loans.name: Malo

texts.en:
Malo is 42 years old and single but with two children. She has a small herd of pigs, chickens, and cows which she raises and sells to the public. She has been doing this for two years. 

Malo needs a loan to buy barbed wire, a shovel, ropes, more cows and chickens for her herd. She is a new member of SPBD this year 2012. Malo will use the profits from her sales to improve her family assets.

loans.use: to buy barbed wire, a shovel, ropes, more cows and chickens, etc.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with six children, and five of them go to school. She has no additional family members. She sells secondhand clothes. She sells her products on a retail basis and from door to door. She has been in this business for the last 10 years. She works six days a week. She has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT – SACCO to buy a bale of secondhand clothes. Her major business challenges are the ever increasing price of used clothes and seasonality. Her goal is to rent a shop where she can operate her business. She lives in her own house, and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

loans.use: to buy a bale of used clothes

loans.name: Ghram Group

texts.en: This group is called Ghram, which consists of four ladies who live in Taiz, Yemen. They applied for a loan of 160,000 YER. Jalila is the leader of this group. She is 29 years old, married and has five children who live in Taiz. She owns a small house. She applied for a youth loan of 40000 YER from AMB to buy construction materials for her house. She hopes to improve her living conditions to enable her to open a retail store.

loans.use: to buy construction materials for her house.

loans.name: Suh-Ochir

texts.en: Mr Suhbaatar is 27 years old and lives with his wife and two children in a small house in Hovd province, Mongolia. His wife, Gerelchimeg, is 27 years old and operates small business. His son, Domogjanhuu, is 6 years old and enrolled in school while his daughter, Nandinchimeg, is 3 years old and attends kindergarten. Mr.Suhbaatar works as musician in the drama theater of Hovd province and earns 310,000 MNT per month. He is planning to teach  traditional Mongolian musical instruments to children and is requesting a loan for 3,000,000 MNT to buy instruments to use in this course. He is a hardworking, honest and talented man.

loans.use: to buy musical instruments to use in a course.

loans.name: Leonidas

texts.es:
El señor Leónidas tiene 53 años de edad, convive en unión libre con su compañera de hogar, tiene 7 hijos. Reside en una comunidad rural del Municipio de Santa Cruz de Yojoa, Departamento de Cortes.
Don Leónidas se dedica desde hace 4 años a la venta de alimentos a través de una pulpería, él vende huevos, manteca, sal, harina de trigo y de maíz, azúcar y refrescos.
En la actualidad ha solicitado  un préstamo por la cantidad de 21,000 Lempiras los que piensa invertir surtiendo su negocio con granos básicos, embutidos, refrescos, golosinas y medicinas de uso común. 
Él piensa que sus ventas van a aumentar ya que se avecina la temporada de cosecha café y en esta época el circulante de dinero en efectivo es mayor y la demanda de sus productos aumenta.
Don Leónidas ha cumplido 4 ciclos de trabajar con préstamos con ODEF lo cual agradece mucho por la confianza que le han brindado. Su meta es aumentar sus ganancias para poder brindarles una buena educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Leónidas, age 53, lives with his life partner, and he has seven children.  He lives in a rural community in the Santa Cruz de Yojoa municipality in the Cortes department.

Leónidas has been selling food in a mini-market for four years.  He sells eggs, shortening, salt, wheat and corn flour, sugar, and soft drinks.

He has currently requested a loan for 21,000 lempiras to stock his business with basic grains, sausages, soft drinks, candy, and commonly used drugs.  

He thinks that his sales will increase because the time for harvesting coffee is approaching.  During this season the circulation of cash is greater, and the demand for his products increases.

Leónidas has completed four cycles of working with loans with ODEF.  He is very grateful for the trust being placed in him.  His goal is to increase his income in order to be able to give his children a good education.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, sausages, soft drinks, candy, and pastas.

loans.name: Khadija

texts.en:
Khadija is 27 years of age, married, and lives with her husband and their son in the town of Kisauni, Kenya. She set up her own business at home over five years ago, where she makes women’s clothing such as dresses for all occasions, skirts, blouses, uniforms, etc. She has always worked in this business, as it was something she learned at a very young age and is now her source of income.

With the loan of 20,000 KES she has requested, Khadija plans to buy raw materials such as fabrics, thread, needles, accessories, buttons, etc. She will use these to make clothing, and therefore provide better customer service. Khadija’s goal is to have a larger business and expand her customer base. This will allow her to meet her objective of owning a clothing retail shop.

loans.use: to buy raw materials such as fabrics, thread, needles, accessories, buttons, etc.

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane is a 34-year-old married woman and a mother of an eight-year-old child. She lives in Talibon, Bohol, Philippines together with her family. She has been running a retail store selling various household materials for more than 15 years now.

Mary Jane will be using the loan to buy more items to sell such as brooms, gloves, cleaning solutions for the kitchen and toilet and others.

Mary Jane dreams of making her business a success. Moreover, she aims to save more money for the educational expenses of her daughter.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell such as brooms, gloves, cleaning solutions for the kitchen and toilet and others

loans.name: Bakur

texts.en:
Bakur is from Chkhorotsku district. He is 28  years old and lives with his wife, infant daughter and parents. The family is involved in agricultural business. In particular, Bakur runs a small dairy farm--he has two calves and a milk cow, whose milk is used for cheese products, which are sold at the local open market. In addition, he has a pig and sells piglets locally. Besides, the family grows maize and nuts on family-owned land. Bakur also works as an artisan to earn additional monthly income. He is very hard-working young man, with a great desire to get ahead.

He requested a loan to expand the shed for cows. Bakur will purchase construction materials for a new cattle-shed. The existing one is already too small and doesn’t allow Bakur to plan future expansion of the family’s farming activities. After the building is expanded Bakur will be able to increase the number of his cattle, produce more dairy goods and sell at a good price. This will increase the family income. The increased income will be used for house renovation and all members of the family will experience improved living conditions.

loans.use: to expand his cowshed

loans.name: Kitsao

texts.en:
Kistao is a dedicated person who has the urge to move forward. He says thank you to both Yehu and Kiva for their humble support. He was able to increase the stock in his vegetable stall. He decided to make a new investment and he currently operates a charcoal selling business. 

Kitsao narrates that the new business is doing well and his desire is to have a bigger store to stock more charcoal. With the requested loan, he will be able to buy more sacks of charcoal for resale. He says thanks for the continual support he is getting.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Batjargal

texts.en:
Batjargal is 37 years old and lives with his retired mother in a small house in Uvurhangai province, Mongolia. He is an honest and hardworking man who was trained in cell phone repair in Ulaanbaatar in March 2012.

Batjargal is requesting 3,000,000 MNT to purchase equipment and inventory for his new business providing phone repairs and selling phones. He plans to rent a phone repair stall at a shopping center where he will provide phone repairs and sell cell phones as well.

loans.use: To purchase equipment and inventory for his new business providing phone repairs and selling phones.

loans.name: Sakeena

texts.en:
Ms. Sakeena is 41 years old and a married woman. Her husband is a laborer. She has eight children and total ten members in her home and her husband is the only earner of the family. It was very tough for Sakeena to manage her household needs with the small income of her husband. Therefore she decided to help her husband in earning. For this purpose she started her business of cloth trade as she brought cloth of different varities from Lahore and Faisalabad market to sell in her area. 

Now she is playing a very important role for her family. For this reason she wants the loan of Rs. 20,000/- to purchase more variety in colors, taking into account the taste and choice of her customers. She is hopeful to get an increase in her income and desires to spend part of the profits on the expansion her business.

loans.use: To purchase more variety in colors, taking into account the taste and choice of her customers.

loans.name: Rath's Group

texts.en: Rath is 30 years old, married and the mother of four children. She lives in a village in the Banteay Meanchy province’s Mongkul Borey district, where she earns a living by farming rice while her husband works at a separate job to help support their family. Together, they can earn about KHR 20,000 per day from their jobs and save about KHR 5,000 a day for future needs. Rath leads a two-person loan group associated with Kiva partner, VisionFund, and has received and repaid four previous loans from VisionFund. She successfully used the loans to better her living conditions and is now requesting a new loan to buy fertilizer for her farm and hire workers to help with her crop. She hopes to grow more rice and sell it for a good price so that she can improve her living standards.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her farmland.

location.town: Banteay Meanchey Province, Mongkul Borey District

loans.name: Primavera Group

texts.es:
El comité primavera está formado por 13 señoras, donde ellas se esfuerzan arduamente para poder salir adelante y ayudar a sus familiares en todo lo que necesitan para tener una vida sin privaciones.
Maria Estela es la presidenta del grupo, y cuenta que ella se esfuerza por poder ayudar a sus amigas del grupo y que de esa forma cada una pueda cumplir con sus metas y objetivos. Ella se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras, y este ha sido su forma de ayudar a su familia en lo que puede.
Maria Estela solicita el préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de frutas y verduras, para poder seguir ofreciendo la variedad a la que están acostumbrados sus clientes.
texts.en:
The Primavera Group is made up of 13 women, where  they working hard to get ahead and help their families in all that they need to have a life without hardship.
Maria Estela is the president of the group, and says that strives to help her friends in the group and in this way each of them can achieve their goals and objectives. She sells fruits and vegetables for a living, and this has been her way of her family with what she can. Maria Estela is requesting a loan to invest in the purchase of fruits and vegetables in order to continue offering the variety to which her customers are accustomed.

loans.use: to purchase fruits and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Kousar

texts.en:
Ms.Kousar is 30 years old and married. She has three children, two daughters and one son. She is striving hard to meet their needs, including food, clothing, and health. Her husband is employed in a small restaurant; his income is not sufficient to meet the daily expenditures of the family. She started her business to contribute in the family income.

She is in the business of sewing for many years. She is very familiar with stitching techniques. She initiated her business with the support of Kashf Foundation; she took her first loan to buy a sewing machine. At present, she enjoys a great client list and has gained a lot of appreciation and popularity in her community. 

She requested a loan of Rs 25,000 to buy a stock of threads of different colors, buttons, needles, etc., so she will be able to meet the demands of her customers without fail.  She hopes to grow her business, and dreams of giving her children a good and quality education through all her hard work in her business.

loans.use: To buy a stock of threads of different colors, buttons, needles, etc.

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es:
El Sr. Francisco tiene 52 años, está casado con la Sra. Ana. Se dedican al reciclaje desde el año 2007. Paralelamente a esta actividad montaron una pequeña despensa en su casa, donde ofrecen frutas, verduras y productos de todo tipo a sus vecinos.
En el reciclaje trabajan con cartones, plásticos, hierros y cobre. Por la mañana sale a realizar la recolección uno de ellos y por la tarde el otro. Luego lo venden a empresas recicladoras.
Tienen tres hijos, dos de los cuales todavía en edad escolar. Anhelan poder brindar siempre una vida digna a sus hijos, además de darles la oportunidad de estudiar y que puedan convertirse en personas preparadas para enfrentar los desafíos de la vida.
Solicita el crédito para la compra de fideos, yerba, huevos, gaseosas, golosinas para poder surtir su despensa.
texts.en:
Francisco is 52 years old and married to Ana. He has dedicated his efforts to recycling since the year 2007. Alongside this activity, he runs a small store from his house, where he offers fruits, vegetables, and all types of products to his neighbors.

In his recycling business, Francisco gathers cardboard boxes, plastic, iron and copper. Mornings, he goes out collecting one of these, and afternoons, a different material. Later, he sells what he gathers to recycling enterprises.

Francisco is requesting a loan to buy beans, yerba mate tea, eggs, soft drinks, and sweets, to restock his store.

loans.use: purchase beans, yerba mate tea, eggs, soft drinks, sweets, etc., to sell.

loans.name: Groupe Ada.

texts.fr: Chistine est une femme de 38 ans, célibataire et mère de 05 enfants dont l'âge varie entre 13 mois et 15 ans. trois de ses enfants vont déjà à l'école. Elle est commerçante dans un marché de la capitale depuis 14 ans où elle vend des vivres frais (maïs, bananes, plantains, légumes, tomate, fruits) selon les saisons.la vente de bananes et plantains est une activité qui rapporte, mais la petitesse de son stock de marchandises entraine de nombreuses ruptures et ne lui permettent pas de satisfaire convenablement sa clientèle. Ce crédit lui permettra alors de s'approvisionner en grande quantité afin de répondre à la demande de ses clients et de ce fait d'augmenter ses ventes et son bénéfice. Elle réinvestira une partie de ce bénéfice dans son activité afin de le diversifier et l'autre pour subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
Christine is 38 years old, single, and the mother of five children between the ages of 13 months and 15 years.  Three of her children attend school already.  She has been a vendor in a market in the capital for 14 years.  She sells fresh produce (corn, bananas, plantains, vegetables, tomatoes, fruits) according to the seasons.  Sales of bananas and plantains are lucrative, but she often runs out of them because her supplies are short, and this makes it difficult to meet the demand of her customers. 
This loan will allow her to stock up on quantities large enough to meet the needs of her customers, and therefore increase her sales and her profits.  She will reinvest a part of the profits in her business in order to diversify it, and the other part will allow her to meet the needs of her family.

loans.use: to increase her supply of plantains, vegetables and fruits.

loans.name: Anne

texts.fr:
Madame Anne, âgée de 42 ans fait du commerce de divers produits depuis 6 ans maintenant. Elle est une habituée d’un de nos guichets ruraux, car elle est à son 6ème crédit. On la reconnait sur la photo qui montre un des divers produits qu’elle vend. Anne, avec le crédit qu’elle  va faire veut acheter  des habits, des tissus pour revendre cela dans le village. Un marché qu’elle fidélise puisque les villageois n’ont pas le temps de venir en ville pour se ravitailler. Elle vend aussi des fruits de mer pour maximiser son profit.
  Anne est mariée et est une brave femme qui soutient son mari dans la gestion du foyer. Elle a décidé de s’occuper de la scolarité de ses deux enfants.
Dans l’avenir, elle aimerait avec le soutien de l’IMCEC, diversifier son activité afin de pouvoir améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Anne is 42 years old and has been running her business selling various goods for six years now. She is a veteran of one of the rural branches of UIMCEC, and she is on her sixth loan cycle. The photo shows one of the various types of products she sells. With this loan, Anne is planning to purchase ready to wear clothing and fabric to sell in her village. At the market she has clients with well-developed customer loyalty, as the villagers do not have the time to go all the way into town for their supplies. She also sells seafood to maximize her income.

Anne is married and is a good woman who supports her husband by managing the household. She also made the decision to pay for the education of her two children. In the future, and with the support UIMCEC, Anne would like to further expand her business in order to improve the living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fabric, as well as ready to wear clothes, for resale.

loans.name: Allen Joy

texts.en:
Allen Joy has a business raising hogs. She is a young married woman who has two infant children. Her spouse is a government employee at Baguio City.

Allen Joy would like to apply for a loan of 30,000 PHP, which would allow her to buy livestock feed, vitamins, and vaccines for her hogs. Through this loan, she could ensure the proper growth and good nutrition of her raised hogs. In addition, she could deal her hogs at a higher price. Allen Joy is hoping for continuous financial assistance for her livestock business so she can save some amount for the bright future of her two children.

loans.use: to buy livestock feed, vitamins, and vaccines for her livestock business

loans.name: Antonette

texts.en: Antonette is 24 years old, married and lives in Poblacion Albur, Bohol. She has a four-year-old son, and has earned a living for many years by selling food, including items such as fried chicken, meatballs and fish. She plans to use this loan to buy additional meat, rice, and soft drinks to sell to her customers. In the future, Antonette would like to expand her food-vending business so that she can pay for the education of her son.

loans.use: to buy meat, rice and soft drinks for a food-vending business.

loans.name: Razia

texts.en:
Razia is 51 years old, married, and has three children who attend school. She has had a business of hand embroidery for the past five years. Two of her  daughters (seen in the photo) assist her in making beautiful patterns. Razia is zealous about her work and client demand is strong. 

Business challenges, combined with family expenditures, frustrate Razia nearly every day. Her husband is employed as a sales person in a grocery store, but he does not earn enough to support the family. Razia’s embroidery patterns are very popular on her street and she is the best earning resource in her household. 

Razia is requesting a loan for 20,000 PKR, which she will use to buy raw materials such as thread, sequins, and pearls in large quantities to meet the increasing demand of her customers. She dreams of running a training center for girls in her village. She would like to teach embroidery skills, so they can help her expand her business and also earn money for themselves. She is also interested in opening her own shop in the market to display her work.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials such as thread, sequins, and pearls.

loans.name: Nadia

texts.en:
Nadia is a 49-year-old married woman, the mother of three children. She has been selling clothing and underwear for 25 years. She is highly experienced in her domain and knows her customers very well; she increases her merchandise upon their request.

Nadia is requesting  a loan from Kiva's partner Al Majmoua in order to buy a new nightgown collection for the coming winter season.

Nadia has been an Al Majmoua borrower for three cycles. Her previous loans helped a lot in increasing and improving her business.  This helped her a lot in helping her husband improve their living, and in covering almost all of their needs.

loans.use: To increase her winter nightgown collection with newly released items to resell.

loans.name: Jerson Bersael

texts.es:
El señor Jerson tiene 24 años de edad, convive en unión libre con su compañera de hogar, tiene 2 hijos. Reside en el Municipio de La Lima, Departamento de Cortes.
Jerson tiene 7 años de ser comerciante, el tiene una negocio de venta de achinería donde vende aretes, pulsera y cadenas de fantasía, además vende accesorios para el cabello para damas.
En la actualidad ha solicitado  un préstamo por la cantidad de 15,000 Lempiras los que piensa invertir surtiendo su negocio con producto nuevo y de la temporada (achinería variada).
Él piensa que al variar su inventario, sus ventas aumentaran, así como sus ganancias. Espera seguir creciendo en su negocio para sostener su familia, por lo que agradece el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Jerson, 24, lives in a common law relationship with his housemate.  He has two children and lives in the Municipality of La Lima, Cortes Department.

Jerson has been a merchant for 7 years.  He has a business selling low-price assorted merchandise like earrings, bracelets and costume jewelry chains; he also sells women’s hair accessories.

He’s currently asking for a 15,000 Lempira loan to stock his business with new, seasonal merchandise (assorted low-price items).  He intends to vary his inventory to support his family and is grateful for the support provided.

loans.use: to buy assorted low-price, novelty merchandise.

loans.name: Maria Auxiliadora Group

texts.es:
El comité Maria Auxiliadora nace mediante la gestión y el apoyo de un grupo de mujeres que se encontraba trabajando en dicho lugar. Son 15 mujeres que no se cansan de trabajar, ya que por medio de ese esfuerzo ayudan a sus familias.
La Sra. Carolina, presidenta del grupo tiene 36 años, es una mujer muy emprendedora y que tiene grandes sueños y metas que quiere cumplir. Ella es cantinera en un colegio, y solicita el crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de golosinas y bebidas con los que desea poder abastecer su cantina y así seguir trabajando.
texts.en:
The “María Auxiliadora” committee arose thanks to the initiative and support of a group of women who were working in said place.  They are 15 women who are tireless workers because it’s through their efforts that they help their families.

Carolina, 36, is group president.  She’s a very enterprising woman who has great dreams and goals to reach.  She runs a school snack bar and is requesting the loan to buy snacks and soft-drinks to stock her snack bar and continue working.

loans.use: to buy snacks and soft-drinks.

loans.name: Gardenia Roxana

texts.es:
GARDENIA ROXANA tiene 34 años de edad es casada tiene dos hijos, vive con los hijos y el esposo en casa de unos familiares en ventanas Provincia de los Ríos.

GARDENIA ROXANA trabaja en el sector público se desenpeña cómo maestra en una escuelita, a ella le gusta enseñar a los niños porque es su pasión ser maestra.

Solicita el crédito para comprar un computador, impresora, hojas, cartulina, marcadores. Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar lo que le hace falta para hacer el material para la escuela. 

Las compras las realizará en la ciudad de Ventanas. El sueño es comprarce una casa. Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta es trabajar más para reunir y comprarce la casa que tanto anela.

En el tiempo libre le gusta descansar y estra con la familia con la hija y el esposo.
texts.en:
Gardenia Roxana, 34, is married and has two children.  She lives with her children and husband in a house belonging to some relatives in Ventanas, Los Ríos Province.  She’s a public sector employee; she works as a teacher in a little school.  She enjoys teaching the children because her passion is being a teacher.

She’s requesting the loan to buy a computer, printer, sheets of paper, construction paper and markers.  With help from the loan she will be able to buy what she needs for the school. She will make her purchases in the city of Ventanas. 

Her dream is to buy a house.  The challenge she faces is to work harder and to buy the house she so desires.  She likes to rest and spend time with her daughter and husband in her free time.

loans.use: to buy a computer, printer, sheets of paper, construction paper and markers.

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en: Catherine is married and has five children, four of whom attend school. She operates a food stall. She has applied for a loan of 2,000,000 UGX from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bunches of green bananas, charcoal, cassava, and sweet potatoes. She has been in this business for 20 years and sells to all kinds of people on both retail and wholesale, at the market and at home. She generates additional income by selling fried food. She works six days a week. Her major business challenges are thieves, transportation, and seasonality. She aspires to own a delivery van and to sell on wholesale only. She decided to join MCDT-SACCO because of the low interest rate. She resides in her own house, and her family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses includes school fees and medication.

loans.use: To buy green bananas, charcoal, cassava, and sweet potatoes

loans.name: Santo Rey Group

texts.es:
El comité  Santo Rey nace con la unión de 13 mujeres de la ciudad de San Lorenzo, quienes se unieron para apoyarse las unas a las otras y de esa forma cambiar el rumbo de sus vidas.
La Sra. Emilia es miembro del grupo, y cuenta que gracias al apoyo de sus amigas del grupo, ella cada vez se siente más fortalecida y quiere seguir luchando. Ella es costurera y solicita el crédito para la compra de telas, botones, hilos, cierres y demás, y de esa forma poder seguir haciendo las confecciones que siempre hace, ya que tiene muchos pedidos.
texts.en:
The “Santo Rey” (Holy King) committee arose when 13 women from the city of San Lorenzo joined together to support one another and thus change the course of their lives.

Emilia is one of the group members and she relates that thanks to the support from her girlfriends in the group she feels stronger every day and wants to continue to strive.  She’s a seamstress and is requesting the loan to buy fabric, buttons, thread, zippers and others to continue making the clothes she always makes since she has many pending orders.

loans.use: to buy sewing supplies like fabric, buttons, thread, zippers, etc.

loans.name: Parveen

texts.en:
Ms. Parveen is a 35-year-old married mother of three. The lady with the veil shown in the photo is Parveen. She is a hardworking mother who is helping her family by providing tailoring services in her community. She has been doing this for the past six years. She knows the techniques of stitching very well. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns enough to lead a decent life.
 
To help her continue operation of her business, she requested a loan of 10,000 PKR to stock thread in different colors, packs of zippers, buttons, etc., to meet the increasing demand. In addition to repaying the loan, she will use part of the revenue to deal with personal expenses and home improvement.

loans.use: to stock thread in different colors and packs of zippers, buttons, etc., to meet the increasing demand

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase bags of maize and fish for the 'kenkey' and 'banku' business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase palm fruit and palm kennels for the extraction of oil to sell.

loans.name: Luzviminda

texts.en:
Luzviminda works hard to earn a living. She offers different kinds of cosmetic products, underwear for men and women, and other products for personal use. She had been running this kind of business for four years. 

Luzviminda is married and has two children. Her eldest child is a college graduate and currently works at Flores hospital on the accounting staff, while her younger child is in the third year of college. Luzviminda wants her youngest child to finish her studies someday.

Luzviminda had successfully repaid her previous loan. This time, she is seeking for another loan of PHP13,000. She will use this loan to purchase stocks of hair pins, towels, plastic bags, cosmetic products and underwear for men and women. 

She knows that this loan could really help her a lot, especially in increasing the profit she generates and improving their way of living.

loans.use: to purchase stocks of hair pins, towels, plastic bags,cosmetic products and underwear for men and women to resell.

loans.name: Roxanne

texts.en:
For the past three years, Roxanne has sold balut and red eggs wholesale and retail. She is happy because her business is growing. As her business grows, she needs more capital. She is requesting a loan of 50,000 PHP to buy materials needed for the production of red eggs and balut.

Roxanne is married and has two children. Her profits are used to pay their monthly electric bill, their daily household needs, and the salary of her helper. She hopes that her business will improve and expand so she can generate higher profits, improve her family's standard of living, and become a successful wholesaler of red eggs and balut.

loans.use: to buy materials needed to make red eggs and balut

loans.name: Ama

texts.en: Ama is a fishmonger. She also operates a chop bar (where a variety of African dishes are sold). She has done this for 30 years now. She serves fufu, banku, and rice balls at her chop bar in Efutu. She is marrried to a driver and has five dependents. Ama assists her husband with feeding and clothing their children. Ama will use her loan to purchase more fish and food stuffs to prepare her dishes for sale. With the new profit, she will expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase fish and food stuffs to prepare dishes

loans.name: Araba

texts.en: Araba  sells 'kenkey' (fermented maize dough) at Efutu. In front of her are some of the  kenkey balls she sells. Araba has been selling 'kenkey' for 8 years. She is married with three children.  She uses her income to assist her husband to pay their accommodation bills. Araba will use her loan to purchase bags of  maize for the preparation of  'kenkey' to sell. With the new profit, Araba plans to expand her business.

loans.use: purchase bags of  maize for the preparation of 'kenkey' to sell.

loans.name: Safeena's Group

texts.en:
Safeena is 36 years old, a hard-working and independent woman. She is living in Punjab, Pakistan, with her husband and two sons. Her husband has been running a general store and his income is not enough to meet the household expenses. Since 2007 Safeena has been running a beauty salon, and she wants to purchase some more cosmetic products and chairs for the business. 

For that reason as a member of a nine-person lending group she has requested a loan from Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan to purchase cosmetics like facial creams, lipsticks, hair colors and other varieties of products for her salon. If she gets good profit she is going to open a tailoring school, pay house expenses, repay the loan amount and will put aside some savings for her family as well. 

Safeena hopes that her business will grow more and she is very much thankful to both BRAC and Kiva. Note: In the picture, Safeena is holding a passbook in her hand.

loans.use: To purchase cosmetics for her beauty salon.

loans.name: Neris Jacinta

texts.es:
NERIS JACINTA Tiene 25 años de edad es  soltera tiene 3 hijos, vive con los hijos en la ciudad de Ventnas Provincia de los Ríos. 

Es Integrante de la VRC CAMINANDO HACIA EL FUTURO SE ENCUENTRA UBICADA EN EL RECINTO JESUS DEL GRAN PODER, PERTENECE AL CANTON VENTANAS SE DEDICAN A LABORES AGRÍCOLAS.

 NERIS JACINTA se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz. Solicita el crédito para ocmprar insecticidas, urea, líquido para combatir la maleza. 

Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar lo necesario para los cultivos. Las compras las realizará en la ciudad de Ventanas.

El sueño es comprar terrno. En el tiempo libre le gusta trabajar.

"Esta muy agradecida por el crédito anterior".
texts.en:
Neris Jacinta, 25, is single and has three children.  She lives with her children in the city of Ventanas, Los Ríos Province.  She’s a member of the “Caminando Hacia el Futuro” (Heading towards the Future) communal bank located in Recinto Jesús del Gran Poder belonging to Ventanas Canton; they work in agriculture.

Neris Jacinta works growing corn and is requesting the loan to buy insecticide, urea and liquid to combat weeds.  With help from the loan she will be able to buy what’s needed for the crops.  She will make the purchases in Ventanas.

Her dream is to buy land.  In her free time she likes to work.  She is very grateful for the previous loan.

loans.use: to buy insecticide, urea and liquid weed killer.

loans.name: Fausto Danilo

texts.es:
FAUSTO DANILO tiene 42 años de edad de estado civil unión libre si tiene hijos, vive con la esposa y con los hijos en Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos.

FAUSTO DANILO trabaja en una finca cosechando, sembrando. Solicita el crédito para comprar mesa, silla, armario, 1 cama. Con la ayuda del crédito comprara lo que tanta falta le hacia para el hogar.

Las compras las realizará en Ventanas. El sueño es poder comprar tierra para poder trabajar y obtener ingresos propios para el bienestar de la familia. 

En el tiempo libre le gusta descansar y estra en familia.
texts.en: Fausto Danilo, 42, is in a common law relationship and does have children.  He lives with his wife and children in Ventanas, Los Ríos Province.  He works on a farm harvesting and planting.  He requests the loan to buy a table, a chair, an armoire and a bed.  With help from the loan he will buy what he so needs for his home.  He will make his purchases in Ventanas.  His dream is to be able to buy land to work and earn his own income for his family’s wellbeing.  In his free time he likes to rest and be with his family.

loans.use: to buy a table, chair, armoire and bed.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more palm fruit to extract the oil for sale

loans.name: Rizalina

texts.en: Rizalina is a married woman from Baclayon, Bohol. She has two children, ages twelve and seven years old. She has been in the retail business for almost one year. She sells items like soap, soft drinks, frozen goods like 'chorizo' (sausage). ground pork and hotdogs. Rizalina is requesting a loan of 14,000 pesos to buy a refrigerator for her frozen goods, and merchandise like soap, canned goods, soft drinks, sugar and noodles. Rizalina would like to expand her business to support her family and for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator, soap, canned goods, and soft drinks

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase bags of  maize and vegetable for her 'kenkey' and 'banku' business

loans.name: Abena

texts.en: Abena  cooks plain rice and serves it with tomato sauce, macaroni, and fried fish which she has done for 6 years. She is married to a driver and has 5 dependents. Abena uses her earnings to help her husband to pay their children’s school fees and other household expenses.   Abena will use the loan to purchase bags of rice, tomatoes, cooking oil and fish to prepare her food for sale. She anticipates reinvesting the new profit.

loans.use: to purchase bags of rice, tomatoes, cooking oil and fish to prepare her food for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase cassava, plantains, and  sweet potatoes for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase bags of maize for her 'kenkey'.

loans.name: Razia

texts.en:
Ms. Razia is a 48-year-old married woman. The man shown in the photo is Razia’s husband. For the past five years, they have provided cooking services from their home. Razia enjoys making food, and she has become famous in her town for her cooking. She is earning enough to lead a decent life. Her husband assists her in taking orders from customers and then sends the food to the correct places. 

Razia is a responsible mother and needs to earn more to support the daily expenses of her family members. She has requested a loan of 20,000 PKR to buy rice and packs of oil and salt at lower rates from the market. In this way she will be able to cater to more customers. Razia desires to spend her earned profit on her children’s education and well being.

loans.use: To buy rice, oil, and salt

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more cooking utensils, shoes and children’s wear for sale

loans.name: Gabriel

texts.en:
Gabriel is 44-year-old retail shop proprietor in Mombasa. He is married to Lewa. He has been doing this business for the past 6 years with great success.

This is Gabriel’s second business loan from KADET LTD to finance his business. He plans to purchase a stock of cooking oil, rice, baking flour, maize flour and washing powders for his shop. 

He will use the anticipated profits to repay his loan, and for the gradual expansion of his shop. He hopes to see his family successful in the future.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of cooking oil, rice, baking flour, maize flour and washing powders to resell.

loans.name: Demuri

texts.en:
Demuri is from Tkibuli district. He is 63 years old and lives with his large family: his wife, parents, two grown sons, a daughter-in-law and three grandchildren. His parents are pensioners. 

The family is involved in agricultural business. In particular, Demuri runs a small dairy farm. He has three calves, three milk cows and one buffalo, whose milk is used in cheese products which are sold at the local open market. In addition, he has a pig and five piglets. The family also owns a nut garden and does all relevant seasonal work to ensure a good harvest. Demuri also serves the local people as a mini-bus driver to earn additional monthly income. He is very hard-working man, with rich experience in his work.

Demuri requested a loan to purchase additional buffalo. He will be able to get more milk and increase the sales of his dairy products. Demuri will thereby raise his income. With the increased income, he plans to expand his agricultural business and improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to purchase additional buffalo

loans.name: Benjamin

texts.en: Benjamin is married and 63 years old. He has a service shop where he repairs shoes and bags. Benjamin has had this business for seven years. Benjamin is requesting a loan of 50,000 PHP to buy materials used in making bags and shoes, such as leather, shoe nails, etc. Each month, Benjamin earns about 5,000 PHP doing this work. In the future, Benjamin hopes that his business will become more progressive to sustain the needs of his family.

loans.use: to buy materials, such as leather and shoe nails, used to make bags and shoes

loans.name: Maria Elba

texts.es:
MARIA ELBA tiene 33 años de edad es casada tiene 7 hijos, vive con el esposo y con los hijo en Ventanas Provincia de los ríos.

Es integrante de la VRC CAMINANDO HACIA EL FUTURO, se encuentra ubicada en el recinto Jesus del gran poder, pertenece al Cantón Ventanas se dedican a Labores Agrícolas.

 MARIA ELBA se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz. Solicita el crédito para comprar urea, ranger, insecticidas, líquido para la maleza. 

Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar lo necesario para aplicar a la siembras. Las compras las realizará en la ciudad de Ventanas.

El sueño es trabajar en un negocio en que haya más ingresos. En el tiempo libre  le gusta dedicarce más a las siembras. "esta muy agradecida por la yuda del crédito anterior".
texts.en:
Maria Elba is 33, married, and has seven children. She lives with her husband and children in Ventanas, in De Los Rios province.

She is a member of the "Caminando Hacia el Futuro" communal bank, located in the rural settlement of Jesus del Gran Poder, which is part of Ventanas canton. People there are farmers.  

Maria Elba is a farmer, and grows corn. She is applying for a loan in order to buy urea fertilizer, pesticides and herbicides.  

With the help of the loan, she will be able to buy what she needs to apply to her crops. She will make her purchases in the city of Ventanas.

Her dream is to work in a business that offers more income. In her free time, she likes to do additional work on her crops. "I am very grateful for the help of the previous loan."

loans.use: To buy urea fertilizer, insecticides and herbicides.

loans.name: Trabajadoras De Santiago Group

texts.es:
El comité "Trabajadoras de Santiago"se originó a través de promociones  que se hicieron en el barrio de las miembros, y de allí surgió la formación del grupo.
La Sra. Maria es Presidenta del grupo, ella Trabaja en la venta de chipa que a diario sale a vender por el barrio, cuenta que es muy difícil su trabajo ya que lo hace en forma ambulante, su deseo es seguir progresando con la Fundación Paraguaya y que el grupo se vaya fortaleciendo cada día más, manifiesta que se siente muy a gusto en su comité y espera muchos beneficio.
Solicita el crédito para la compra de chipas,  los cuales quiere vender y de esa forma seguir trabajando y ganándose el sustento diario.
texts.en:
The "Trabajadoras de Santiago" committee originated through different promoting activities done in the members' neighborhood. The group was born this way.

Mrs. Maria is the group's president. She sells chipa [cheesy buns] in her neighborhood everyday. She mentions that her job is very difficult, because she does not have a fixed stall, but has to move around looking for customers. 

Her dream is to continue progressing with Fundación Paraguaya and that the group keeps gaining strength every day. She mentions that she is happy with the committee and expects many benefits.

She is requesting the loan to buy chipas, in order to sell them and in this way keep working and covering her daily needs.

loans.use: to buy chipas [cheesy buns] for sale.

loans.name: Genesis Group

texts.es:
El comité Genesis es un grupo muy activo,  siempre saben salir adelante, se encuentra en el ciclo 4º, tienen ahorros y caja chica que les ayuda a solventar cualquier problema que pueda surgir.
La Sra. Elena siempre sabe  llevar bien adelante su puesto de tesorera, y nos cuenta que es artesana y realiza todo tipo de manualidades, como ser muñecas de trapo, sabanas para bebé con decoraciones etc.,  y cuenta que ella desea tener su propio negocio.
Solicita el préstamo para la compra de telas, hilos, botones y demás para poder seguir haciendo las manualidades que vende.
texts.en:
Genesis Communal Bank is a very active group. Its members also know how to get ahead and are now in their fourth loan cycle. They have savings and petty cash, wlhich help them resolve any problems they have.

Sra. Elena always knows how to carry out her duties as treasurer well and states that she is an artisan and creates all kinds of handmade items such as rag dolls, decorated baby sheets, etc. She notes that she would like to have her own business. She is requesting a loan to purchase fabrics, thread, buttons and other materials so she can continue producing the handicrafts she sells.

loans.use: to purchase fabric, thread, buttons and other items.

loans.name: Katherine

texts.es:
Cuando Katherine recibió su credito anterior de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, compró mayor cantidad de víveres como arroz, aceites, tubérculos, verduras y carnes que vendió prontamente, su capital de trabajo rotó y ganó un poco más, no solo por las ventas que hizo sino también por los descuentos que obtuvo, al comprar en mayor volumen y esto fue gracias a este financiamiento. Ella vive en el municipio de Puerto Colombia, ubicado a orillas del mar caribe y por eso la playa, brisa y mar es lo que la rodea y ella se desenvuelve en ese ambiente turistico que potencializa la clientela de su restaurante, el cual ella quiere hacer crecer aplicandole recursos que le faciliten el aumento de su capital de trabajo y asi mismo de sus ventas.. 
Hoy planea comprar un nuevo refrigerador, porque el actual está presentando imperfecciones mecánicas y esto no es bueno para su negocio. Por eso ha acudido a un nuevo financiamiento y esta vez mediante Kiva; su inversión será exitosa, porque responde a una necesidad inmediata y en sus 10 años de experiencia ella ha aprendido a manejar sus recursos y tiene una muy buen clientela a la que cuida esmeradamente y necesita dar respuesta oportuna. Su mensaje a los financiadores de Kiva es el siguiente: “Agradezco la ayuda recibida, y deseo que sigan ayudando a muchas personas como yo, en todo el mundo“
texts.en:
When Katherine received her previous Fundación Mario Santo Domingo loan she bought larger amounts of foodstuffs like rice, oil, tubers, vegetables and meat that she resold quickly.  Her working capital turned over and she earned a bit more not only through the sales but also because of the discounts she got by purchasing larger amounts and this was made possible thanks to the loan.

She lives in Puerto Colombia located on the shores of the Caribbean Sea so she’s surrounded by beaches, breeze and sea.  She develops in this environment of tourism that creates a good clientele for her restaurant.  She wants to make it grow by applying resources to it that will facilitate her increase of working capital and thus her sales.

She’s now planning to buy a new refrigerator because her current one is having mechanical failures and this isn’t good for business.  This is why she’s applying once again for a loan through Kiva.  The investment will be successful because it’s meeting an immediate need and in the ten years’ experience she’s attained she’s learned well how to manage her resources; she also has a good clientele that she cares for with dedication and needs to respond to promptly.  

Her message to Kiva lenders is the following: “I am grateful for the help received and hope you will continue to help many people like me around the world.”

loans.use: to buy a new refrigerator.

loans.name: Mujeres Emprendedoras Group

texts.es:
El comité MUJERES EMPRENDEDORAS, están en el cuarto ciclo del programa quien es presidenta de su comité es la Sra. Mercedes, quien se dedica a la venta ambulante de frazadas, sabanas, prendas y demás, cuenta que su trabajo es muy sacrificado y que está saliendo adelante gracias a la ayuda de sus amigas del grupo y de fundación paraguaya.
El sueño de Mercedes es poder tener un puesto fijo y así poder ofrecer más comodidad a sus clientes y seguir ganándose así sus ingresos honestamente. Solicita el préstamo para la compra de frazadas, sabanas y demás y así poder tener mayor variedad que ofrecer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
The “Mujeres Emprendedoras” (Enterprising Women) committee is in the program’s fourth cycle.  Mercedes is committee president and she sells blankets, sheets, clothes and others from place to place. She relates that her work is very demanding and she’s getting ahead thanks to help from her fellow group members and Fundación Paraguaya.

Mercedes’ dream is to be able to have a permanent stand to sell her goods more comfortably and continue to earn income honestly.  She’s requesting the loan to buy blankets, sheets and others in order to have a wider variety available to offer her customers.

loans.use: to buy blankets, sheets and others.

loans.name: Olivier

texts.fr: Olivier est un homme de 28 ans fiancé, père de deux enfants de 1 et 4 ans. il commerçant et a ouvert une petite structure dans laquelle il commercialise les pneus de véhicules, gentes, pièces détachées.depuis 04 ans. Son activité fonctionnement bien grâce à la clientèle qu'il a acquis au fil dut temps. Il sollicite ce prêt parce qu'il n'arrive plus à la satisfaire ceci est du à la petitesse de son capital qui l'oblige à acheter ses marchandises en petites quantité et faire écouler un bonne quantité pour pouvoir s'approvisionner à nouveau. Le bénéfice que lui apportera ce crédit sera en partie réinvesti dans son activté et le reste lui permettra de subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en: Olivier is 28 years old and is engaged to be married. He is the father of two children who are 1 and 4 years old. He is a shopkeeper, and four years ago he opened a small space where he sells car tires, rims, and other car parts. His business is doing well due to the clients that he's acquired over time. He is asking for a loan because he can no longer meet the needs of his clients. Since he has a small amount of capital, he can only buy his goods in small quantities. He also has to sell a large amount of his stock in order to make new purchases. Part of the profits that he makes from this loan will be reinvested in his business, and the rest will allow him to meet the needs of his family.

loans.use: increase his inventory of tires, rims, oil, and other car parts.

loans.name: Rakiba

texts.ru: Ракиба очень трудолюбивая и целеустремлённая женщина. Она родилась в селе, и имеет достаточный опыт по животноводству и выращивания сельхоз культуры.
