После занятий в школе она работала на поле, чтобы заработать деньги, чтобы помогать родителям. После замужества она опять занималась земледелием. В основном  Ракиба выращивает пшеницу, ячмень и другие сельхозпродукты. Уже более 4 месяцев она самостоятельно занимается этим бизнесом. Муж помогает ей в ведении бизнеса. Полученный урожай они  продают местным жителям по более низкой цене, чем на базаре, с первых рук. В целях повышения своей навыки  Ракиба приняла участие на тренинге «Добейся успеха» проведённого Национальной Ассоциации Деловых Женщин. Она планирует организовать новый бизнес животноводством и поэтому запрашивает займ на сумму 2500 сомони для покупки скота. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Rakiba is a very hard-working and determined woman. She was born in a village and has substantial experience in animal husbandry and growing crops. After she completed her schooling, Rakiba began working in the fields to earn money so she could help her parents. After getting married, she began working in farming again. Rakiba mainly grows wheat, barley and other crops. For the last 4 months, she has been doing this type of business independently, with the help of her husband. They sell their harvest directly to local residents at a price that is lower than what is charged at the market. For the purpose of improving her skills, Rakiba took part in the training course "Get Ahead" that was organized by the National Association of Businesswomen. Rakiba plans to set up a business in animal husbandry, and for that reason she is seeking a loan in the amount of 2,500 Tajikistan Somoni to buy cattle. She is waiting for your kind assistance.

loans.use: To buy cattle to establish a new business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a variety of soft drinks and grocery to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase other kinds of groceries to bring variety into her shop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy vitamins, syrups, pills and creams.

loans.name: Sadid

texts.es: Sadid, vive en la población de Malambo con su cónyuge  y sus dos hijos en las edades de 8 y 29 años. Allí tiene varios negocios, por un lado  vende carbón, mientras por otro alquila mesas, también ofrece el servicio de transporte en una carretilla y vende frutas y verduras  frescas. Con estos negocios ha logrado apoyar los ingresos de su hogar, desde el año 1997,  cuando empezó a generarlos, pues conocía esta actividad ya que la  había aprendido de sus abuelos, en un pueblo de Córdoba llamado Planeta Rica. Sadid con la ayuda de su hermana, compró 3 hectáreas de tierras y las dedicó al cultivo de limones, mangos, guayabas y ciruelas principalmente, además de la venta del carbón; actividad que emprendió una vez llegó al municipio de Malambo, donde hoy habita y tiene su negocio, al que ha agregado otras tareas productivas. Sus principales clientes son las tiendas, a quienes les vende de contado y a diario, trabajando desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 4 de la tarde. Su meta más adelante es mejorar su medio de transporte o carretillas, que utiliza para llevar tienda a tienda de los municipios de Malambo y de Soledad, todos los productos que vende y con ello aumentar sus utilidades, todo esto, con el fin de mas adelante pueda incrementar su producción de tal forma, que logre mejorar las condiciones habitacionales, para siempre proteger sus hijos en especial al mayor de ellos,  que se encuentra en estado de discapacidad. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará carbón,banano, limón, guayaba, mango, sillas en madera, y una carrerilla para transportar de los productos directamente a su distinguida clientela.
texts.en:
Sadid lives in Malambo with her spouse and two children who are 8 and 29 years old.  She has several businesses there.  On the one hand she sells charcoal while she also rents out tables.  She also provides transportation services with a cart and sells fresh fruit and vegetables.  She’s managed to provide household income through these businesses since 1997 when she started them.  She knew this activity because she’d learned it from her grandparents in a town in Córdoba called Planeta Rica.

With help from her sister, Sadid bought three hectares of land and started to grow lemons, mangoes, guavas and plums mainly and also started to sell charcoal, an activity she started once she moved to Malambo where she now lives and has her business to which she’s added other productive activities.  Her main customers are stores she sells to daily and for cash.  She works from 8am until 4pm.  Her goal for later on is to improve her means of transport or carts she uses to go from store to store in Malambo and Soledad taking all the products she sells so that she can increase profits.  All of this is in order to increase production later on so that she can do some home improvements to protect her children always, especially her oldest son who is disabled.

She’s currently asking for a Kiva loan, her first financing from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo that she’ll use to buy charcoal, bananas, lemons, mangoes, wooden chairs and a cart to transport her products directly to her distinguished clientele.

loans.use: to buy bananas, lemons, guavas, mangoes, wooden chairs, charcoal and a cart.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase more palm fruit to extract the oil for sale

loans.name: Teofilo

texts.es: Teofilo se dedica al comercio de mercancía en general, el sale de su casa todos los dias y en su carretilla  transporta sillas mesas, y otros articulos exhibiendolos por todo el  el municipio de Soledad, donde habita con su familia. Entre los productos que vende están las mecedoras, las almohadas, sabanas, toallas y electrodomésticos menores que comercializa a crédito entre sus vecinos, habitantes del municipio donde habita. En la actualidad está aplicando aun credikiva, segundo financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará electrodomésticos menores y otras mercancías, para lograr el aumento del volumen de sus ventas y una rotación de inventarios mayor. Por eso comprará ventiladores de mesa, electrodomésticos almohadas y mercancías requeridas por sus clientes y que tienen una salida comercial inmediata. El se encuentra muy agradecido con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, porque el crédito es una gran ayuda para él y lo hace con el propósito de crecimiento y mejoramiento de sus condiciones empresariales actuales, como el incremento de su capital de trabajo y para tener una oferta de mercancías, que rote rápidamente y es que esto es justamente lo que hace que la inversión de credikiva, logre el éxito que Teófilo espera.
texts.en:
Teófilo works selling general merchandise.  He leaves home daily transporting chairs, tables and other merchandise in his cart displaying them throughout the town of Soledad where he lives with his family.  Among the products he sells are rocking chairs, pillows, sheets, towels and small home appliances that he sells on credit to his neighbors and residents in the town where he lives.  

He’s currently applying for a Kiva loan, his second Fundación Mario Santo Domingo financing that he’ll use to buy small home appliances and other merchandise to increase sales volume and have a larger inventory turnover.  He will buy table fans, home appliances, pillows and merchandise needed by his customers that will sell immediately.

He’s very grateful to Fundación Mario Santo Domingo because the loan is of great use for him and he does it aiming at growing and improving his current business conditions like increasing working capital in order to have merchandise available for sale that will turnover quickly; this is what will make his Kiva loan have the success Teófilo expects it to have.

loans.use: to buy small home appliances and other merchandise.

loans.name: Me'rojiddin

texts.ru: Меърожиддин 34 - летний житель района Кубодиен. Меърожиддин женат, он является отцом пятерых детей. Меърожиддин просит кредит для закупа бычков и телят, чтобы заняться скотоводством. Меърожиддин создал все условия для разведения крупного рогатого скота у себя дома. Кроме того у Меърожиддина имеется собственная мельница, где на сегодняшний день он работает.
texts.en: Me'rojiddin is 34 years old and lives in the Qubadiyon region. He is married and has 5 children. Me'rojiddin is seeking a loan to purchase bulls and calves so that he can work in animal husbandry. He has set up all the necessary facilities for raising cattle at home. In addition, Me'rojiddin has his own mill where he currently works.

loans.use: to purchase bulls and calves

loans.name: Esi

texts.en:
Esi cooks plain rice and banku (fermented cooked corn dough and cassava dough).  She serves it with tomato sauce, macaroni, and fried fish; she has been doing this for 35 years. 

She is widow and has 9 dependents. Esi uses her earnings to pay her children’s school fees and other household expenses.  Esi will use the loan to purchase bags of maize, rice, tomatoes, cooking oil and so on. She anticipates reinvesting the new profit.

loans.use: to purchase bags of maize, rice, tomatoes, cooking oil and so on to prepare food to sell.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 40 years old, married and has two children .They live in the village of Rizal in Isabela province  Her husband, Bernando, works as a farmer. Teresita is a vegetable vendor in her village. She buys vegetables in bulk and then sells them at retail prices. She is planning to expand her business in order to increase her income. Therefore, she requests a loan of PHP 22,000. Teresita believes she must be diligent enough to work hard to achieve her goals and send her children to school so they can have a better future. She hopes that her business will continue to grow and that she will have a permanent business stall in the market.

Teresita is thankful her family is still happy even in times of crisis. She hopes and prays to God that her family will remain healthy and away from any harm.

loans.use: to expand her vegetable business.

loans.name: Aba

texts.en: Aba is a petty trader who is married to a farmer and resides in Abura, Ghana. Among the items she sells are onions, footware, buscuite, toffies, salt, soft drinks and canned fish. Aba uses her income to support her partner to take care of the home. Aba will use the loan to purchase other types of groceries to add variety for her customers. She plans to reinvest the new profit.

loans.use: to purchase other types of groceries to add variety for her customers.

loans.name: Azka's Group

texts.en:
Azka is a 34-year-old woman who lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan, with her husband and two sons. Both of her sons are students. Her husband is a taxi driver and in recent weeks he has not been able to generate any income as the engine of his taxi is not working properly. Azka herself is an efficient tailor who has operated her business very well since 2008. Her husband is very happy that his wife has been doing a great job. 

Azka, as a member of a 10-person lending group, has requested a loan from Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan. With the loan amount, she will be purchasing a new sewing machine so that she can expand her business. With the profit, she will save some money and repay the loan amount. She wants to purchase a new taxi for her husband. As she is living in a rented house with her family, she dreams to build her own house. She also desires to increase her business and to provide a quality education for her children. Many thanks from her to all the staff of Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.
Note: In the picture Azka holding a passbook in her hand.

loans.use: to purchase a sewing machine to expand her tailoring business.

loans.name: Norah

texts.en:
Norah is widowed with six children, four of whom go to school. She has a business of selling charcoal. She has been in this business for five years. She generates additional income through rental rooms. She sells charcoal both retail and wholesale and works six days a week. Her major business challenges include transportation and seasonality. 

Norah has applied for a loan of 1,700,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO to buy more bags of charcoal. She aspires to see her business grow big so that she is able to buy a delivery van to ease in transportation, and also hopes to sell wholesale only. 

She resides in her own house, and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees, electricity and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en: Jocelyn is a 23-year-old married woman with two children. She hails from Baclayon, Bohol. She has been in the sari- sari (convenience) store business for two years.She sells merchandise like soft drinks, eggs, coffee, biscuits and canned goods. Jocelyn is requesting a loan of 9,000 PHP to buy additional merchandise like noodles, canned goods, soft drinks, eggs and coffee. In the future, Jocelyn would like to expand her business into other ventures to support the schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, eggs, coffee, noodles and canned goods.

loans.name: Nelvadis

texts.es: Nelvadis con su previo credikiva reparó el molino eléctrico, con el cual prepara su masa de maíz pilado y elabora sus productos fritos. Así mismo compró en mayor volumen, aceite y maíz, inversión con la cual le fue muy  bien y por eso está entusiasmada en hacer crecer aun más su negocio. Hoy está aplicando a un nuevo credikiva con el cual elaborará un mesón metálico en acero inoxidable y comprará una vez más maíz al por mayor. Su éxito radica en los descuentos que obtiene al no comprar las materias primas al detal pues gana descuentos por compras en este sentido y de contado. Ella dice a sus financiadores de Kiva que está “muy agradecida de todo corazón, por la ayuda recibida y que siempre los encomiendo en sus oraciones a ustedes y a su familias. “
texts.en:
Nelvadis used her previous Kiva loan to repair her electric mill she uses to make corn dough used for her fried products.  She also bought large amounts of oil and corn.  She did very well with this investment and this is why she’s excited about making her business grow still more.  

Today, she’s applying for a new Kiva loan she’ll use to build a large stainless steel table and once again to buy corn at wholesale.  Her success is based on the discounts she gets when buying raw materials in quantity and not at retail because she qualifies for discounts this way as well as for paying cash.  

he says to all her Kiva lenders: “I thank you with all my heart for the help I’ve received; I always keep you and your families in my prayers.”

loans.use: to build a large stainless steel table and to buy corn at wholesale.

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en:
Ekua sells footwear and cooking utenstils at Asafora near Cape Coast.  She is married and has four children. Her husband is a farmer.  

Ekua has been selling these goods for some years now.  She supports her husband in paying their children’s school fees.  She will use her loan to purchase more footwear and cooking utensils to sell.  She hopes to use the new profits from her business to build a shop for the sale of her footwear and cooking utenstils

loans.use: purchase more footwear and cooking utensils to sell

loans.name: Rano

texts.ru: Раъно очень трудолюбивая и целеустремленная женщина. Ей 52 года и она замужем. На воспитании имеет 1 умственно отсталую дочь. Ей 31 года. Условия жизни у них очень тяжелые. Чтобы прокормить семью муж  Раъно уехал в  Россию на заработки. С целью обеспечения семьи со всеми не обходимыми средствами, Рано организовала свой бизнес выращиванием сельхоз культуры. Уже более 4-ёх месяцев она занимается этим бизнесом. Большая часть населения данного района приобретают пшеницу, ячмень, а затем на мельнице получают муку и выпекают хлеб для личного пользования. Раъно хочет получить побольше доходов путем развития нового бизнеса и на полученный доход планирует, улучшит благосостояние семьи, т.е достроит дом. Она очень надеется на вашу помощь и поддержку.
texts.en: Rano is a very hard-working and determined woman. She is 52 years old and married. She has one mentally challenged daughter who 31 years old and lives at home. Their living conditions are tough. Rano's husband has gone to Russia to earn money in order to feed his family. To help provide for the family's needs, four months ago Rano started a business growing crops. Most of the residents in the area where Rano lives buy wheat and barley that they take to the mill to be made into flour which they use to bake bread for household consumption. Rano wants to increase her profit by developing her new business and to use the increased income to improve her family's living standard, specifically by fixing their house. She is hoping for your kind assistance and support.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers to develop a new business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase bags of maize for the kenkey.

loans.name: Jovielyn

texts.en: A 38-year-old from the community of Capellan, Jovielyn is a very diligent woman. According to her, hard work makes your dream come true. She is requesting a loan of 20,000 PHP to buy additional products for her store, such as beverages, snack food and spices. Jovielyn's dream is to expand her business so that she can sustain the needs of her family.

loans.use: to buy beverages, snack food and spices for her store

loans.name: Analiza

texts.en:
Analiza runs a general store business situated in front of her house. Aside from selling different groceries, she also retails plastic wares like durabox (plastic cabinets), bamboo sala sets (living room furniture), appliances, and a lot more. She lives in a place away from the town proper, so she thought of selling those items to reach customers in their distant and remote village of Capellan province of Isabela.  She uses her income in sustaining the educational needs of her two children. 

Analiza is asking for a loan of PHP 10,000 to be used as her additional business capital to buy more items to be displayed just beside her house so as to grow her business. She doesn’t want her children to experience the hardship of life that she and her husband have previiously experienced because they were not able to gain a good education in college or even in high school.

loans.use: to use as additional capital for her business

loans.name: Efua

texts.en:
Efua sells cassava, plantain, and palm fruit at  Asafora near Abura.  Efua has been selling foodstuffs for three years now.  She uses her income to assist her husband in paying their children’s school fees.  

Efua will use her loan to purchase cassava, plantains, and a variety of foodstuffs to sell.  With the new profit she will expand her business.

loans.use: purchase cassava, plantain, and a variety of foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Justina

texts.es: La socia Justina nació en la ciudad de Mollepata pero actualmente vive en la ciudad del Cusco, tiene 58  años de edad y tiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene cuatro hijos. La socia Justina se dedica a la venta de especerías en uno de los mercados más populares de la ciudad del Cusco, ella en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar mercadería como por ejemplo condimentos.  Ya son varios años que se dedica al negocio y le va muy bien. La socia Justina pertenece al banco comunal “Los Andes” de la Asociación Arariwa de la ciudad del Cusco.
texts.en:
Justina was born in Mollepata, but she is currently living in Cusco. She is 58 years old and lives in a common-law marriage, from which she has four children.

Justina sells spices in one of the most popular markets in Cusco. She is now requesting a loan to buy spices and other supplies. She has been selling spices for several years and she does very well.

Justina is a member of the communal bank “Los Andes”, a part of Asociación Arariwa, from Cusco.

loans.use: to buy spices and other supplies.

loans.name: Kousar

texts.en:
Kousar is a 27-year-old married woman and mother of two. She has run a tailoring business for five years. She accepted the fact that if her husband were the only one working in their family, they would not be able to meet the expenses of the household and the children’s educational needs. That is why she started tailoring at home to support her family.

She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Now, she has requested a loan of Rs. 20,000 to purchase more reels of threads, packs of buttons, laces etc. so that she will be able to meet increasing demand. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. Kousar hopes her business will grow and dreams of providing her children with a good, quality education through all her hard work in her business.

loans.use: To purchase more reels of threads, packs of buttons, laces etc.

loans.name: William Lionel

texts.es: El socio William nació en la ciudad de Cusco y  vive en la misma ciudad donde nació, él tiene 30 años de edad y tiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene dos hijos. El socio William se dedica a la venta de computadoras en su domicilio, él en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar accesorios como por ejemplo memorias, mouse y otras cosas. Ya son varios años que se dedica al negocio y le va muy bien. El socio William pertenece al banco comunal “Los Andes” de la Asociación Arariwa de la ciudad del Cusco.
texts.en: William was born in the city of Cusco and still lives in the city of his birth.  He’s 30-years-old and lives in a common law relationship; he has two children.  William sells computers at home and on this occasion needs the loan to buy accessories like memories, mice and other things.  He’s been in business several years now and does very well.  He’s a member of Asociación Arariwa’s “Los Andes” communal bank in the city of Cusco.

loans.use: to buy computer accessories.

loans.name: Abena

texts.en:
Abena produces kenkey, a Ghanaian staple food, in large quantities and distributes it for sale at Asafora near Cape Coast. In front of her are leaves she uses in covering the dough in her kenkey production.   Abana has done this for 15 years. She is married with 10 dependants.  Abena uses her income to assist her husband to pay their accomodation bills.  

Abena will use her loan to purchase bags of maize for the kenkey production.  With the new profit, Abena plans to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase bags of maize for kenkey production.

loans.name: Ntimama

texts.en:
Ntimama is 42 years old and married. He supports a family of six children. He is a maize farmer, and he has been in this business for the past 12 years with a monthly income of KES 20,000. 

He is servicing his second loan of KES 30,000 from KADET LTD.  He will use the loan to prepare the land and purchase farm inputs.


He hopes to use anticipated profits to expand his farm and reinvest. His future dreams are to improve his family's living standards and educate his children

loans.use: to prepare the land and purchase farm inputs.

loans.name: Efua

texts.en:
Efua cooks banku for sale. She serves the banku with fish and vegetable sauce at Asafora near Cape Coast.   Efua is married to a farmer and has seven children.   

Efua has done this for six years now. She uses her income to support her husband in paying their children’s school fees. 

Her loan will be used to purchase bags of  maize and fish for her banku business.

loans.use: To purchase bags of maize and fish for her banku business.

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en:
Ekua cooks plain rice and serves it with tomato sauce, macroni, and fried fish, which she has done for 35 years. She is widow and has nine  dependents.  Ekua uses her earnings to pay her children’s school fees and other household expenses.  

Ekua is showing some of the raw rice that she cooks for sale, but it's not enough.  She needs a loan from Kiva to enable her to buy bags of rice, tomatoes, cooking oil, fish, and other items to prepare her food for sale. She anticipates reinvesting the new profit.

loans.use: buy bags of rice, tomatoes, cooking oil, fish, and other items to prepare her food for sale.

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en:
Ekua lives together with her husband and four children at Asafora near Cape Coast.  She sells cassavas and plantains.   Ekua has been selling foodstuffs for three years now.  She uses her income to assist her husband in paying their children’s school fees.  

Ekua will use her loan to purchase cassavas, plantains,  and a variety of foodstuffs to sell.  With the new profit, she will expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase cassavas, plantains, and a variety of foodstuffs to sell.

loans.name: Magaly

texts.es: Magaly de 45 años de edad, vive con su cónyuge y sus 3 hijos en las edades de 11 a 21 años. Ella desde hace 7 años, se dedica a la actividad comercial: vende mercancías mediante guías especializadas de productos o catálogos, respondiendo a pedidos que su clientela hace a través de su preventa. Los principales productos con los que trabaja son la perfumería, los cosméticos, las cremas y los accesorios femeninos. En la actualidad su clientela va en aumento y la demanda de estos productos ocurre en el mismo sentido, pero su capital de trabajo se torna insuficiente para responder a su potencial clientela. Esta es la razón por la cual acude a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará productos que han llegado en descuentos en sus catálogos, como colonias femeninas y masculinas, perfumes, cosméticos y cremas, las cuales venderá a créditos, en plazos cortos entre su clientela, a la que escoge con mucho cuidado y por la que trabaja durante 12 horas diarias sin descanso, con el fin de aumentar cada vez más sus ingresos y lograr sus sueños de ver a sus hijos, que terminen sus estudios y sean unos profesionales brillantes.
texts.en:
Magaly is 45 years old. She lives with her partner and her three children, aged from 11 to 21. 

She has worked in sales for seven years. She sells merchandise through specialized product guides or catalogs, responding to orders that her clientele place as a result of her pre-sales work. 

The main products that she works with are perfumes, cosmetics, creams, and  women's accessories. Currently her clientele is increasing, and the demand for these products is moving in the same direction. But her working capital is proving to be insufficient to respond to her potential clientele. This is the reason why she is applying for a Kiva loan; the first she is taking out with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. 

With the loan, she will buy products that have become available at discounts in her catalogs, such as women's and men's colognes, perfumes, cosmetics and creams, which she will sell among her customers by extending short-term credit. These are customers she chooses very carefully and for whom she works tirelessly, 12 hours a day. Her aim is to increase her income more and more and achieve her dream of seeing her children complete their education and become outstanding professionals.

loans.use: To buy colognes for women and men, perfumes, cosmetics and creams.

loans.name: Ana

texts.es:
Ana de 45 años de edad, vive con su familia conformada por su cónyuge y sus 5 hijos, en las edades de 8 a 25 años, en la ciudad de Barranquilla. Allí se dedica a la venta de comidas rápidas y también genera otros ingresos, alquilando máquinas de lavar diariamente entre sus vecinas del barrio. Su negocio inició desde hace 3 años y cuando su esposo no estaba laborando, decidieron emprender un  negocio de alquiler de lavadoras, experiencia que tomó de su suegra, quien se dedicó a ello. Ana también trabaja como empleada del servicio doméstico y los negocios usualmente son atendidos por su cónyuge. También aprovechando su conocimiento en la preparación de comidas rápidas, dio curso a esta actividad  y con todas estas tareas conjuntas, la pareja  sostienen a su familia. 
Los principales productos de su oferta son las picadas de embutidos, los perros calientes y las hamburguesas, los cuales son bien preparados, con salsas y combinaciones que cada día inventan, para que sean las delicias de su clientela. En el servicio de lavadoras, sus clientes trasladan a sus domicilios estas maquinas, para realizar las tareas de lavar la ropa, de todos los miembros del hogar. En la actualidad sus negocios están en un rango de crecimiento y su capital de trabajo no responde a las necesidades de dar al mercado lo que este requiere; esta es justamente la razón para aplicar a un credikiva, con el cual comprará 3 lavadoras para aumentar su capacidad de respuesta al servicio y también comprará salsas, carnes frías, verduras, panes, para aumentar la oferta de productos en su punto de ventas. El éxito de su credikiva radica en su experiencia en este negocio y la coyuntura de su creciente demanda, especialmente en el segundo semestre del año, temporada en la que usualmente aumentan sus ventas. Su sueño de prosperidad, es que su negocio crezca, para lograr adquirir su propia casa y generar un mayor bienestar familiar.
texts.en:
Ana, 45, lives with her family composed of her spouse and five children whose ages range between 8 and 25 years in Barranquilla.  She sells fast food there and generates additional income renting out washing machines daily to her neighbors.  She started the business three years ago and when her husband became unemployed they decided to start the washing machine rental business, an experience she took from her mother-in-law who worked at that.  Ana also works as a domestic employee and the businesses are usually looked after by her spouse.  Taking advantage of her fast-food cooking skills she started this activity and with all of her activities together the couple supports their family.

The main things she offers are cold-cut plates, hot-dogs and hamburgers that are well-prepared with sauces and combinations thought up daily to delight her customers.  In the washing machine business her customers take the machines to their homes to do the washing for all the family members.  Currently, her businesses are in a growth phase and her working capital is insufficient to keep up with market needs which is precisely why she needs to apply for a Kiva loan to buy three washing machines to increase capacity and respond to service calls.  She will also buy sauces, cold-cuts, vegetables and bread rolls to increase offer of products in her food stand.

The success of her Kiva loans rests on her business experience meeting growing demand, especially during the second semester of the year which is a season when sales usually increase.  Her dream for prosperity is that the business grows to buy a house of her own and generate greater family wellbeing.

loans.use: to buy sauces, cold cuts, vegetables, bread and three washing machines.

loans.name: Salvador Manuel

texts.es:
Salvador, se dedica a la venta de cosméticos y productos para el hogar, es una persona de hogar, no tiene hijos está soltero, vive junto a su familia, él aprendió el negocio por iniciativa propia, tiene más de un año de realizarlo, su dificultad en el negocio es cuando los pedidos de mercadería se tardan.
Solicita un préstamo para la compra de cremas, lociones, shampoo, cosméticos,  desinfectantes, con esta compra estará mejorando el negocio, obteniendo productos de mayor demanda para suplir las necesidades de los clientes, generando más ventas y los ingresos para el hogar. 
Su objetivo es aumentar los productos, agregar mayor diversidad al negocio, para poder llegar a otras zonas, además quiere tener a futuro un local fijo.
texts.en:
Salvador sells cosmetics and household products.  He’s a man of his home.  He’s single and has no children.  He lives with his family.  He learned the business on his own initiative and has been in it for a year.  His business difficulty is when his products are late in arriving.

He’s requesting a loan to buy creams, lotions, shampoo, cosmetics and disinfectants.  With this purchase he will be improving the business obtaining products in highest demand to meet customer needs generating more sales and household income.

His goal is to increase his products adding more diversity to the business in order to reach other zones; he’d also like to have a permanent locale in the future.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics.

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es: Isabel  de 56 años de edad se dedica al comercio de calzado, ropa, cosméticos, platería y otras variedades que su clientela solicita muy seguido, por eso intentando complacerla recurre a fuentes de financiación, para tener capacidad de compra, lograr descuentos especiales y responder a la demanda de sus compradores, quienes son los que al final generan los ingresos para apoyar el bienestar de su hogar. Desde el año 2001, empezó vendiendo sencillos artículos, para complementar los ingresos de su hogar, su negocio poco a poco fue creciendo y hoy vende de todo un poco: calzado, ropa, cosméticos, platería, según pedidos de su clientela, a fines ofrece créditos de acuerdo a su capacidad de pago y también vende de contado en una jornada de 8 horas diarias. Sus principales clientes son sus vecinos, y referidos, los cuales se han constituido en compradores fijos. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, segundo financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo,  teniendo en cuenta que con el anterior crédito mejoró su liquidez, aumentó sus ventas y generó más utilidades. Con su credikiva, hoy comprará al por mayor y de contado artículos que solicitan sus clientes en la temporada de fin de año, como adornos navideños, accesorios femeninos y otras variedades. Sus 11 años de experiencia y el conocimiento de cómo se mueve el mercado en cada época, son los mejores indicadores, de que este, su credikiva sea muy exitoso.
texts.en:
Isabel, 56, makes a living selling footwear, clothing, cosmetics, silverwork, and other assorted goods that her customers request frequently.  She tries to satisfy the demand with sources of financing so she can make purchases, get special discounts, and respond to her customers, who are the ones who generate the income to support the well-being of her household.

In 2001 she began selling small items to supplement her household income.  Little by little her business grew and now she sells a bit of everything: footwear, clothing, cosmetics, and silverwork, on customer request.  She offers loans in accordance with the capacity to pay and also sells in cash during her eight-hour day.  Her main customers are her neighbors and referrals who have turned into steady customers.

Currently she's applying for a Kiva loan, her second financing from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.  With the previous loan she improved her liquidity, increased her sales, and earned more profit.  With her Kiva loan she's going to buy wholesale and cash articles that her customers request at the end of the year, such as Christmas decorations, women's accessories, and other assorted goods.

Her 11 years of experience and knowledge of how the market behaves seasonally are the best indicators that her Kiva loan will be successful.

loans.use: to buy Christmas decorations, women's accessories, and other assorted goods

loans.name: Aba

texts.en:
Aba operates a chop bar, where a variety of African dishes are sold.  Aba is the lady scooping soup from the pot.  She has run her chop bar for four  years now.  The food she serves is fufu, banku, and rice balls.  She is married to a driver and has five children.   Aba uses her income to support her husband in paying their children’s school fees. 

With the new profit, Aba plans to get a better place to enable her to serve her customers

loans.use: To purchase foodstuffs and other ingredients to prepare food for sale.

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es: Sonia de 45 años vive en el municipio de Soledad, área metropolitana de la ciudad de Barranquilla, donde se dedica a la venta de pasabocas y en general productos derivadas de la harina de trigo que empaca en bandejas de icopor cubiertas con plástico. Ella también vende refrescos congelados y produce hielo, que comercializa entre sus principales clientes comerciantes, ubicados en el sector donde habita y en barrios aledaños. Su meta es alcanzar un mayor nivel de ingresos familiar, pues sueña con que hija de 13 años tenga una educación de calidad que le ayude a ser muy exitosa.  En la actualidad está aplicando a  un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará un congelador vertical, que le proveerá la higiene y conservación requerida para sus productos congelados y para su materia prima y con ello aumentará sus ventas, para escalar su camino hacia el crecimiento de sus ingresos y   el aumento de su bienestar familiar
texts.en:
Sonia, 45, lives in Soledad part of the Barranquilla metropolitan area.  She sells snacks and general products made from wheat flour that she packs in Styrofoam trays covered with plastic wrap.  She also sells frozen treats and makes ice that she sells among her main merchant customers from her and from adjacent neighborhoods.

Her goal is to reach higher levels of family income because she dreams with her 13-year-old daughter having a quality education that will help her be very successful.  She’s currently applying for a Kiva loan, her first Fundación Mario Santo Domingo financing to buy a stand-up freezer that will provide hygiene and the required storage for her frozen treats and for her raw materials to increase sales and move along the path towards income growth and improved family wellbeing.

loans.use: to buy a stand-up freezer and raw materials.

loans.name: Fanny

texts.es: La socia Fanny nació en la ciudad de Quillabamba pero actualmente vive en la ciudad del Cusco, tiene 28 años de edad y es soltera. La socia Fanny es asesora jurídica y trabaja de forma independiente. Ya son seis meses que se dedica a su trabajo y le va muy bien. Ella en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar útiles de escritorio como por ejemplo papel, tintas, lapiceros y otras cosas más que hacen falta en la oficina. La socia Fanny pertenece al banco comunal “Los Andes” de la Asociación Arariwa de la ciudad del Cusco.
texts.en: Fanny was born in the city of Quillabamba but currently lives in the city of Cusco.  She’s 28-years-old and single.  Fanny works independently as a legal advisor; she’s been in business six months and does very well.  On this occasion she needs a loan to buy office supplies like paper, ink, pencils, etc. that she needs for her office.  Fanny is a member of Asociación Arariwa’s “Los Andes” communal bank in the city of Cusco.

loans.use: to buy office supplies like paper, ink, pencils, etc.

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.es: Beatriz de 31 años de edad y en condiciones de mujer viuda y madre de 3 hijos, decidió emprender su propia aventura de negocios, impulsada por una amiga comerciante y mayorista de artículos varios; Para atender su responsabilidad de mujer cabeza de familia, se dedicó a la venta de mercancía variada y al detal, entre clientes ubicados en el sector donde habita y  amigos y referidos,   principalmente empleados que trabajan en empresas y con sus ingresos no alcanzan a comprar  de contado, artículos que Beatriz vende y que sus familias requieren, como anillos, dijes  y cadenas en pedrería, en acero y plata. Sus ventas las realiza a crédito y muchas veces de contado y con una frecuencia diaria, trabajando desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 7 de la noche. Su clientela poco a poco ha crecido y su experiencia de 4 años le indica, que debe aplicar capital de crédito para poder ampliar el volumen de sus ventas, por eso ella ha acudido a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, donde realizó anteriormente 1 crédito, que le ayudó a incrementar su capacidad de compra y así mismo el número de su clientes. Esta es la razón por la cual acude a un credikiva, segundo crédito a esta organización, con el cual comprará artículos de bisutería, accesorios en plata y en acero, los cuales son muy vendidos en la temporada del segundo semestre del año, época en la cual se acercan las fiestas y su clientela quiere lucir muy elegante. Su meta más adelante es convertirse en mayorista de estos productos y surtir a muchas misceláneas, con las cuales está haciendo su primer contacto y es que su experiencia y su capacidad para cumplir sus sueños, son la fortaleza más importante con la que cuenta su negocio, para hacer de su credikiva una inversión exitosa.
texts.en:
Beatriz, 31, is a widow and mother of three children.  She decided to start her own business venture encouraged by a girlfriend who is a merchant and wholesaler of various articles.  In order to fulfill her obligations as a woman who is head of household, she started selling varied merchandise at retail among customers located around her neighborhood and to friends and referred customers mainly employees who work in firms and whose salaries are insufficient for them to pay cash for the items Beatriz sells and their families need like steel and silver rings, charms and chains with stones.  She sells daily on credit and often for cash; she works from 8 in the morning until 7 at night.  Her clientele has been gradually growing and she four years’ experience tells her that she must apply for a loan in order to expand the volume of her sales. 

This is why she’s called on Fundación Mario Santo Domingo where she’s had one previous loan that helped her increase her buying capacity and her number of customers.  This is the reason behind her applying for a Kiva loan, her second loan from this organization, that she’ll use to buy costume jewelry, steel and silver accessories, that sell very well during the year’s second semester which is when the end-of-year parties approach and people want to look very elegant.

Her goal for later on is to become a wholesaler of these products and to supply many variety stores that she’s already making initial contacts with.  Her experience and her capacity to make her dreams reality are the most important strength her business can rely on to make her Kiva loan a successful investment.

loans.use: to buy steel and silver costume jewelry.

loans.name: Maria Luisa

texts.es: La socia Maria Luisa nació en la ciudad del Cusco y vive en la misma ciudad donde nació, ella tiene 28 años de edad y es soltera. La socia Maria Luisa es Obstetra y trabaja en un centro de salud en unos de los distritos de la ciudad del Cusco. Ya son varios años que se dedica a su trabajo y le va muy bien. Maria Luisa y su mamá tienen un pequeño negocio en sociedad que consiste en vender carne. Ella en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar una maquina molinera que le hace falta a la carnicería. La socia Maria Luisa pertenece al banco comunal “Los Andes” de la Asociación Arariwa de la ciudad del Cusco.
texts.en:
Member Maria Luisa was born in the city of Cusco and lives in the same city where she was born. She is 28 years old and single. Maria Luisa is an obstetrician and works at a health center in one of the districts in the city of Cusco. She has been working for several years and things are going very well for her. 

Maria Luisa and her mother are partners in a small business selling meat. This time, she wants the loan to purchase a grinding machine they need for the butcher shop.

Member Maria Luisa belongs to Asociación Arariwa's communal bank Los Andes, in the city of Cusco.

loans.use: to purchase a grinding machine.

loans.name: Noris

texts.es: Noris de 31 años de edad, madre de una niña de 6 años de edad, desde hace 7, por sugerencia de su prima de- dedicada al comercio, decidió vender mercancías a crédito mediante pedidos; su negocio poco a poco fue captando más clientes y hoy en su preventa logra muchos pedidos, que no son proporcionales al   capital de trabajo con el que cuenta, el cual resulta insuficiente, para atender la demanda de productos, como perfumería, cremas, calzado, pantalones y camisas. Su meta es aumentar las ventas y ella está segura que con un capital de crédito, lo logrará; esta es la razón por la cual    está aplicando a un credikiva, su primer financiamiento que hace a la  Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual logrará descuentos en sus compras de ropa, calzado y colonias, por hacerlo en mayor volumen y de contado. Su propósito de seguir ampliando sus ventas no se detiene y hoy sus indicadores financieros, presentan un margen de utilidad no menor del 35% y una rotación de cuentas por cobrar de 40 días, lo cual es muy apropiado en este tipo de negocios.
texts.en: Noris, 31, is the mother of a six-year-old girl.  For the last 7 years on advice from her cousin she’s been a merchant.  She decided to sell merchandise to order on credit.  Her business gradually captured more customers and today her presales are large.  However, they are not proportional to the working capital she has which is insufficient to meet demand for perfume, cream, shoes, pants and shirts.  Her goal is to increase sales and she’s sure that with working capital she’ll succeed in doing so.  This is the reason why she’s applying for a Kiva loan, her first financing with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo that will qualify her for discounts in her purchases of clothes, shoes and cologne because she’ll buy in volume and pay cash.  Her goal is to continue to expand. Her sales don’t stop and today her financial indicators present a profit margin of no less than 35% and a 40 day accounts receivable rotation which is very appropriate for this type of business.

loans.use: to buy clothes, shoes and cologne.

loans.name: Denis

texts.es: Denis de 39 años de edad vive en el municipio de Puerto Colombia, con sus dos hijos en las edades de 18 y 2 años: allí en esta tierra de playa, briza y mar con un potencial turístico importante,  vende mercancías mediante guías especializadas de productos para lograr ingresos con os cuales sostener a sus dos hijos. Las colonias, los perfumes, las cremas y maquillajes son los productos favoritos de su clientela y Denis está muy pendiente de las ofertas que llegan en su catalogo, para lograr captar la atención, el interés, el deseo y la acción de compra de ellos.  Su meta mas adelante es abrir un punto comercial o miscelánea donde agregue variedades de productos que sus vecinos compran en otros lugares, pudiendo ella vendérselos si tuviera suficiente capital de trabajo para comprar.  Su negocio inició desde hace un año, pues no encontraba un trabajo como empleada y por eso decidió emprender su propia aventura de negocios. En la actualidad maneja un margen de utilidad promedia del 17% y una rotación de inventarios de 12 días, con la aplicación de este, su primer credikiva, comprará mercancías sobre pedidos que han hecho sus clientes, como accesorios femeninos, perfumería cremas y maquillajes, que venderá en su natal Puerto Colombia, donde es muy reconocida por los habitantes de este maravilloso lugar en el Caribe Colombiano.
texts.en:
Denis, 39, lives in Puerto Colombia with her two children whose ages are 18 and 2.  There in this land of beach, breeze and sea with important tourism potential she sells merchandise via specialized catalogues to earn income to support her two children.  Colognes, perfume, creams and make-up are her customers’ favorite items and Denis is very watchful of special offers in her catalogues in order to capture interest, attention and purchases. Her goal for later if she had enough working capital to make the purchase is to open a sales point or variety store to add a variety of products her neighbors buy in other places selling them to them herself.

She started her business a year ago because she was unable to find employment so decided to start her own business venture.  She currently has an average profit margin of 17% and her inventory turns over in 12 days.  With this she will be buying products like women’s accessories, perfumery, creams and make-up to her customers have already preordered and that she’ll sell in her native Puerto Colombia where she’s very well-known by residents of this wonderful place on the Colombian Caribbean.

loans.use: to buy women's accessories, perfumery, creams and make-up.

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es: Mercedes con su preVio credikiva compró telas y accesorios varios para producir prendas de vestir y disfraces, especialmente para niños, con los que le fue muy bien. Ahora se prepara para una nueva temporada, en la cual necesita pagar mano de obra y comprar telas porque tiene encargos a los cuales responder  para continuar generando ingresos suficientes para su bienestar y el de su familia. Su mensaje a los financiadores de Kiva es el siguiente: “Agradezco la ayuda recibida y ruego a Dios que los colme de bendiciones a ustedes y a sus familiares. “
texts.en: Mercedes used her previous Kiva loan to buy fabric and various accessories to make clothing and costumes, especially for children; she did very well with them.  Now, she’s preparing for a new season and she needs to both pay labor costs and to buy fabric because she has pending orders she must respond to in order to continue generating income sufficient for her and her family’s wellbeing.  Her message to Kiva lenders is the following: “I am very grateful for the support received and I pray to God that He’ll shower blessings on you and your families.”

loans.use: to buy fabric in larger amounts.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy bread, tomatoes, ham and meats.

loans.name: Fidel

texts.es:
Fidel es casado y tiene dos hijos que son mayores de edad, independientes, vive en casa        propia ocupando cinco habitaciones con paredes de ladrillo y revocado con estuco y el piso es de tablones, la casa se encuentra ubicada en la zona Tembladerani de la ciudad de La Paz.
Actualmente trabaja como sastre, elaborando trajes para caballeros, además realiza las composturas de todo tipo de ropa en un pequeño taller que cuenta de sastrería en la misma casa, es la única actividad que tiene y por lo tanto el único ingreso, el colabora con el pago de servicios básicos de su familia.
El crédito lo requiere para la compra de más materia prima (tela, hilos, forros) y así poder aumentar el volumen de su trabajo y  poder mejorar sus ingresos.
El sueño de Fidel es poder adquirir un ambiente de sastrería más en la ciudad de El Alto y poder tener empleados y ayudar en trabajo a otras personas y mejorar su calidad de vida.
Es la cuarta vez que solicita crédito junto a  KIVA y la séptima con IMPRO.
texts.en:
Fidel is married and has 2 grown children who are independent.  He lives in his own home, occupying 5 rooms.  The home has brick walls plastered with stucco, and the floor is made from wood planks.  This house is located in the Tembladerani neighborhood of the city of La Paz.

Fidel currently works as a tailor, making suits for men.  He also makes repairs to all types of clothing in a small tailoring workshop that is set up in his own house.  This is his only business, and so it is his only source of income.  He contributes toward the payment for basic services for his family.

Fidel needs a loan to buy more raw materials, (fabric, thread, linings), so that he can increase his work volume and increase his income.

Fidel's dream is to be able to buy another tailoring shop in the city of El Alto, where he could have employees and thereby help other people to find work, and also improve his quality of life.

This is the 4th time that he has requested a loan with Kiva, and his 7th loan with IMPRO.

loans.use: to buy fabric, thread, and lining material for his tailoring business

loans.name: Jose Leonidas

texts.es:
Jose, tiene 47 años, vive con su esposa y seis hijos, tienen casa propia y él se dedica al trabajo en agricultura para poder mantener el hogar, aprendió desde muy pequeño esta labor junto a sus padres ya que también trabajan en agricultura.

Solicita un préstamo para poderse comprar ocho sacos de abono, este materiales es el que utilizará en la siembra que actualmente realiza, ya que podrá mejorar la producción de granos básicos y también los ingresos.

Su aspiración es mejorar la economía de su hogar a través de su trabajo, dándole a sus hijos una mejor condición de vida.
texts.en:
Jose, 47, lives with his wife and his 6 children.  They have their own home.  Jose is a farmer who works to support his household.  He learned how to farm by working with his parents from the time that he was very young, as his parents are also farmers.

Jose is requesting a loan to buy 8 sacks of organic fertilizer.  He will use these supplies on the crops that he is currently cultivating, so that he can increase his production of staple grains and thereby increase his income.

Jose's aspiration is to improve his household finances through his work, providing his children with better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy 8 sacks of organic fertilizer

loans.name: Furkat

texts.ru: Фуркату 28  лет, женат и на воспитании имеет 1 несовершеннолетнего ребенка. Более 11 лет он занимается выращиванием сельхоз культуры, как картофель, лук, морковь и т.п.Он научился от отца земледелием и очень доволен тем, что он занимается земледелием. Полученный доход он продает на рынке. Так как у него высококачественный урожай, так и его товары имеют большой спрос. Его жена помогает ему в ведении бизнеса. Он хочет развевать свой бизнес, но не имеет достаточного средства. Он запрашивает займ на сумму  10000 сомони, чтобы купить минеральные удобрения и семена. Он нуждается и ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Furkat is 28 years old, married and has 1 young child. For over 11 years, he has been growing crops such as potatoes, onions, carrots, and so on. He learned how to farm from his father and is very happy to be a farmer himself now. Furkat sells his harvest at the market and, because his produce is of good quality, there is a high demand for it. His wife helps him in his business. Furkat wants to develop his business, but does not have the means to do so. Furkat is seeking a loan of 10,000 Tajikistan Somoni to buy mineral fertilizers and seeds. He needs and hopes for your assistance.

loans.use: to purchase seed and fertilizer

loans.name: Marisa

texts.es: La socia Marisa nació en la ciudad del Cusco y vive en la misma ciudad donde nació, ella tiene 48 años de edad y es divorciada pero tiene dos hijos. La socia Marisa es profesora y trabaja en uno de los colegios de la ciudad del Cusco pero también se dedica al alquilar de carros. Ya son varios años que se que se dedica ha  alquilar carros  y le va muy bien. Ella en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para hacer mantenimiento de los carros. La socia Marisa pertenece al banco comunal “Los Andes” de la Asociación Arariwa de la ciudad del Cusco.
texts.en: Marisa was born in the city of Cusco and lives in the city where she was born.  She is 48 years old and divorced, but she has two children.  Marisa is a teacher and works in one of the schools in the city of Cusco, but she also rents out cars.  It has been several years since she began renting cars out, and it has been a very good job for her.  She is currently in need of a loan to make repairs to her cars.  Marisa is a member of the community bank “Los Andes” in the Asociación Arariwa in the city of Cusco.

loans.use: to do maintenance work on cars.

loans.name: Malkhaz

texts.en:
Malkhaz is from a small village of Tskaltubo district. He is 29 years old and lives with his wife and child. 

The family earns its living through an agricultural business. In particular, Malkhaz has four milk cows and uses their milk for cheese production. Besides, they have bee hives with bee colonies and two greenhouses, where different kinds of greens, tomatoes, and cucumbers are grown. 

Malkhaz sells his agricultural production, cheese, and honey at the local open market. He is a hard-working young man, with a great desire to get ahead.

Malkhaz requested the credit for renovation of the greenhouse. He has to change the polyethylene cover, as well as fix the wooden construction. When the greenhouse is renovated, it will keep the needed temperature, and the family will harvest more products. It will increase their income from sales. 

Malkhaz plans to use the increased income for expanding his agricultural business and improving the living conditions for the family

loans.use: to renovate his greenhouse.

loans.name: Abena

texts.en:
Abena  is a fishmonger, and she also sells cassava at Asafora near Cape Coast.   In front of her is the cassava she sells. She has been into this business for the past five years now. She is married to a driver and has six children.  Abena  uses her income to assist her husband in providing for their family. 

She will use her loan to purchase more fresh fish to fry and cassava for sale. With the new profit, Abena will expand her business.

loans.use: purchase more fresh fish to fry and cassava for sale.

loans.name: Alejandro

texts.es: El socio Alejandro nació en la ciudad de Ayacucho pero vive en la ciudad del Cusco, él tiene 62 años de edad y es casado y fruto de esta hermosa relación tiene dos hijos. El socio Alejandro tiene una pequeña tienda de abarrotes en su domicilio donde vende diferentes productos de primera necesidad como por ejemplo arroz, azúcar, fideos, panes, tarros de leche, refrescos , gaseosas, detergentes y otras cosas más, él en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar comestibles como por ejemplo sacos de azúcar y sacos de arroz pues le conviene comprar en sacos. Ya son varios años que se dedica al negocio y le va muy bien. El socio Alejandro pertenece al banco comunal “Los Andes” de la Asociación Arariwa de la ciudad del Cusco.
texts.en: Alejandro was born in the city of Ayacucho but now lives in the city of Cusco.  He is 62 years old and married, and the fruits of this beautiful relationship include his two children.  Alejandro has a small grocery store in his home where he sells different staple products, such as rice, sugar, noodles, breads, containers of milk, juice drinks, sodas, detergents, and much more.  He currently is in need of a loan to buy consumer goods, for example sacks of sugar and rice, since it is more convenient to buy in bulk.  It has been several years since he began this business and it has been going well.  Alejandro is a member of the community bank “Los Andes” in the Asociación Arariwa in the city of Cusco.

loans.use: to buy sacks of sugar and rice.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more eggs and groceries for resale.

loans.name: Hatice

texts.es:
Hatice esta soltera, vive en casa propia y no tiene hijos; ocupa dos habitaciones con paredes de acabado de ladrillo y piso de tierra, la casa esta ubicada en la zona de Tacagua de la ciudad de La Paz.

Hatice trabaja como enfermera en una de las  cajas de salud por más de diez horas al día; con lo poco que gana debe cubrir los gastos de alimentación y pago de servicios básicos de su casa

El crédito requiere para pagar sus estudios de maestría en investigación científica ya que por la actividad que tiene necesita capacitarse más.

El sueño es poder tener su propio consultorio para poder mejorar sus ingresos y tener un futuro más prometedor.
texts.en:
Hatice is single and has no children.  She lives in her own home, occupying 2 rooms with walls made of brick and an earthen floor.  Her house is located in the Tacagua neighborhood of the city of La Paz.

Hatice works as a nurse in a health center for more than 10 hours a day.  With the little she earns, she must cover the food expenses and utility bills for her house.

Hatice needs to pay for her Master's degree in Scientific Research, because she needs further training for her job.  

Hatice's dream is to be able to have her own practice so that she could increase her income and have a more promising future.

loans.use: to pay for her Master's degree in Scientific Research, so that she can increase her earnings as a nurse

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en:
Ekua cultivates and harvests cassava for sale at  Asafora  near Cape Coast.  Efua has been selling cassava for three years now.  She uses her income to assist her husband in paying their children’s school fees.  

Efua will use her loan to cultivate a variety of foodstuffs to sell. With the new profit she will expand her business.

loans.use: To cultivate a variety of foodstuffs to sell.

loans.name: Adwowa

texts.en:
Adwowa produces kenkey for sale at Asafora near Cape Coast. In front of her is the dough she uses  in kenkey production.  Adwowa has done this business for 15 years. She is married with four children.  She uses her income to assist her husband in paying their accommodation bills.  

Adwowa  will use her loan to purchase bags of maize for her kenkey production.  With the new profit, Adwowa plans to expand her business.

loans.use: Tp purchase bags of maize for her kenkey production.

loans.name: Bernardino

texts.es: El socio Bernardino nació en la ciudad de Cusco y  vive en la misma ciudad donde nació, él tiene 68 años de edad y es casado y fruto de esta hermosa relación tiene seis hijos. El socio Bernardino es profesor de futbol y tiene un pequeña escuela de futbol, él en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar materiales de trabajo como por ejemplo pelotas, camisetas y otras cosas más. Ya son varios años que se dedica al negocio y le va muy bien. El socio Bernardino pertenece al banco comunal “Los Andes” de la Asociación Arariwa de la ciudad del Cusco.
texts.en: Bernardino was born in the city of Cusco and lives in that same city where he was born.  He is 68 years old and married, and has six children thanks to that relationship.  Bernardino is a soccer coach and runs a small soccer school.  He currently needs a loan to buy materials for his work, such as soccer balls, shirts, and other items.  It has been several years since he started his business and things are going well for him.  Bernardino is a member of the community bank “Los Andes” of the Asociación Arariwa in the city of Cusco.

loans.use: to buy materials for his work, such as balls, t-shirts, and other items.

loans.name: Ikhtier

texts.ru: Дом, где живет  Ихтиер,  не отвечает стандартам жилья и он срочно должен отремонтировать свой дом. Ему 29  лет, он женат и на воспитании имеет 1 4 летнего ребенка. Более 10 лет он занимается фермерством. В основном он выращивает помидор, пшеницу и лук. Его жена помогает в ведении бизнеса. Ихтиер должен отремонтировать дом, но его доход от выращивания сельхоз культур не достаточно для этого. Он запрашивает займ на сумму 5000  сомони для покупки строительных материалов для ремонта дома. Он ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: The house, where Ikhtier lives, does not comply with the living standards, and he has to promptly repair his house.  He is 29 years old, married and raising one 4 year-old child.  Ikhtier has been involved in farming for over ten years.  He primarily grows tomatoes, wheat and onions.  His wife helps him with running the business.  Ikhtier must repair his house, but his income from growing agricultural crops is not enough for this.  He is requesting a loan in the amount of 5000 somoni to purchase construction materials to repair his house.  He awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials to repair his house

loans.name: Esi

texts.en:
Esi  sells raw rice and soap at Asafora near Cape Coast. She is a single parent with four children.  As a single parent, she uses her income to feed and clothe her children and pay their school fees.  

Ama needs a loan from Kiva to enable her to buy bags of rice and boxes of soap to sell.  With the new profit, she will expand her business

loans.use: To buy bags of rice and boxes of soap to sell.

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites is a 29-year-old married woman with two children, ages six years and one year.  She has been in the business for almost one year.

She sells rice cake, ice candy, fruit juice, and siakoy, a snack food made with flour, sugar, and margarine.  She is requesting a loan of PHP 5,000  to buy additional ingredients for her food-vending business, like flour, sugar, and fruit-flavored juices like mango, pineapple, and orange.

In the future, Marites would like to expand her business to support her family and at the same time to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy sugar, flour, and fruit juice.

loans.name: Abdugafor

texts.ru: Абдугафор родился 1982 году. Он женат. Жена Абдугафора домохозяйка. Абдугафор работает таксистом. Образование у него средне - специальное, он шафер. Абдугафор занимается развозкой пассажиров на своем автомобиле. В этой области он три года. Абдугафор берет кредит для приобретения нового автомобиля, а имеющуюся автомашину он хочет отдать младшему брату, чтобы он начал свою деятельность.
texts.en: Abdugafor was born in 1982. He is married and his wife is a homemaker. Abdugafor is a taxi driver. His secondary education makes him a chauffeur by trade. Abdugafor has driven customers in his own car for three years now. Abdugafor would like a loan to purchase a new automobile. He wants to give his old car to his brother so he can start his own business.

loans.use: to purchase a new automobile

loans.name: Sayora

texts.ru: Трудное условие жизни заставляет человека направлять все свои усилия и мотивировать существующие ресурсы. Сайёра является одним из таких личностей, которая старается улучшить условия жизни и стимулировать экономическое состояние семьи. Она замужем и на воспитании имеет 4 детей. Ее муж занимается земледелием и получает маленький доход. Этот доход не хватает для обеспечения семьи со всеми необходимыми средствами.    Сайёра решила помочь мужу для благо получения семьи. С такой целью она обучилась в курсе «Добейся успеха» организованный Ассоциация Деловых Женщин и получила сертификат. Теперь она вполне может организовать свой бизнес и стать успешной в этой сфере. Она хочет организовать бизнес животноводством, так как имеет опыт в этом виде бизнеса. От полученного дохода она планирует обеспечить своих детей с хорошим образованием и высококалорийными продуктами питания. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 8500 сомони для покупки скота, чтобы организовать новый бизнес. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Difficult living conditions force a person to direct all of her efforts and motivate existing resources.  Sayora is one of these personalities, who tries to improve living conditions and stimulate the economic well being of the family.  She is married and raising four children.  Her husband is involved in farming and earns a small income.  This income is not enough to provide the family with all of the necessities.  Sayora decided to help her husband for the family's welfare.  With this goal in mind, she completed the "Achieve Success" course, organized by the Association of Business Women, and obtained a certificate.  Now, she is able to start her business and become successful at it.  She wants to organize an animal husbandry business because she has experience in this type of business.  She plans to use the resulting income to provide her children with a good education and high-calorie food products.  Sayora is requesting a loan in the amount of 8500 somoni to buy livestock and start her business.  She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to buy livestock and start her business

loans.name: Elsa Teodocia

texts.es: La socia Elsa nació en la ciudad del Cusco y vive en la misma ciudad donde nació, ella tiene 38 años de edad y tiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene dos hijos. La socia Elsa se dedica a la lavandería en su domicilio, ella lava ropas y manteles de los hoteles y restaurantes, ella también se dedica a brindar servicio de enfermería de forma eventual en algunas clínicas de la ciudad del Cusco. Ya son varios años que se dedica a la lavandería y le va muy bien. Ella en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar una lavadora. La socia Elsa pertenece al banco comunal “Los Andes” de la Asociación Arariwa de la ciudad del Cusco.
texts.en:
The member, Elsa, lives in the city of Cusco, where she was born.  She's 38 years old and has a common-law relationship from which she has two children.

Elsa makes a living washing clothes in her home.  She washes clothing and tablecloths for hotels and restaurants.  She also provides nursing services on an occasional basis in some clinics in the city of Cusco.  She has made a living washing for several years and it's going very well for her.

She needs this loan to buy a washing machine.

Elsa belongs to Los Andes Communal Bank of Asociación Arariwa in the city of Cusco.

loans.use: to buy a washing machine

loans.name: Concepcion Mercedes

texts.es:
Concepción, administra una tienda de productos del hogar, está divorciada y tiene dos hijos, ella inició el negocio para poder tener una fuente de ingresos que le permitiera llevar el sustento su familia y cubrir todas las necesidades más básicas.

Ella quiere invertir en nuevos productos para diversificar la tienda, por eso está solicitando un préstamo el cual utilizara para la compra de productos de uso personal, arroz, embutidos, gaseosas, esto le ayudará a tener más inventario de sus clientes mantengan la preferencia, aumentandole así sus ganancias.

Su objetivo es mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia y poder continuar trabajando en el negocio haciéndolo cada vez más rentable.
texts.en:
Concepción runs a household products store.  She's married and has two children.  She started the business to be able to have a source of income to support her family and cover all the most basic necessities.

She wants to invest in new products to diversify the store, so she's requesting a loan to buy personal care products, rice, cold cuts, and soda.  This will allow her to have more inventory and be her customers' preference, and so increase her profits.

Her goal is to improve her family's quality of life and be able to continue working in her business, making it more profitable all the time.

loans.use: to buy personal care products, rice, cold cuts, and soda

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Ama lives with her husband and children in Asafora, near Cape Coast. She cultivates and harvests maize to sell.

Ama has been selling maize for three years now.  She uses her income to assist her husband with paying their childrens' school fees.

Ama will uses her loan to hire laborers, which will enable her to cultivate more maize to sell. With the new profit, she will expand her business.

loans.use: to hire laborers to enable her to cultivate more maize to sell.

loans.name: Minerva Del Carmen

texts.es: En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, quinto financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con los que ha adquirido activos fijos, y ha logrado ampliar su capital de trabajo y así mismo su clientela fortaleciendo su negocio; Hoy invertirá su credikiva en materiales e insumos, para elaborar postres y ponqués y comprará también cosméticos, que le han encargado en su preventa. Su meta más adelante es continuar adquiriendo nuevos equipos de trabajo y continuar apoyando a su familia en su bienestar y para eso trabaja permanentemente en su negocio con el fin de conseguir su propósito. Ella da las gracias a sus  financiadores de Kiva   por el servicio prestado a bajo costo, pues le ha servido su crédito para que sus utilidades sean más altas.
texts.en: She is currently applying for a micro-loan (credikiva), her fifth loan investment from the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, with which she has acquired a set of stable assets and has been able to increase her working capital and also her customer base, strengthening her business.  She now wants to invest her micro-loan in materials and comestibles for making pastries and cakes and she will also buy cosmetics which people have already ordered from her.  Her goal for the future is to continue acquiring new work equipment and continue to support her family and their well-being, as for this she works always in her business with the intention of achieving her goal.  She thanks the lenders at Kiva for their work in providing low cost loans, as these loans have served to make better profits for her.

loans.use: to invest in materials and foodstuffs to make pastries and cakes and to also buy cosmetics.

loans.name: Duaa

texts.en: Duaa, a 20-year-old single lady, is the oldest girl out of 5 siblings. Duaa is a second year university student studying to be a nurse, and she would like to take out an educational loan to pay for her upcoming semester fees.

loans.use: to pay for her upcoming semester fees.

loans.name: Ruqiya

texts.ru:
Рукия жительница района Дж. Руми. Ей 42 года. Она разведена. У нее трое детей. Рукия имеет среднее образование. Она вместе с сыном занимается торговлей. Рукия в третий раз берет заем в нашей организации. Она уже два года сотрудничает с Хумо. 
В начале 2011 года Рукия получив первый заем начала свою деятельность. На сегодняшний день она арендует небольшую торговую точку, где продает теплые носки и подгузники. Рукия намерена расширить свою деятельность, хоть и не сразу. Рукия планирует увеличить оборот и в будущем она хочет открыть собственный магазин.
texts.en: Ruqiya is a resident of the J.Rumy district.  She is 42 years old, divorced and has three children.  Ruqiya has a secondary education.  She and her son are involved in sales.  This is her third time obtaining a loan from our organization.  She has been partnering with Humo for two years.  Ruqiya obtained her first loan at the beginning of 2011 and started her business.  Today, she leases a small retail outlet, where she sells warm socks and diapers.  Ruqiya intends to expand her business, although not all at once.  She plans to increase her goods turnover and open her own store in the future.

loans.use: to purchase children's clothing

loans.name: Ehsonjon

texts.ru: Эхсончону 44 года. Он женат на прекрасной женщине, которую зовут Нуринисо и на воспитании имеет 2 детей. Он работает в Министерстве Внутренних Дел. В свободное время читает медицинские книги. Он считает, что здоровье самое главное и поэтому посоветовал старшему сыну поступить в Медицинский Университет Таджикистана. Его сын является студентом 1 курса, а у Эхсончона нет денег, чтобы оплатить за учебу сына. Он запрашивает займ для оплаты учебы сына в университете. Он ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Ehsonjon is 44 years old.  He is married to a beautiful woman, whose name is Nuriniso, and raising two children.  He works at the Ministry of Internal Affairs.  He reads medical books in his free time.  Ehsonjon thinks that health is most important and this is why advised his oldest son to go to the Tajikistan Medical University.  His son is the first-year student, but Ehsonjon does not have money to pay for his education.  He is requesting this loan to pay for his son's education at the university.  He awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to pay for his son's education at the university

loans.name: Nelly Florencia

texts.es: La socia Florencia nació en la ciudad de la Quillabamba pero vive en la ciudad del Cusco, ella tiene 57 años de edad y es casada y de esta hermosa relación tiene cinco hijos. La socia Florencia se dedica a la venta de vinos y piscos, ella compra mercadería de la ciudad de Ica. Ya son varios años que se que se dedica al negocio. Ella en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar vinos y piscos. La socia Florencia pertenece al banco comunal “Los Andes” de la Asociación Arariwa de la ciudad del Cusco.
texts.en:
The member, Florencia, was born in the city of Quillabamba but lives in Cusco.  She's 57 years old and married, with five children from this beautiful relationship.

Florencia makes a living selling wine and pisco.  She buys merchandise in the city of Ica.  She has made a living in this business for several years now.

She needs this loan to buy wine and pisco.  She belongs to Los Andes Communal Bank of Asociación Arariwa in the city of Cusco.

loans.use: to buy wine and pisco

loans.name: Willy

texts.es:
El señor Willy, vive con su conyugue; no tiene hijos. La casa donde viven es alquilada, ocupando dos habitaciones con paredes de ladrillo y acabado de piso es de tierra, él trabaja como empleado en una Vidriaría en la zona de Villa Dolores de la Ciudad de El Alto.

Willy, trabaja más de ocho horas al día en una vidriería, ya que el cubre los gastos de servicios básicos, alimentación y pago de alquiler.

El crédito lo requiere para la compra de una maquina ralladora de vidrios con la que podrá cortar y entregar vidrios para ventanas en forma particular y convertirse en micro empresario.

El sueño de Willy es convertirse en un microempresario, abrir su propia vidriaría, es por eso que requiere el créditos para comprar la maquina y así incrementar sus ingresos para mejorar la calidad de vida de su hogar.

La cliente se encuentra muy satisfecho con los créditos que se le otorgaron anteriormente por eso es sexta vez con IMPRO y la tercera con KIVA.
texts.en:
Willy lives with his wife; he does not have children.  He rents the house where they live, and they occupy two rooms with brick walls and dirt floors.  He is employed at a glass business in the Villa Dolores area of the city of El Alto.

Willy works over eight hours a day at a glass business because he covers expenses for basic services, food, and rent.

He needs the loan to buy a glass cutting machine with which he will be able to cut and deliver windows sized to order and become a small businessman.

Willy’s dream is to become a small businessman and to open his own glass shop.  That is why he needs the loan to buy the machine.  This way he will increase his income in order to improve the quality of life for his household.

He is very satisfied with the previous loans he received.  This is his sixth loan with IMPRO and his third with Kiva.

loans.use: to buy a glass cutting machine to cut glass for windows and doors and to tend to his customers' orders.

loans.name: Gulchehra

texts.ru: Гульчехра жительница города Душанбе. Ей 61 год. Она замужем. Гульчехра занимается шитьем, она портниха. Шитьем Гульчехра занимается 14 лет. В этой области она имеет богатый опыт. Гульчехра работает в ателье. Она берет кредит для приобретения швейной машинки, чтобы в свободное время заняться шитьем у себя дома (чтобы продолжить работу дома).
texts.en: Gulchehra is a resident of the city of Dushanbe.  She is 61 years old, married.  Gulchehra is involved in sewing; she is a seamstress.  She has been involved in sewing for 14 years.  She has a rich experience in this area.  Gulchehra works at an atelier.  She is requesting this loan to purchase a sewing machine in order to sew at home in her free time (to continue working at home).

loans.use: to purchase a sewing machine in order to sew at home in her free time

loans.name: Hamida

texts.ru: Хамида родилась 1963 году. Она проживает в районе Рудаки. Хамида замужем. Она имеет среднее образование. Хамида два года как занимается животноводством. Она разводит мелко – рогатый скот у себя дома. Кредит берет для закупа овец с целью увеличения поголовья.
texts.en: Hamida was born in 1963.  She lives in the Rudaki district.  She is married.  Hamida has a secondary education.  She has been involved in animal husbandry for two years.  She breeds small livestock at home.  Hamida is requesting this loan to buy sheep in order to increase the headcount.

loans.use: to buy sheep in order to increase the headcount

loans.name: Ekua
